story:
THE INSPIRATION

As a Catholic writer with a life long commitment to justice, SISTERS has become the project of my life. My aunts Sisters Serena and Anna Marie Branson DC greatly influenced me. SISTERS is their story. To learn more about about me, my work, and my writing, please see my profile.       

                                                                                                   

 Sister Anna Marie stands between me
and my sister Sheila at Bethany Beach,
DE in 1972, in a rare visit to see her
family in the states.

MY AUNTS' STORIES

 SISTERS will explore the influences of family and faith that shaped these two legendary holy women, the spirituality that informed them, their influences upon each other, and their remarkable work's impact.

The Branson family circa 1920. Serena
is on the left. Anna Marie on the far
right.

The pragmatic Serena was a prodigious fundraiser, charming yet determined advocate for poor persons, and a social services pioneer. She’s best known as the Executive Director of Catholic Charities of Albany, the first woman in the United States to serve in that role. To learn more about Serena, click here.


 

The Branson family in 1979, during Anna Marie's last visit home.
My beautiful mother Ellen, the youngest in her family holds forth. 
Anna Marie is on the left, and Serena on the right.

Anna Marie was more idealistic than her big sister. A mystic, she’s best known as a missionary, who ignored her own failing health, to serve Bolivia’s indigenous poor.  Many people consider Anna Marie a saint. I hope SISTERS advances her cause. You can read more about Anna Marie here.

Serena with her family in 2001 in
her final visit to Washington. We're
at my cousin Theresa's (left) home.
I'm behind Serena.


Readers will accompany Anna Marie, among other places, as she administers a hospital for the mentally ill in Baltimore and cares for Bolivia’s street children. That ministry Amanecer (Dawn) flourishes to this day.You can read about their work here.

      

Anna Marie awards prizes after a nurses'
field day in Bolivia.

Readers will follow Serena to New York, among other places, as she begins the Kennedy Institute, the first resident treatment program for exceptional children in the United States. They’ll be with Serena in Albany as she starts a program for babies born with HIV and addicted to crack cocaine.  

Serena receives Catholic Charities USA's Vision Award
from Bishop Howard Hubbard in 2002. It's the highest
honor Catholic Charities USA bestows.


VISION AND IMPACT

As I perpetuate the legacies of women dear to me, I hope to uphold role models of Christian witness Pope Francis has called us to be: a church that's poor, that stands with poor persons and encounters persons on the peripheries. 

I hope moreover through telling the stories of these good, extraordinary women, to broadcast a vision of a society that promotes God's reign of peace and justice. I hope finally these remarkable women's lives will inspire others to become better Christians and persons who want "to do the good that's presented us," in the words of St. Vincent de Paul, founder of the Daughters of Charity.

    

The sisters during Serena's visit to Anna Marie in Bolivia in 1981. This was the last meaningful time they would spend together. Anna Marie died a few months later.

THE SUPPORT I NEED AND THE SUPPORT I HAVE

To inspire others to become better Christians and persons and promote a more peaceful and just society, I need your help. I hope to raise $5,000 to help with documents' translation and my travel to conduct research and interviews, including trips to Bolivia and Albany.

The Daughters of Charity St. Louise Province's generous gift of $15,000 has supported my research thus far. I’ve also received some help from some private donors, especially Lady of Charity Mary Beth O'Brien.

I'm also grateful to Gail Prensky and her videographer Mark Haney for producing my site's promotional video. You can learn more about Gail's work here. I'm also indebted to Eileen Callahan, who designed the book cover and the inspirational bookmarks below.

Featuring quotations from my aunts, they are among the perks you'll receive when you donate to my campaign. To find out more about Eileen's work, please contact eocallahan@comcast.net. Thanks also to  Rich Swietek for his invaluable marketing and editing advice. You can learn more about Rich's work here.


                                                                                 

The Daughters of Charity in the United States and South America have extensive networks, which will help me promote SISTERS. The Ladies of Charity, the Albany Diocese, and national Catholic Charities networks, which still regard Serena highly will also help market SISTERS.        
                                                                                                                            

                                                                                                                                                                                                                              

I hope the publications for which I’ve written will review the book, and I'll reach out to my wide network of social justice friends and colleagues to help spread the word about SISTERS.


I'll also reach out finally to school alumni networks, parishes and organizations affiliated with my family, including the Marine Band, which my Grandfather led.

CHALLENGES AND REWARDS

Telling one of my aunts' stories well sufficiently challenges me. However, aware of the unique prospective obstacles with which I must contend, trying to get both of their stories right especially daunts me.

Some people who knew this women well are also dead. Scarce correspondence exists between them, and their private writings largely don't exist. And translating Spanish documents related to Anna Marie's work will also challenge me. My aunts' spirits nonetheless live in the hearts and memories of many, and I trust those spirits will guide me all along the way.

                                                                                


Donors' support will keep me on track to publish SISTERS by 2017. And I hope I can count on you. How often do you get a chance to spread the legends of holy women?

story:
Since banding together in 2013, the Grue-Crew have been providing horror movie news and reviews with their network of podcasts ( Horror News Radio, Decades of Horror, and more) and online at GruesomeMagazine.com. Now, they are primed and ready to bring you the latest information on upcoming Indie Horror Films with a new quarterly magazine available in both print and digital versions, suitable for collecting. They need your help to get the first issues into your hands.

What will be in Gruesome Magazine – Print & Digital Editions

  • Dimensions: 6.63 inches X 10.25 inches (25.7 cm X 16.8 cm)
    [UPDATED] 8.5 inches x 11 inches (21.6 cm x 27.94 cm)
  • In the range of 80 – 110 pages for the first issue
  • Full color covers
  • Black & white interior pages
    [UPDATED] Full color interior pages for the print edition and the digital edition
  • Articles spotlighting upcoming Indie Horror Films currently making the rounds in horror film festivals across the globe
  • Interviews with Indie Horror Filmmakers
  • Information on Genre Films Festivals where you can catch the latest Indie Horror Films
  • And other Indie Horror related goodies

What They Need & What You Get

The Grue-Crew is looking for your help in raising $2,500 to help them get the first couple of issues into your hands. Below is a breakdown of where that money will go:

  • Indiegogo - 10%
  • Creating and shipping the perks - 25%
  • Creating magazine content (Paying writers, staff, contributors) - 30%
  • Purchasing promotions, advertising and convention space - 35%

So, what kind of cool swag can you get for helping out:

  • Signed Limited-edition copies of the first issue of Gruesome Magazine (target delivery: late Spring, 2017) (also available with a hand-drawn sketch cover by former Marvel Comics artist and Gruesome Magazine contributor Chad Hunt)
     


     

  • Gruesome Magazine Yearbook 2016 - signed  (target delivery: late Spring, 2017). Take a look back in horror at the year that was 2016. Find out the Grue-Crew's picks for Best Horror Films of 2016 and see if you agree or if there are any that you missed.
     


     

  • Gruesome Magazine T-shirts


     
  • Cool Gruesome Magazine Logo stickers and magnets

     

  • A must-have Gruesome Magazine stress ball



     

  • One-of-a-kind original artwork for Horror New Radio t-shirts - from Gruesome Magazine's own Chad Hunt



     

  • One-of-a-kind original artwork of iconic horror characters - from Gruesome Magazine's own Chad Hunt





     

A Gruesome History

  • In April of 2013, Doc Rotten and Thomas Mariani of the American Horror Story Fan Podcast and the Monster Movie Podcast teamed up with The Black Saint and Dave Dreher from HorrorNews.Net to form the Grue-Crew and to begin the weekly Horror News Radio Podcast, featuring the latest horror news and reviews.
     
  • Since then, they have expanded their podcast network to include the Hannibal Fan Podcast, Decades of Horror: 1970s, Decades of Horror: 1980s, Decades of Horror: 1990s, and the HNR Extra podcasts.
     
  • In October of 2015, the Grue-Crew joined with a large number of their friends and co-hosts to launch the online version of Gruesome Magazine. In the past 12 months, Gruesome Magazine’s international array of reviewers and correspondents have published over 1000 articles, reviews, podcasts, and contests.
     
  • Gruesome Magazine’s contributors have covered a whole slate of conventions and film festivals around the world to bring you the latest in horror movie news and reviews.

Risks & Challenges

  • Content: The Gruesome Magazine editorial staff has already lined up the writers (the Grue-Crew), has mapped out content for the first issue, and has already begun planning articles for the second issue due this Summer.
     
  • Printing: Lulu.com will be handling the printing of the physical copies as well as the distribution of the digital copies. With the print-on-demand model, the cost of fulfilling the print copies is fully covered by the perk levels.
     
  • Perks: Vendors have been procured for most of the other perks. They are still looking for a vendor for the stress balls and for some additional perks they would like to add.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone has spare cash on hand. If you want to help, but are temporarily short on funds, you can still help out by:

  • Telling your like-minded friends, family, and co-workers about Gruesome Magazine
  • Share this campaign on all your social media account.

In the past 12 months, Gruesome Magazine’s international array of reviewers and correspondents have published over 1000 articles, reviews, podcasts, and contests. 

Gruesome Magazine’s contributors have covered a whole slate of conventions and film festivals around the world to bring you the latest in horror movie news and reviews.

Printing: Lulu.com will be handling the printing of the physical copies as well as the distribution of the digital copies. With the print-on-demand model, the cost of fulfilling the print copies is fully covered by the perk levels. 

Perks: Vendors have been procured for most of the other perks. They are still looking for a vendor for the stress balls and for some additional perks they would like to add.
Other Ways You Can HelpWe understand that not everyone has spare cash on hand. If you want to help, but are temporarily short on funds, you can still help out by:
Telling your like-minded friends, family, and co-workers about Gruesome Magazine
Share this campaign on all your social media account.

story:
*All proceeds go to support the building of my startup, Terra Digital*

Story of My Book

Digital Storytelling: The Rise of Personal Narratives is a books that explores the intersection of personal narrative storytelling and business, politics, and culture.

How has the digital revolution led to a growth in user-generated stories? How do personal stories of everyday citizens get used to influence everything from the bottom line of tech corporations to policy change in Washington D.C.? How do those in power exploit personal narratives to create micro-realities and drive their own agendas?

My name is Karam Sethi and I am the author of Digital Storytelling: The Rise of Personal Narratives. I wrote this book because the tech-media sphere is changing rapidly. Our unprecedented interconnectedness has led to a growth in personal stories told across digital and social media. I'm on a journey to understand how that swell of content impacts everything around us. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover your digital presence is more powerful than you may think. Every like, comment, and share bears a degree of personal responsibility, and we have an opportunity to empower underrepresented populations with our digital engagement. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to help digital creators that align with your values and become more aware consumers.

The thesis of empowering socially-conscious creators with better storytelling tools is also the mission of my startup, Terra Digital. Follow Terra below:

Website: welcometerra.com
Twitter: twitter.com/video_terra
LinkedIn: linkedin.com/company/terra-digital-video

What I Need & What You'll Get

I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the cost of publication. Money raised will go towards:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.

The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book and a thank-you note.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

About the Author

Karam Singh Sethi is Co-Founder and Chief Executive Officer of Terra Digital, a video creation platform for mission-driven creatives. He is an award-winning writer and creative director.

His work focuses on documentary-style cross-platform digital storytelling for video, photography, motion, and copy. Prior to launching Terra, he led creative marketing campaigns for IBM Originals, IBM’s first in-house creative agency.


Facebook: @karam.sethi
Instagram: @hi_im_karam
LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/karamsinghsethi

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a memoir is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order.


I will also be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone, publishes, and is ready to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TerraDigital and tag me as well as my publisher.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of this page.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support! It’s been quite the journey to this point and I can’t wait to see what lies ahead.

story:
Story of My Book

Glory Writers

My name is Deanna Drogan and I am the author of Glory Writers. I wrote this book because there is so much amazing Christian content out there, whether it be books, blogs, or songs, but not many discuss the process and divine inspiration that goes into them.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover what it looks like to write an impactful Christian book and, more importantly, that you will learn the amazing ways that writing allows us to connect with the Lord. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for Christian writing in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you grow closer to the Lord through a powerful way of communication.

In this book, you'll learn about Christian writing through:
  • Several wise Christian authors who are experienced in the field and have amazing stories to tell and insight to share.
  • My own personal testimony and how God has used writing itself to communicate with me and change me in incredible ways.
  • The infallible Scriptures and things God has strongly put on my heart to share with you.
You will love this book if you love to write or simply have a passion for creativity.

Glory Writers is a non-fiction book that speaks to aspiring writers and content creators who are seeking to use their gifts and skills for the glory of God.

 

The Book - Glory Writers

The book is written in 3 Parts....

Part 1 contains the introduction + additional chapters. The readers will learn about shifting their mindsets to writing for the glory of God rather than their own fame as well as different ways to implement divine inspiration into their writing and create a clear pathway with no distractions to hear God best. They will also learn the power of vulnerability and how writing authentically has the power to change lives.

Part 2 contains Chapters 4-7. In these chapters the readers will learn about the power of words and the ways that writing can not only impact their audience but themselves as the writers. They will also learn about how to surrender and put themselves in a position to be used best by God. Lastly, they will learn how to combat attacks from the enemy and understand the victory they have in Christ.

Part 3 contains Chapters 8-10. These chapters delve into identity and understanding that identity does not come from success or a vocation, but from Jesus Christ Himself. The readers will also understand through this chapter that in being authors they are taking on a role of leadership with the unique opportunity to reach people on a higher platform.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2019
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.



I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now. You will receive:

  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Deanna Drogan is an alumna of Liberty University where she earned her bachelor's degree in Journalism and minor in Creative Writing. She has written for several online publications such as CharlotteFive, the Liberty Champion, Turning Point News, and the Odyssey Online.

Deanna has been passionate about writing ever since she was handed her very first hot pink and lime green composition notebook covered with pictures of her dog and favorite celebrities circa 2008. She believes that the Lord has blessed her with the gifts of creativity and wit to ultimately glorify Him through her work.

If you can't find Deanna typing something behind her computer, you most likely will find her sipping on a matcha latte, petting a nearby dog, or “attempting” to play the guitar.

For more information, you can connect with Deanna at Deedrogan@gmail.com and on Instagram at @Deedrogan or Twitter at @Deedrogan5.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #glorywriters and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Deanna Drogan
story_txt:
Story of My Book
Glory WritersMy name is Deanna Drogan and I am the author of Glory Writers. I wrote this book because there is so much amazing Christian content out there, whether it be books, blogs, or songs, but not many discuss the process and divine inspiration that goes into them.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover what it looks like to write an impactful Christian book and, more importantly, that you will learn the amazing ways that writing allows us to connect with the Lord. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for Christian writing in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you grow closer to the Lord through a powerful way of communication.In this book, you'll learn about Christian writing through:
Several wise Christian authors who are experienced in the field and have amazing stories to tell and insight to share.
My own personal testimony and how God has used writing itself to communicate with me and change me in incredible ways.
The infallible Scriptures and things God has strongly put on my heart to share with you.
 You will love this book if you love to write or simply have a passion for creativity.Glory Writers is a non-fiction book that speaks to aspiring writers and content creators who are seeking to use their gifts and skills for the glory of God. 
The Book - Glory WritersThe book is written in 3 Parts....Part 1 contains the introduction + additional chapters. The readers will learn about shifting their mindsets to writing for the glory of God rather than their own fame as well as different ways to implement divine inspiration into their writing and create a clear pathway with no distractions to hear God best. They will also learn the power of vulnerability and how writing authentically has the power to change lives.Part 2 contains Chapters 4-7. In these chapters the readers will learn about the power of words and the ways that writing can not only impact their audience but themselves as the writers. They will also learn about how to surrender and put themselves in a position to be used best by God. Lastly, they will learn how to combat attacks from the enemy and understand the victory they have in Christ.Part 3 contains Chapters 8-10. These chapters delve into identity and understanding that identity does not come from success or a vocation, but from Jesus Christ Himself. The readers will also understand through this chapter that in being authors they are taking on a role of leadership with the unique opportunity to reach people on a higher platform. 
What I Need & What You'll Get This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2019
The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now. You will receive:

A personally signed copy of my book when I publish
A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
And more...

story:
Parents know their children are special and our half panda, half unicorn main character is just as unique as they are. We believe a magical life––one that is fun, loving, connected, and enriching––is always within reach. Our mission is to entertain, educate, and empower children to live magical lives.

As a parent of three boys and after going through hardships of her own, author, Kathy V. Tran, learned that you’re capable of overcoming any obstacle in your path and is committed to passing this lesson on to those who read Kai's story.

Kathy successfully self-published her first book,”Kai Can Do!”, and needs help to bring to life the second book in the series.  The book is titled “Kai Panducorn and his Magical Bobo”.  The tale follows Kai on his first day of a school experiencing fear and anxiety.  He brings his security blanket, lovingly named “Bobo”, thinking it will ease his fear and help him adapt.  However, will his Bobo really help him or stop him from experiencing his new surroundings?  Kai will learn about compassion and not being scared from a new classmate with a rare disease.  He see the "magical" or positive side of things when a tough situation happen.  

As your children read the new book,” Kai Panducorn and his Magical Bobo”, they will be able to hold their very own Bobo.  We designed a real-life Kai Panducorn Bobo for your children to hug while reading the story, bringing the magic even more to life.

Whether you are a parent, grandparent, child, or babysitter, the colorful, whimsical illustrations will keep you turning the page and the new upcoming toys will entertain kids of all ages. 

This is where we need your help.  Funds raised will be used towards the cost of designing, developing, and producing the initial Kai Panducorn book series and products.  All other expenses included in this campaign cost are marketing, fulfillment, shipping, credit card processing fees, and Indiegogo fees.

In addition, although we won’t recoup all of our development costs, we have committed to giving back a portion of funds raised to our charity of choice in this campaign.  As our books and toys are embraced by children, Kai Panducorn will lead by example to be compassionate and give back to the children across our world.

With your support, we can bring more smiles to more children.

 

​

 

Kathy and Aiki were college sweethearts from the University of Texas at Austin, and they now share their love and their home with three incredible sons and an English Labrador retriever.  They are serial entrepreneurs with over 20 years of combined experience and a dozen past businesses. Owners and operators of restaurants, technology companies, consulting, construction, tapioca shop, and a beef jerky shop.  Ironically, after the beef jerky shop shut down, Aiki became a vegan and 7 time Ironman.

Kathy: Author & CMO, or Chief Magical Officer

Discovering a passion for art at a young age, Kathy immersed herself in comic strips throughout her childhood, picking up a pen and drawing as soon as she was able. Her favorite TV shows were always bright and colorful: Rainbow Brite, My Little Pony, and Care Bears. She dreamed of growing up to become an 80s pop star but instead pursued a career as an author and entrepreneur. A proud mother of three, she enjoys spending time with her loved ones, eating ice cream, and daydreaming about living in a castle. Her goal is to one day hold the largest children's business fair in the nation.  A one-day market place for children to learn to be entrepreneurs.

Aiki: Illustrator & Ninja

A deeply introspective and spiritual person, Aiki spends many of his waking hours meditating and caring for his bonsai. He is an artist to his core, and his favorite pastimes are drawing and journaling. Any time he gets an idea, he sets out to make the most of it––his creative juices flowing freely and his mind drifting away to a world in which nothing but creating matters. He stays active and fit by running, and to date, he has completed seven Ironman triathlons, 24 marathons, and four ultramarathons. His day job is in content creation, marketing, and branding, and he is constantly coming up with new ways to connect with others through his art.  

Havy: CFO, or Chief Fun Officer

Kathy, Aiki & Havy have known each other since college at the University of Texas. Havy immediately fell in love with the magical message and core values of Kai Panducorn. With her financial background as a CPA and CFO/controller, she and her husband, Bao, have multiple businesses in oil and gas, real estate, and a hair salon. However, their real passion is to leave a legacy behind for their two children, Lindsay and Joshua, and future generations to empower others and make an impact on the world. Havy and Lindsay are currently working on a Unicorn Cakes & Desserts Cookbook for Beginners which will be launched end of 2019/early 2020.

 

Kai Plushie Doll

Kai Wrist Plushie

Kai Bobo Blanket

2 in 1 Pillow & Blanket 

Sticker Pack

 

One of the core values for Kai Panducorn is compassion, and the best way for us to teach our children is to be the example they can follow. Compassionate hearts create magical moments. We selected Ronald McDonald House Charities of Greater Houston/Galveston ("RMHC") as our charity of choice for our Indiegogo campaign and a portion of our proceeds will be given to RMHC at the end of our campaign. RMHC provides vital resources and compassionate care to children and their families. As our stories are shared with children in the community, we can help RMHC serve those same children in the community with healthcare services. Please check out their website for more details https://www.rmhcghg.org

 

If you’re excited about helping kids and seeing Kai Panducorn reach more families, spread the word!

Sharing the campaign link on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, in texts to friends, emails, on your blog, literally anywhere––makes a huge difference. 

If you have questions about our rewards, how to pledge, how IndieGoGo works, or anything else, please contact us at kai@panducorn.com. You can also find us online on our website, and on Facebook and Instagram. 

You don’t want to miss out on the experience and memory of creating something magical.  

Thank you so much for your support. Spread the love, please!

Risk and Challenges:  Only if the world ends will you not get your stuff.  (Possible delay due to flooding in Houston) 

We have a Kai Can Do! attitude, though we also know life is full of surprises.  Some potential hurdles are delayed in shipping, not getting enough campaign backers, or becoming overwhelmed with too many backers.  

We've taken steps to eliminate possible risks and challenges and increase the chance of successfully delivering the rewards on time. All backers will receive communication from us along the way with updates about the process and any changes to the timeline.  The most significant risk we face in delivering on the promise of this campaign is a delay due to unexpected production obstacles, however, we are in constant communication with our production team and do not expect any delays.  

A note about shipping + customs for our international customers: We are happy to spread the love worldwide and ship to you. We try to keep shipping costs as low as possible for each country. Some countries do end up being expensive to ship to and we wish we could send your rewards via magic mail. Please note that shipping and duties costs are beyond our control and that all backers are responsible to pay any customs fees their country might charge. We wanted to give you a heads up because we'd hate for you to be surprised!

story:
I'm Tuatha. I'm a sheltie and a genius in consensus decisionmaking. For all time until recently, I lived in a hut in the woods with my parents, C.T. Butler and Wren Tuatha, and some goats.

Then I decided that "Occupy" would mean that we would live everywhere in a house on wheels, which Wren named Serenity, after a spaceship that falls apart a lot.

We drove my goats, Wicca and Niabi, to an Occupy called Indiana and left them there because they wouldn't like touring. I missed them right away. Now C.T. and Wren tell me that they died. We miss them more than ever.

You can learn more about Value-Based Consensus at http://www.consensus.net/ and follow our adventures at http://www.hippiechickdiaries.com/ .

We three are Fiopa Consensus Collective:

Food Not Bombs cofounder C.T. Butler is author of On Conflict and Consensus, Food Not Bombs: How to Feed the Hungry and Build Community and his new book, Consensus for Cities. He's a veteran of 30 years of activism and, in addition to Food Not Bombs, has been an organizer for the Pledge of Resistance, ACT UP, Coalition for Direct Action at Seabrook, New England War Tax Resistance and many more movements. He has taught consensus and facilitation workshops to intentional communities, activist groups, non-profits, worker collectives, food co-ops, indigenous tribes and more.

Here's Papa C.T. at work: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pJq5hf8ZnqE&...

Hippie Chick Diaries writer Wren Tuatha is a 17 year veteran of the intentional communities movement. She's been an alternative educator for 30 years. Her activism has included campaigning for the Equal Rights Amendment, GLBT rights, animal rights, no nukes and the Worthy Wage Campaign. She developed and directed the consensus-based Open Classroom homeschooling program at Heathcote Community.

Here's Mama Wren posting about me and my stroller: http://hippiechickdiaries.com/2012/04/17/discov...

Tuatha Guinan is and eleven year old sheltie to teaches Wren and C.T. everything about group dynamics through the mediums of ball games and puppy piles. He is convinced that squirrels are tools of the state that throw things at him. He believes the social divide between dogs and cats has gone beyond what simple conflict resolution techniques can fix. Most of his activism has centered around access for dogs in public places, known as the, "get to go, get to go!" campaign. When thunder happens, Tuatha becomes the super hero Dragon Boy by donning a costume with some assistance.

Since October of 2011, Fiopa has been touring America, offering workshops in consensus, facilitation, non-violence, intentional community, agenda planning, minutes taking, how to start a Food Not Bombs, etc., to Occupy groups. We held 6 weekend workshops and dozens of shorter teach-ins in 15 Occupy cities, including:

Baltimore, MD
Boston, MA
Philadelphia, PA
New York, NY
Chico, CA
San Francisco, CA
Berkeley, CA
Oakland, CA
Louisville, KY
Lexington, KY
Charleston, WV
York, PA

I teach Wren and C.T. and they teach others. I don't like the subway, even though I have a stroller, so I guard Serenity. Now we're taking our momentum to other groups. We continue to get requests from activists, communitarians and organizers for our deepened trainings in places are far flung as:

OWS/New York, NY
Philadelphia, PA
Denver, CO
Boulder, CO
Dallas/Ft. Worth, TX
Atlanta, GA
Louisville, KY
Seattle, WA
Asheville, NC
Orlando, FL

THAT'S A LOT OF MILES! WE MUST KEEP OUR HOME ON THE ROAD TO MAKE IT POSSIBLE!

Everyone attends meetings. Humans have the idea that they're a necessary evil. But we are teaching a form of direct democracy that eclipses voting, where all voices truly are heard, and the group learns how to handle dominating personalities while making decisions that have everyone's buy-in.

HELP US KEEP SPREADING THESE SKILLS!

What We're Asking and Offering

Our 1986 34-foot Fleetwood Bounder, "Serenity," is our home, office and transportation. It is a secure place where Mama can keep me safe and it makes our travels consistent, relaxing and possible. But it's an old truck and needs the following repairs to pass Maryland State Inspection, get registered and to be safe while we drive:

Update: Since we made this breakdown, we've learned from the inspectors that our total will actually be about $3400.

Any money donated will be applied toward RV repairs. If we exceed our goal, additional money will be held in reserve for future maintenence and repairs.

Perks:

Any donation you can make is greatly appreciated! $5 is $5! Here is what we are offering at specific giving levels:

• $25 A pewter dragon necklace, pewter frog necklace or a FNB t-shirt.

• $30 A pewter unicorn necklace, pewter Zuni fetish bear necklace or a batik blue fairy flag

• $35 A batik crystal dragon pennant

• $50 An autographed copy of On Conflict and Consensus. Keep it or gift it!

• $100 An autographed copy of On Conflict and Consensus and Consensus for Cities!

• $120 A string set of 6 batik cat goddess flags

• $250 Dinner with C.T. and Wren!

• $1000 A week on tour in Serenity!

OR

•Substitute any perk above for a guest post on Hippie Chick Diaries---What would you like to say to the HCD audience? Perhaps you or your pet have some ideas to share with the world!

Together We Are Making a Difference

Early in their adult lives, C.T. was a theater producer and Wren went to film school for screenwriting. And I was studying to be a couch tester. We diverted from our paths, not because we changed our desires, but because, through our activism, we learned that social technologies like Value-Based Consensus, creative conflict resolution, Non-Violent Communication, ZEGG Forum, etc., were the structural keys to changing the world. The visions of how to make things better are all great---Permaculture, natural building, dog parks, bike co-ops, community gardens, direct action, etc. But whether these social change strategies succeed or fail is determined by how we talk, listen to each other and how we create buy-in.

AND WE WANT THE GREAT IDEAS PEOPLE ARE COMING UP WITH TO SUCCEED!

So we must stay on the road, teaching these skills. These cooperative concepts not taught in schools or obedience classes. Can you help? We have the experience, and our pedagogy is blossoming in exciting ways. Will you help get us down the road?

I teach that the best use of consensus is to decide to take a nap, go for a walk, choose between fetch and soccer and to reward the dog with the last corner of your sandwich. But C.T. and Wren thought you'd want to know of these examples...

Success stories in Value-Based Consensus include:

•The Tulsa Symphony Orchestra. Solved a intractable union dispute by adopting C.T.'s model. Now the musicians are in management and they're getting great reviews.

•The Alaskan Native Health Board. Used C.T.'s model to dismantle the government's "divide and conquer" stragegy. Now they are in charge of their own health care system and hundreds of millions of their tax dollars have been returned to them for health care. This success story is being spread to other First Nations groups around the world.

•Grand Travers County Land Use and Transportation Study. The county around Travers City, Michigan used C.T.'s model to create a land use plan with massive citizen input and decisionmaking.

•ACT UP. C.T. facilitated a national conference call using consensus to design a way to equitably distribute $1.5M between 80 ACT UP local chapters.

•Feminist GA; Occupy Redux. Occupy activists in New York and Philadelphia are "recircling the wagons," organizing Value-Based Consensus affinity groups and calling for a reorganizing of the Occupy structure to create safer space and real accountability, so all voices can truly be heard!

Please contribute today and join us in this great work!

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can't contribute money today, but please spread the word about our Indiegogo campaign (Indiegogo share tools are the best way). If you've met us and been touched by our ideas, please make some noise for our campaign!

What groups are you involved in? Could your democratic process be better? Have you tried consensus but you're ready to dump it because it doesn't seem to work? Are you having problems with squirrels or infiltrators? Call us to talk about scheduling a workshop in your area, for your group and others.
fiopa@consensus.net 410-458-2310.

He has taught consensus and facilitation workshops to intentional communities, activist groups, non-profits, worker collectives, food co-ops, indigenous tribes and more.
Here's Papa C.T. at work: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pJq5hf8ZnqE&...
Hippie Chick Diaries writer Wren Tuatha is a 17 year veteran of the intentional communities movement. She's been an alternative educator for 30 years. Her activism has included campaigning for the Equal Rights Amendment, GLBT rights, animal rights, no nukes and the Worthy Wage Campaign. She developed and directed the consensus-based Open Classroom homeschooling program at Heathcote Community.
Here's Mama Wren posting about me and my stroller: http://hippiechickdiaries.com/2012/04/17/discov...
Tuatha Guinan is and eleven year old sheltie to teaches Wren and C.T. everything about group dynamics through the mediums of ball games and puppy piles. He is convinced that squirrels are tools of the state that throw things at him. He believes the social divide between dogs and cats has gone beyond what simple conflict resolution techniques can fix. Most of his activism has centered around access for dogs in public places, known as the, "get to go, get to go!" campaign. When thunder happens, Tuatha becomes the super hero Dragon Boy by donning a costume with some assistance.
Since October of 2011, Fiopa has been touring America, offering workshops in consensus, facilitation, non-violence, intentional community, agenda planning, minutes taking, how to start a Food Not Bombs, etc., to Occupy groups. We held 6 weekend workshops and dozens of shorter teach-ins in 15 Occupy cities, including:

Baltimore, MD Boston, MA Philadelphia, PA New York, NY Chico, CA San Francisco, CA Berkeley, CA Oakland, CA Louisville, KY Lexington, KY Charleston, WV York, PA

I teach Wren and C.T. and they teach others. I don't like the subway, even though I have a stroller, so I guard Serenity. Now we're taking our momentum to other groups. We continue to get requests from activists, communitarians and organizers for our deepened trainings in places are far flung as:

OWS/New York, NY Philadelphia, PA Denver, CO Boulder, CO Dallas/Ft. Worth, TX Atlanta, GA Louisville, KY Seattle, WA Asheville, NC Orlando, FL

THAT'S A LOT OF MILES! WE MUST KEEP OUR HOME ON THE ROAD TO MAKE IT POSSIBLE!
Everyone attends meetings. Humans have the idea that they're a necessary evil. But we are teaching a form of direct democracy that eclipses voting, where all voices truly are heard, and the group learns how to handle dominating personalities while making decisions that have everyone's buy-in.
HELP US KEEP SPREADING THESE SKILLS!
What We're Asking and Offering
Our 1986 34-foot Fleetwood Bounder, "Serenity," is our home, office and transportation. It is a secure place where Mama can keep me safe and it makes our travels consistent, relaxing and possible. But it's an old truck and needs the following repairs to pass Maryland State Inspection, get registered and to be safe while we drive:

Update: Since we made this breakdown, we've learned from the inspectors that our total will actually be about $3400.
Any money donated will be applied toward RV repairs. If we exceed our goal, additional money will be held in reserve for future maintenence and repairs.
Perks:
Any donation you can make is greatly appreciated! $5 is $5! Here is what we are offering at specific giving levels:
• $25 A pewter dragon necklace, pewter frog necklace or a FNB t-shirt.
• $30 A pewter unicorn necklace, pewter Zuni fetish bear necklace or a batik blue fairy flag
• $35 A batik crystal dragon pennant
• $50 An autographed copy of On Conflict and Consensus. Keep it or gift it!
• $100 An autographed copy of On Conflict and Consensus and Consensus for Cities!
• $120 A string set of 6 batik cat goddess flags
• $250 Dinner with C.T. and Wren!
• $1000 A week on tour in Serenity!
OR
•Substitute any perk above for a guest post on Hippie Chick Diaries---What would you like to say to the HCD audience? Perhaps you or your pet have some ideas to share with the world!
Together We Are Making a Difference
Early in their adult lives, C.T. was a theater producer and Wren went to film school for screenwriting. And I was studying to be a couch tester. We diverted from our paths, not because we changed our desires, but because, through our activism, we learned that social technologies like Value-Based Consensus, creative conflict resolution, Non-Violent Communication, ZEGG Forum, etc., were the structural keys to changing the world. The visions of how to make things better are all great---Permaculture, natural building, dog parks, bike co-ops, community gardens, direct action, etc. But whether these social change strategies succeed or fail is determined by how we talk, listen to each other and how we create buy-in.
AND WE WANT THE GREAT IDEAS PEOPLE ARE COMING UP WITH TO SUCCEED!
So we must stay on the road, teaching these skills. These cooperative concepts not taught in schools or obedience classes. Can you help? We have the experience, and our pedagogy is blossoming in exciting ways. Will you help get us down the road?
I teach that the best use of consensus is to decide to take a nap, go for a walk, choose between fetch and soccer and to reward the dog with the last corner of your sandwich. But C.T. and Wren thought you'd want to know of these examples...
Success stories in Value-Based Consensus include:
•The Tulsa Symphony Orchestra. Solved a intractable union dispute by adopting C.T.'s model. Now the musicians are in management and they're getting great reviews.
•The Alaskan Native Health Board. Used C.T.'s model to dismantle the government's "divide and conquer" stragegy. Now they are in charge of their own health care system and hundreds of millions of their tax dollars have been returned to them for health care. This success story is being spread to other First Nations groups around the world.
•Grand Travers County Land Use and Transportation Study. The county around Travers City, Michigan used C.T.'s model to create a land use plan with massive citizen input and decisionmaking.
•ACT UP. C.T. facilitated a national conference call using consensus to design a way to equitably distribute $1.5M between 80 ACT UP local chapters.
•Feminist GA; Occupy Redux. Occupy activists in New York and Philadelphia are "recircling the wagons," organizing Value-Based Consensus affinity groups and calling for a reorganizing of the Occupy structure to create safer space and real accountability, so all voices can truly be heard!
Please contribute today and join us in this great work!
Other Ways You Can Help
Maybe you can't contribute money today, but please spread the word about our Indiegogo campaign (Indiegogo share tools are the best way). If you've met us and been touched by our ideas, please make some noise for our campaign!
What groups are you involved in? Could your democratic process be better? Have you tried consensus but you're ready to dump it because it doesn't seem to work? Are you having problems with squirrels or infiltrators? Call us to talk about scheduling a workshop in your area, for your group and others. fiopa@consensus.net 410-458-2310.

story:
A couple months ago, I was appointed the designated driver for a group of friends of mine. As a young adult finally pursuing his career, I didn't wish to put my future in jeopardy. 

At roughly one in the morning, after dropping most of my friends off at home, it was time to get some rest. Leaving, I came to an "incomplete stop" at a stop sign. First off, this was far from true. It is my belief that the officer simply needed a reason to pull someone over at one in the morning. Secondly, other than the police officer, there were no other cars or civilians around for miles. No one would have been harmed, no damage was done.

I have always had a respect for police officers, and like I said, I didn't want to put my new career in jeopardy. Right off the bat, the officer was rude, disrespectful, and obviously new on the job (judging by how many times he screwed up the ticket). After being told he would get a warrant to search my car for no reason, I knew respect wasn't going to be in play. Knowing one of my friends in the vehicle had marijuana on them, I informed the officer before he made any rash decisions, handed it over, and politely waited in my car for the officer to go back to his vehicle, chock it up as nothing, and let me go. 

Let me tell you something about the marijuana laws in Vermont. Under an ounce, which is 28 grams, it is decriminalized. Which means, you get a small fine, and they send you on your way. Generally, police officers in Vermont avoid the fine entirely, and you proceed with your life.

My friend had one and a half grams on them. That is FIVE PERCENT of an ounce. For this five percent, I got the same ticket as if it were an ounce. 

I did my duty as a civilian by being the designated driver, and I respectfully handed over the five percent of the decriminalized amount of A PLANT to the officer. NOTE: THIS WAS NOT MY WEED. I WAS THE DESIGNATED DRIVER.

Is it right that I have to pay this fine? No. Especially since I hardly have the money to feed myself. 

So please, every penny counts. If you believe this was an injustice, please donate or share, and wish me luck I guess.

story:
Short Summary

Little Raven Publishing is working with Stripfest in May 2013. The Brunswick St. Stripwill be erotic stories and poems that are about or inspired by Fitzroy. The work will be published as a series of letters to be available in Fitzroy and at our events.

Little Raven Two will be our second erotic anthology. It will be published in November as an eBook filled with great writing and naughty stories.  

What We Need & What You Get

- All funds raised will go towards paying our writers 

- Any extra will go towards the cost of creating an eBook

The Impact

Your contribution will help us:

- Support and encourage our writers 

- Pay the cost of getting our manuscript turned into an eBook

- Keep Little Raven going! 

We were able to raise enough money to pay our writers last year, which was fabulous. This made creating Little Raven One an even more satisfying experience. The writers are the lifeblood of Little Raven and it is important to us to reward them for their work.

story:
The W. W. book project was launched to commemorate the civil rights activities and events that occurred 50 year ago in 1963. As such, the book W. W. is a celebration of the life and legacy of Mr. Westley Wallace (W. W.) Law who was a contributing voice to the civil rights movement on the national and local levels. A great American and iconic Savannah civil rights crusader, Mr. Law was a tireless advocate whose dedication to freedom, justice and equality were planted in his heart as a child.

Overcoming great adversity and fighting for the rights of others are universal struggles that transcend time, context and geography, the inspirational story of Mr. W. W. Law speaks to the power of faith, family and friends. In the tradition of African story telling, Ja Jahannes (the author) has eloquently captured the essence of the story as told to him by Mr. Law, so future generations of young people will come to know the story of this important contributor to the civil rights struggle in America.  

One of the main objectives of this campaign is to celebrate the transformative impact of an individual's childhood on his/ her capacity for success and to recognize that all great people were once children too.

story:
For updates on Save Bob please "like" the facebook page where I will be posting the latest news on readings and articles (and of course how the novel is going): www.facebook.com/savebobnovel

Thanks, 

Carrie.

THANK-YOU TO EVERYBODY WHO HAS SUPPORTED THIS CAMPAIGN!! 

The following material and the video above are from the recent campaign to fund the last draft. "like" the facebook page and stay tuned!

This campaign allows you to get involved in an international, collaborative exchange on this exciting novel!

Für Information auf Deutsch siehe Dokument “Deutsch” unter dem Reiter „Gallery“. (oben rechts)

SAVE BOB is a short novel set in the suburbs of New Zealand in the near future. The story is told from the perspective of Bob, a regular guy experiencing the changes in his suburban world as cheap oil runs out. SAVE BOB traces the protagonist’s comical attempts to change his life in order to cope with the global energy crisis. In the style of a great whodunit, Bob wakes up in a pool of blood on the kitchen floor and tries to piece back together the events leading up to his predicament.

The end goal of this story is to give a broader audience a realistic picture of life in the suburbs in the very near future. This project is about creating a rocking short novel - ideal for being transposed to other entertainment formats.

WHO WE ARE:

Author

My name is Carrie Hampel and SAVE BOB is my first novel. Working in the creative arts and entertainment industries for more than 20 years, I have written a number of short stories, performances, and songs that I have produced and performed in Berlin. In many ways I am a true freelancer – in every sense of the word – in that I have worked as an actor and entertainer in many different forms from circuses to stand-up, prime time national German TV, to films and performance art in Auckland, Melbourne, New York, London, and Berlin. Basically, I know what makes an audience tick. Since becoming a mother and working on this novel, I have also worked as a translator and language editor. SAVE BOB will be the first piece of creative writing I aim to get published.

Administrator 

My friend and assistant, Leah Matthews, is helping me to get this project off the ground. Having completed a Bachelor and Master’s degree in literature in Australia and Germany, she will assist me in editing and coordinating the final draft of the novel before it is sent off to publishers or published online.

Mentor

My mentor, Atillio Pigneri has a doctorate in Energy Systems and Environment at Università degli Studi di Lecce. Attilio’s experience and passionate involvement in numerous organisations, institutes and universities around the world are too lengthy to list here. Suffice it to say he has over ten years’ experience in interdisciplinary scholarship on energy and environmental issues, incorporating engineering, economics, public policy, and environmental science. Attilio has mentored this project from the beginning (2005) and makes sure the novel reflects scientific fact. He has also coached me in the methods and mechanisms of creating a solid and multifaceted future scenario.

 

THE CONCEPT:

The idea of SAVE BOB dates back to 2005 when I was living in the suburbs of Auckland. I found myself stuck without a car and had no access to reliable public transport. During this time it struck me that oil wont last forever. I started asking myself: What would happen to the area I was living in when oil ran out? These questions coupled with some initial research into global oil supplies inspired me to write a short novel - a near future scenario in the suburbs as oil becomes expensive before finally running out.  SAVE BOB provides a very likely prognosis for suburban life based on, and supported by, research from industry as well as academic channels. The research for the novel dates back to 2005 and includes expert interviews, industry statistics and local research.

 

THIS CREATIVE PROCESS INVOLVES YOU!

This crowdfunding campaign and your support will help me to complete the last draft. Once this has been written, I will offer a series of live online readings in both German and English for different time zones. During the online reading I will be able to address you personally, and you will be able to ask questions and give feedback on the excerpts. I hope and plan to incorporate your feedback and comments in any subsequent corrections and rewrites before the novel is published.  

GOAL:

The funds generated through this campaign will enable me to write the final draft of SAVE BOB. Specifically the money will be used to:

  • Provide me with a wage for a three-month period to write the final draft.
  • Give me chance to work with other people on the text, themes and ideas.
  • Perform online live readings of the material and integrate your feedback and ideas.

If I receive more than my stated goal of USD 5 000, funds will go towards a trip to Australia and New Zealand for researching and fine-tuning details relating to setting and characters. Moreover, I plan to use the campaign to create awareness of the themes addressed in the book.

If I do not reach my goal of USD 5 000, I will use all received funds to work for long as I can on the novel. 

TAKE A PEEK! 

In the gallery (tab above video), we have included a four-page excerpt from two different chapters of the previous draft for you to read.

WHY CONTRIBUTE TO THIS CAMPAIGN?

  • Because you think that it’s a great idea and you are interested in the topic!
  • Because this will be a fun and fulfilling project to get involved in with your own scientific/networking/creative/personal talents.
  • Because you would like to be part of an ever-expanding network of people interested in this idea from all kinds of backgrounds and all kinds of angles.
  • Because entertainment products reach a broader audience that scientific and political discourses don’t.
  • Because you want to know what happens to Bob! 

HOW YOU CAN SUPPORT:

  • By making any financial contribution through the indiegogo platform
  • By getting tickets to the live international online reading and giving your opinions, feedback and ideas.
  • Share! Use the share buttons below the video link to email, facebook, twitter or imbed it on your site or blog. Keep updating your friends as to why you like the project!
  • Word-of-mouth – Start asking people you know how they imagine their future when petrol is no longer affordable. Tell people about this project!

WHY CONTRIBUTE TO THIS CAMPAIGN?

Because you think that it’s a great idea and you are interested in the topic!
Because this will be a fun and fulfilling project to get involved in with your own scientific/networking/creative/personal talents.
Because you would like to be part of an ever-expanding network of people interested in this idea from all kinds of backgrounds and all kinds of angles.
Because entertainment products reach a broader audience that scientific and political discourses don’t.
Because you want to know what happens to Bob! 

HOW YOU CAN SUPPORT:

By making any financial contribution through the indiegogo platform
By getting tickets to the live international online reading and giving your opinions, feedback and ideas.

Share! Use the share buttons below the video link to email, facebook, twitter or imbed it on your site or blog. Keep updating your friends as to why you like the project!

Word-of-mouth – Start asking people you know how they imagine their future when petrol is no longer affordable. Tell people about this project!

story:
A book to inspire real love for people, the earth and you.

You are invited to taste living wine, immerse in the truth of a love so profound, that you are filled and on fire for what can turn our own and the world around.

What inspires people to care for the environment, to put their lives on the line for those, whose human rights don't even exist, to create works of magnificence and beauty, be kissed in wild abandon and reach a hand across the chasm of different worlds to truly connect? Love. Here. In each of us, and alive between the stars. A gift, beckoning us to come home and cultivate our soil for real love to grow. Spreading far and wide, inspiring lives. One heart, one book at a time.

This book is a unique symphony of true life adventure, poetic stories, practical skill and ancient wisdom woven together to ignite a blazing fire- a revolution that awakens lives, touches hearts and changes the world. I send a kiss across the universe to you for being part of it.

What has love got to do with rich bread and dark chocolate, your toes and simply breathing, the business of actual relating with each other and being present with a child, to tend to trees and rivers, connect with animals and roar like a lioness for what we value at the core? What’s love got to do with daring to be vulnerable and reach through the deep dark to bring forth what is true, healing all too familiar heartbreaks and aches, embracing joy and pain, dropping into stillness and intimacy with all of life, turning on awareness and falling free into love all over, engaging with social justice and my neighbor next door? Everything. I have not met a single being, who does not want to be seen, heard and loved.

What is in it? (For excerpts please scroll below the picture.)

'Kissed by Fire’ is a flesh-and-blood book on real love, how to discover and grow it in ourselves, with nature and between each other. It is empowering us to truly live this love- simple and outrageous, with all our human stumbling- wherever we are, whatever is going on. Written with mind, belly, feeling and soul, it engages, educates, touches our deepest being, and inspires us toward a greater calling. One that can cause a dam to open and the world to turn- with the wonderous gift of you. 

A little about myself:  

I am putting my naked heart unto the street with this book, feel vulnerable to bring it forth, exited, unnerved and it's plain awkward to promote it too. But that's how it is with love. It just takes courage to be open and real. What to do, when on fire for true loving, in a world where we could do with much more of it? I worked for over a decade in the field of teaching, healing and leading people, and have been walking this path myself, through the trenches and glories. I felt called to write a book that was in the making and baking for an entire lifetime- and still is.

What is the funding needed for:

Even though the title is not yet set in stone, the book is written with 350 pages and is getting ready to come out. I have poured every cent, time, energy and my whole heart into a labor of love, for what I believe is an important contribution to humanity and the planet.  Funding is needed for an editor, proof reader, designer, agent to deliver substantial quality and get into a publishing house to show up in bookstores, in your hands and to turn lives.

What you receive:

Wonderful perks to choose from. This book for your own life. To grow and spread love by making the book happen. Be part of a movement that is benefitting the planet and people. With your contribution you are helping a book to come forth, that will help many other beings.

Thank you for supporting "Kissed by Fire". With you it will be published, can turn and inspire lives, and change our world- one heart, one book at a time. Forward the campaign to friends, write a comment on this site, pledge monies, make some noise and spread the news about this book! Every act of love matters. You make a difference with a contribution.Thank you with all my heart! 

For tastes from the feast, please scroll below the picture where the book was written.

Tastes of the Book

From 'A deeper calling": 

Do you hear the whisper, the stirring when life is emerging as the first daffodil, when the tiny chirpings of birds tickle you to smile; or the moment, when all is still and suddenly shattering thunder and lightening pierces the sky? In the middle of the night, when alone twisting and turning, there is a restlessness that nothing seems to satisfy, no matter how hard you may have tried to tie it down. Or looking out across the ocean over the horizon, and a longing, an ache is arising, as if from an ancient knowing wanting to awaken in you...

From the 'Loving humanity' chapter: 

Glorious. Bloody. Humanity. Centuries interwoven with times of peace and war, terror inflicted and happiness shared, threads of beauty shining through, and toxins spilled upon the carpet of life, works of geniuses and the greatness of the human spirit follow us through all the ages. The color of insanity is close by, horrible and beneficial deeds stand out; we are born and die over and over again. The fabric of humanity is a mighty one, an epic played out, that still continues on- to this day. The story is alive in our cells and bones.Where does love come in?...

 ...A little 5 year-old girl in the orphanage where I worked offered Mother Teresa her only toy to take to the children in the slums. I could see how precious this ragged, cuddled up and tear stained doll was to her, and yet she was beaming to be able to offer her gift. Mother Teresa did not want people to give from their abundance, what they did not need, or a leftover. What matters, she always said, is how much love we put into the giving. That is where true joy is found. She lived what she spoke; I saw it in her eyes and in the way she held the hand of the old thin man, who was dying in peace. 

From the 'Relationship Cookbook':  

"Is your kitchen a welcoming place?" I asked a friend, to which he replied: “What in the world are you talking about? What have kitchens, bread, chocolate to do with relationships and love?”(I would include chilli too). Well, everything really. What ingredients do you have in your kitchen that nourish and grow healthy relationships? Sometimes we have rotten food in our refrigerator or jars of poison that might need to be emptied out. What could use a dose of refilling in your storage house? Appreciation is one, that comes in handy to be able to offer daily food for any relationship. 

From 'Essential communication for all seasons': 

Simple and real the heart always hits the mark. What is fresh and alive for you? What is true and here between us, right now? The invitation is to enter into another world with curiosity, to get to know the different landscape of another and let our own world be seen, without the usual judgment screen. This is a worthwhile practice that can connect us across the abyss of misunderstanding and the walls we tend to build, when we shut down.

From the 'Truth breaks through' chapter:

...She looked panicked, kept turning around to see if someone could hear her and then drew me into the back, the dark corner of my favourite chai and coffee store. In a husky voice the woman, who worked for him, spoke: “I must not be seen or heard, you must not use my name. It could cost my life.” I leaned in closer to listen: ”You are about to grasp the velvet glove of a vampire. Get the hell out.Now.“ My hairs went up, I literally had fallen into one of those thriller Hollywood movies I thought I never watch. I was in big time trouble with finances, a castle and my life at stake. Would the power of truth be enough to find a way to victory? 

From the 'The Kiss and the Gold' chapter: 

"She kissed my forehead with a gentle touch and lightening struck all the way through. My life, as I had known it, was over.. .

..Love is like a fire, burning everything that is untrue, without escape. In the final surrender, as nothing is left, the deepest yearning is fulfilled. You are the flame." 

From 'Relating with Nature': 

The eye of this magnificent whale carried stillness from the deepest place in the sea and ancient wisdom from the earth was woven in her song. It was otherworldly and profound to hear, piercing each of us to tears. What could we do for the ocean and her kind, given the situation the environment is in? As I reached with my hands to touch the humpback whale mother, I told her that I would help however I could. 

From the introduction chapter 'Power of real love': 

Can we allow our hearts to be broken open, be as wide as the world in answer to this? Greatness emerges, as we dare to be present and open in the midst of the beauty and the horror of our humanness. I have seen it over and over again: when people feel connected, they care and act. They naturally love.

End of Excerpts. For now.

I am grateful for Indiegogo. It offers a platform for creativity, pioneering and odd artists like myself and a book such as this one here, that intends to inspire and turn the world around. A little much, hm? It can happen for one person and spread on from there. One drop is sometimes enough to cause a dam to break.

My book came ananounced and unplanned, as often creative projects- and in fact babies- do. It emerged from thirty years of my work with people and my own, rather epic life. Many a time I have been asked to write what I have found in the darkest time when all was taken, and what I have been passionatley living- with all the glories and agonies. 

A love that is universal and intimate, burning through the  delusions we tend to carry around, connecting us for real and which makes a powerful difference in the world; no matter what country, belief and background people come from.

I have been writing (in scribbles), before I could walk, but this is officially my first 'proper' book. I have written a book of poems that has been selling in the local market and other little booklets, some landed in peoples hands, but a lot I kept away from the public eye. Even though I am shaking in my boots, I feel this one is deserving to venture out from my paper filled closets to a publishing house.  Why? Because this book is about what most people want in their life, are fulfilled, inspired and moved to action by. Real Love.

And I am on fire to awaken hearts and changing the world, one book at a time. Written for the sake of the people, this beautiful earth, and you.

Thank you for offering your special gift to it!

All written material is the copyright of Nicola Amadora. For more information visit my website.
story_txt:
A book to inspire real love for people, the earth and you.
You are invited to taste living wine, immerse in the truth of a love so profound, that you are filled and on fire for what can turn our own and the world around.


What inspires people to care
for the environment, to put their lives on the line for those, whose human
rights don't even exist, to create works of magnificence and beauty, be kissed
in wild abandon and reach a hand across the chasm of different worlds to truly connect? Love. Here. In
each of us, and alive between the stars. A gift, beckoning us to come home
and cultivate our soil for real love to grow. Spreading far and wide, inspiring
lives. One heart, one book at a time.
This book is a unique symphony
of true life adventure, poetic stories, practical skill and ancient wisdom
woven together to ignite a blazing fire- a revolution that awakens lives,
touches hearts and changes the world. I send a kiss across the universe
to you for being part of it.
What has love got to do with
rich bread and dark chocolate, your toes and simply breathing, the business of actual relating with each other and being present with a child, to tend to trees and rivers, connect with animals and roar like a lioness for what we value at the core? What’s
love got to do with daring to be vulnerable and reach through the deep dark to bring forth what is
true, healing all too familiar heartbreaks and aches, embracing joy and pain,
dropping into stillness and intimacy with all of life, turning on awareness and falling free into love all over,
engaging with social justice and my neighbor next door? Everything. I have not
met a single being, who does not want to be seen, heard and loved.
What is in it? (For excerpts please scroll below the picture.)
'Kissed
by Fire’ is a flesh-and-blood book on real love, how to discover and grow it in
ourselves, with nature and between each other. It is empowering us to truly live this love- simple and outrageous, with all our human stumbling- wherever we are, whatever is going on. Written
with mind, belly, feeling and soul, it engages, educates, touches our deepest being, and
inspires us toward a greater calling. One that can cause a dam to open and the world to turn- with the wonderous gift of you. 

A little about myself:  
I am putting my naked heart
unto the street with this book, feel vulnerable to bring it forth, exited,
unnerved and it's plain awkward to promote it too. But that's how it is with
love. It just takes courage to be open and real. What to do, when on fire for
true loving, in a world where we could do with much more of it? I worked
for over a decade in the field of teaching, healing and leading people, and
have been walking this path myself, through the trenches and glories. I felt
called to write a book that was in the making and baking for an entire
lifetime- and still is.

What is the funding needed for:
Even though the title is not
yet set in stone, the book is written with 350 pages and is getting ready to come out.
I have poured every cent, time, energy and my whole heart into a labor of love, for what I believe is an important contribution to humanity and the planet.  Funding is needed
for an editor, proof reader, designer, agent to deliver substantial quality and get into a publishing house to show up in bookstores, in your hands and to turn lives.
What you receive:
Wonderful perks to choose
from. This book for your own life. To grow and spread love by making the
book happen. Be part of a movement that is benefitting the planet and people. With your contribution you are helping a book to come forth, that will help many other
beings.

Thank you for supporting "Kissed by Fire". With you it will be
published, can turn and inspire lives, and change our world- one heart, one book at a time. Forward the campaign to friends, write a
comment on this site, pledge monies, make some noise and spread the news about this
book! Every act of love matters. You make a difference with a contribution.Thank
you with all my heart! 
For tastes from the feast, please scroll below the picture where the book was written.
Tastes of the Book

From 'A deeper
calling": 
Do you hear the whisper, the stirring when life is emerging
as the first daffodil, when the tiny chirpings of birds tickle you to smile; or
the moment, when all is still and suddenly shattering thunder and lightening
pierces the sky? In the middle of the night, when alone twisting and turning,
there is a restlessness that nothing seems to satisfy, no matter how hard you
may have tried to tie it down. Or looking out across the ocean over the
horizon, and a longing, an ache is arising, as if from an ancient knowing wanting
to awaken in you...
From the 'Loving humanity'
chapter: 
Glorious. Bloody. Humanity. Centuries interwoven with times of
peace and war, terror inflicted and happiness shared, threads of beauty shining
through, and toxins spilled upon the carpet of life, works of geniuses and the
greatness of the human spirit follow us through all the ages. The color of
insanity is close by, horrible and beneficial deeds stand out; we are born and
die over and over again. The fabric of humanity is a mighty one, an epic played
out, that still continues on- to this day. The story is alive in our cells and
bones.Where does love come in?...
