story:
HI FOLKS, THANKS SO MUCH FOR HELPING ME REACH MY GOAL IN 8 DAYS!   IF IT WORKS FOR YOU TO SEND ADDITIONAL FUNDS, I CAN DEFINITELY USE THEM TO PAY FOR PRINTING MY BOOKS -- SINCE I NEED TO PAY IN ADVANCE TO PRINT BOOKS FOR AK PRESS TO DISTRIBUTE TO BOOKSTORES AND LIBRARIES. THANK YOU, THANK YOU!!

HELP ME TAKE MY BOOK ON THE ROAD!!

HOPE Into PRACTICE, Jewish Women Choosing Justice Despite Our Fears

When I first read the Table of Contents, I was surprised to feel tears arise: tears of need, hunger, yearning, promise. Penny’s book is filled with wild, truthful, and exuberant voices, you can feel their spirits in their words. –Rabbi Margaret Holub

Yep, “Thank you” is what I thought I was supposed to say, when told I didn’t “look Jewish.” Unbelievable, eh?

What will make it irresistible for Jewish women to free ourselves of ways we’ve been (unconsciously) taught to feel, deep inside, that there is something wrong with us? It’s what I call internalized anti-Semitism, also internalized sexism. My new book – Hope into Practice, Jewish women choosing justice despite our fears -- responds with a juicy blend of healing stories, fascinating history, and also a fair-minded perspective on Israel-Palestine—asking us to love ourselves enough to have the courage to face our Jewish fears, without acting on them.

An activist’s call to repair the world, Hope into Practice is anchored in Jewish ethical tradition and community. AND to help it be most useful, I’ve included an action-oriented Reader’s Guide, for groups and individuals. For nearly six years, I’ve been birthing this book and I’m so excited to get it out there! Scroll down to read some eloquent testimonials…

What’s in it for You!

Life experience has taught me that the better we feel about who we are and where we come from, the better we’ll treat other people -- and the more positive/powerful our activism will be in creating a just and generous world. And the more joyful, expansive and meaningful our own lives will be. That’s the bottom line of Hope into Practice, and why I want to launch it around this country, wherever I can: to bookstores, Jewish gatherings, women’s centers, queer gatherings, universities, house parties, you name it.

Hope into Practice is about Jewish women in the U.S., but it’s for everyone who cares about Jewish women, about Jews, about women (including those who identify as trans, gender-queer.)

I’m so ready – and I need your help!  If you can spare the funds to help me raise enough to take my book on the road this year, I’d be thrilled. In exchange, you could receive a first edition, autographed, first-run copy of Hope into Practice (424 pages), plus more copies to use as gifts, and even copies of my other books – not to mention a ton of gratitude and virtual hugs from me!

And soon you could also help by bringing me to give a reading, and/or a workshop, to your community, group, synagogue, school, or local bookstore. Visit my website for more info about the book and event possibilities, and to contact me: www.PennyRosenwasser.com.

Funds to Raise

I want to raise $7500 to fund airfare for a bunch of mini-book-tours all over the country this year, from New York to Ohio, North Carolina to San Diego, Michigan to Seattle. Because of my job commitments, I can’t take one big chunk of time to do this, so I’ll schedule week-long tour-lets throughout the year. Based on fares for recent flights I’ve taken, $7500 is my best guess for overall expenses, including rental cars, meals, and motels when I can’t find community housing. I need to raise this by OCTOBER 15, so hope you can help -- and if I raise more, I’ll use those funds to print more books. (For my last 2 books, I organized 30-city book tours across many states, so I know I can make this happen!)

A Little About Me…

Some of you are already friends and family. But for those who don’t know me, I’m a lifelong heartfelt  – Jewish loud and proud – rabble-rouser for social justice. I’ve publishedVisionary Voices, Women on Power: Conversations with shamans, activists, teachers, artists and healers (Aunt Lute Books) and Voices from a ‘Promised Land’; Palestinian & Israeli peace activists speak their hearts (Curbstone Press),and I earned my Ph.D. at the California Institute of Integral Studies in Transformational Learning & Change.

Former Jewish Caucus Chair of the National Women’ Studies Association, I was also a founding board member of Jewish Voice for Peace. For many years I was a performing folk musician, and later a community radio (KPFA) host and producer. I also belong to Kehilla Synagogue in Oakland, California, and I teach an Anti-Semitism/ Anti-Arabism class with a Palestinian colleague at the City College of San Francisco.

What some amazing folks have said about Hope into Practice…

A wonderful, gutsy, and inspiring book. Penny Rosenwasser takes on the most explosive issues in American Jewish life today—racism and anti-Semitism, victimization and privilege, and Jewish politics around Israel and Palestine—and she does it with a generosity of spirit and a clear head. A vision of a progressive Jewishness for a multicultural 21st century comes through proud and clear. –Karen Brodkin, author of How Jews Became White Folks and What That Says About Race in America

This is a book about liberation from our narrow places and the power to change the world.  No matter who you are, you’ll learn something new about being human.–Noah T. Winer, Co-founder, MoveOn.org; Board member, Jewish Voice for Peace

A powerful tool for today's Jewish activists. Based on the bold assumption that communal and individual healing is integral to justice work, Rosenwasser's multi-disciplinary book is written from a poignant, personal perspective. Hope into Practice allows readers to reflect on their own struggles with Jewish identity, queerness, and ethical commitment in order to imagine a better future. A must-read for all Jewish feminists!–Alainya Kavaloski, Jewish Caucus Chair, National Women’s Studies Association

A teaching story for all of us.–Akaya Windwood, President, Rockwood Leadership Institute

Hope Into Practice acknowledges that we cannot wait to heal all our wounds before we can act–but cannot wait until our movements are successful before we turn to our healing.–Marjorie Dove Kent, Executive Director, Jews for Racial & Economic Justice

And finally, just so you know, Hope into Practice…

*  Reclaims a loud-proud (not superior) joyful Jewishness

*  Invites us to reframe internalized voices that tell Jewish women we are Too Much or Not Enough, that no one wants us, that it's dangerous to be visible, that we can't trust anyone, that we are the Lone Ranger, that we have to appear tough, that the whole world is really against Jews.

*  Insists on the centrality of Jewish multiculturalism, meaning full inclusion of Jews of color, Mizrahi and Sephardic Jews, and Jews of other ethnicities and hyphenated identities

*  Calls for liberatory healing, bringing our bodies and whole selves into the act, on healing trauma and rebuilding aliveness

*  Advocates for changing unfair systems, including in the US, including US policies regarding Israel-Palestine; it calls for security, equality, dignity, self-determination and full human rights for Israelis and Palestinians

* Shines a light on Jewish resistance struggles and on our allies, and asks us for the courage to face our fears without acting on them -- to choose justice despite our fears -- linking personal healing with tikkun olam, or mending the world.

Thanks so much for any kind of support you can give!

Also find this campaign on: Facebook, www.PennyRosenwasser.com

story:
Short Summary

So, we're all sitting here, with jobs and bills and obligations and wants and needs and no idea what the hell to do about it all.

Nobody gave us an instruction manual.  For some of us, our parents prepared us as best as they could and we're doing what we can with the tools they gave us.  Some of us had less guidance and are doing the best we can with the tools we've scrounged.

In any case, being a grown up isn't easy.  It would be nice to have some instructions, wouldn't it? Out of such a desire, a collaborative project was borne - a collection of personal stories, advice, lessons, and activities that might just give a little relief to the confusion and frustration that comes with being an adult.

That's what this book is about. Being a Grown Up: A User's Manual for the Real World is a collection of essays, poems, and words of wisdom from all over the world. Some of our authors are previously published, some are brand new faces.

What We Need & What You Get

We're an independent project. We're passionate about this book and it's success, but we don't have a lot of capital.

Our most important goal is to pay all of our authors as soon as possible. Our $2000 goal will cover payments for all of our contributors first and foremost.

  • A $5 contribution will get you a big ol' Thank You, and your name printed in the book as a contributor
  • A $10 contribution will get you a copy of the ebook, and your name printed in the book as a contributor
  • A $30 contribution will get you a print copy of the book, and your name printed in the book as a contributor
  • A $50 contribution will get you two print copies of the book, an ebook, and your name printed in the book as a contributor 
  • A $100 contribution will get you a special edition hardcover signed by the editors, and your name printed in the book as a very special contributor
  • A $500 contribution will get you a special edition hardcover signed by the editors, a softcover copy of the book, an ebook, and your name printed in the book as a very special contributor

The Impact

By helping us fund this project, you're really helping the fantastic authors and contributors who are making this book a possibility. If we meet our goal, we can compensate them quickly and really put our efforts into making the book the success it deserves to be.

If we manage to surpass our initial goal, we'll be able to really put some oomph behind the launch of this book, and really let it shine! Every penny helps!

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign with your friends, family, loved ones! Do any of them really know how to be a grown up? They could probably use the advice, too! Everything helps, and the more people who know about our project, the better.

Take care, and thank you all so much.

Sincerely,

Ayla-Monic McKay and Kathleen Healy,

Editors

story:
What We Need, What You Will Get & The Story:

My name is Marissa Klein and I need your help to plant the "seed money" for my children's book series, The Dream Big Academy.  To create the brand. To educate.  To inspire.  I feel strongly that Rosie Wants to be a Fireman, the first book in the series, is just scratching the surface of what I could do with The Dream Big Academy.  Indiegogo funds can help me print, market, and write additional storylines.  Thank you in advance for your interest and TLC.

         xoxo, Marissa*

When I was a little girl, I wanted to be a writer. That was my inner most dream.  What did you want to be? This simple question stops people.  It makes them think.  It stirs up emotion.  Thought.  Memory.  Passion. Disappointment.  Acceptance.

For the last 8 years, I have helped people to find dream jobs in the NYC fashion & media world.  I listen, coach, critique, and support.   I help people chase their dreams and embrace reality at the same time. I can relate as I had a career in fashion after trying to work in beauty. I wanted to be a newscaster.  I wanted to be a billion things.  And here I am, a recruiter.  

Its not always easy.  When the economy was tough,  I heard so many stories.  I didn't want my candidates to give up just because the professional world had come to a pause.  I didn't want to give up because I had a little girl at home who missed me when I went to work.  The juxtaposition of going to work every day and struggling to help people and coming home and looking into those hopeful and bright eyes brought my pen to paper.  How could I explain what I do to my daughter?  How could I teach her to never give up?  How could I encourage her to chase her dreams? My gut instinct reminded me that I was far from the only parent wanting to explain "work and choice and perserverance" to my child. 

Memorial Day Weekend 2011-I was delayed at O'Hare airport for literally 8 hours and I sat down and wrote about Rosie wanting to be a fireman.  In the 2 years since I wrote a simple but meaningful story while waiting for my flight to Newark:  I had a second daughter, watched my beautiful mother beat breast cancer, became an Aunt, and grew my division of our family's staffing firm (Choice Fashion) tremendously.  Busy was putting it kindly.   Yet, I never gave up on the dream of getting this book out there and into the hands of my peers...my fellow parents who want to read something super relevant at bedtime.

By supporting my efforts,  I hope to publish not only this book, but a series of books all about different careers.  Why not?  It just makes so much sense- as "they" say, I can write what I know and help others while doing it. I have charities I would love to give back to, big plans, big dreams.  

I hope that you too can use Rosie to teach a great lesson in your own home.  She will start a dialogue.  One that is ageless.  And timeless.  Because you know what?  Even though I am a mom and run a business and have all of this serious day to day grown up stuff to swallow...I always wanted to be a writer.  And now, I can add that title to my resume.  Writing Rosie proves that I practice what I preach day in and day out. Dreaming big is not always easy, but it is certainly always worth it.  

My staff knows my "Marissa'isms" inside and out.  One of my favorites applies to Rosie and I expect to happen once I click "upload" to this Indiegogo profile (eek!)- Success redefines itself every single day.  What feels right today, may not feel right tomorrow and visa versa.  Rosie can be the next Must HAVE book for anyone who is anyone under the age of 6 or Rosie may just be a beautiful little story that I wrote for my daughter and for your daughters/sons.  I love either storyline, however you define it.  

To learn more about my day job, please visit www.choicecofashion.com. To learn more about my incredibly talented illustrator, Brooke Hagel, please check out her www.fabulousdoodles.blogspot.com. Without Brooke, I would not have been able to get my words to come alive.  She is a dreamer & I am honored to have her creating by my side.  Please share this with friends... and pay it forward for Rosie.  Much love and thanks...  DREAM BIG.  Marissa Klein

story:
Hi, I'm Nhat Crawford, the author of Black Coffee One Sugar. Eight years ago I began putting a real to life story into a novel called Black Coffee One Sugar. It was created on the heels of my first book entitled Love Braid Us Three, a book that many readers enjoyed and were quite moved by. Naturally, everyone wanted to know if I’d be writing a sequel or at least another book. My answer was, Yes! Instead, however, as life would have it, I suffered a divorce and magnanimous loss, which landed me in the poorhouse first then the hospital several times, then nearly in the grave. Thank God I was spared! 

Black Coffee is the first in a trilogy about Ian Maximus Yarborough, the head of a successful business and a family who adores him. To his daughter, Teenah, he is idylic. However, when one flawed decision of his causes their family and business to become striped of everything, Teenah is left to wade through taunting nightmares, questions and her own personal lusts. Weak for the fight, she and her family battle murderous enemies that have been awaiting the Yarboroughs for decades, all without Mr. Yarborough.

I need your help to pay for printing, editing, graphics, formatting, television adaptation, shipping and distribution. 

Please help me get it out and onto your Ereaders or into your hands. You won’t believe this book is based on actual events.

Thank you in advance!  

READ A SECTION OF THE PROLOGUE

CLICK HERE TO PREVIEW FOUR CHAPTERS!

What We Need & What You Get

It will cost approximately $8,000 for graphics, a final edit, formatting, printing, then distribution. 

For a contribution of $1 - I thank you immensely and will put you on my mailing list, keep you updated on the life of BCOS and the books that will follow in the trilogy.

For a contribution of $5 - You will receive a high resolution digital copy of the BCOS book cover emailed directly to you. 

For your contribution of $12 You'll receive a digital copy of the entire novel for your personal use within 48 hours of your contribution!

For your contribution of $29 you'll receive a copy of the first printing of BCOS with free shipping and handling within the USA.

In apprectiation for a $50 contribution you'll get an autographed copy mailed to you with no shipping cost to you. 

Become a friend of BCOS with a $100 gift. Your name will be printed in my book on the Friend's Page. In addition, you get 4 copies of BCOS to share.  

In appreciation of $500 you and your corporation will be listed on our Corporate Page. You'll recieve 6 copies of BCOS, 3 of them autographed.

In appreciation for $1000 you become our Platinum Supporter. Your logo and website information will be included in our promotional videos. I can't thank you enough!

This money will go strictly toward the publication and distribution of Black Coffee One Sugar, a family saga by Nhat Crawford. 

None of us can do anything great by ourselves; I know I cannot accomplish this campagne without you! Black Coffee One Sugar is a story that has already been test read by many and anticipated by even more. Thank you for helping me bring it to life at this time. 

READ A SECTION OF THE PROLOGUE

CLICK HERE TO PREVIEW FOUR CHAPTERS!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please feel free to spread the word about Black Coffee One Sugar. Visit Nhat Crawford on Youtube and encourage others to do so, also; you can also make a contribution from there. Follow me on Twitter [nhattheghost] and upload as you wish there, too! Support us on Facebook! The best advertisement is word of mouth and social media.

story:
For some people, understanding and accepting feelings and attractions is simple and straightforward; for others, it can be difficult. It’s a complicated process which often causes feelings of confusion, doubt, guilt, shame, excitement, fear, relief and anxiety.

The Coming Out is a collaborative project. It’s a collection of coming out stories, real life coming out stories from gay, lesbian, bisexual and trans-gender people. The goal of The Coming Out is to inspire, support and unite those who are living their lives either completely, or partially in the closet. The purpose of the book is not to encourage people to come out before they are ready, but rather to expose them to first hand accounts from people who have already been through, and are still going through the process themselves.

Where will the stories come from? They’ll come from you. We want you to share your coming out story. Any gender, identity or sexuality. Happy, sad, serious, successful, funny or however. We want you to share your own experience.

To produce the book, we need approximately $8,000. The funds raised will go to cover the cost of:

  • Content Curating
  • Book Trailer Cinematography 
  • Custom Cover
  • ISBN Assignment
  • Worldwide Book Distribution
  • Book Design and Page Layout
  • Custom Interior Design
  • Digital Formatting and Distribution


The profits from the book are going to support an LGBT Organization. The profits will be donated to the Human Rights Campaign, which is America’s largest civil rights organization working to achieve lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender equality. 

If you can't financially contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share the project with your friends and family
  • Spread the word via Facebook, Twitter, etc.

story:
Hi!

My name is John Kelepouris and i'm from Greece. Three years now after the economic crisis hit Greece i'm unemployed and with so much free time in my hands i started writing a fantasy novel that i first thought while i was working at a sleep apnea company. While i was working there not only i found out a lot about the facts of sleeping but also i came across with the myth of Hypnos god of sleep. So the idea started forming itself until one summer three years ago, as i was unemployed, i started writing.

I finally managed to come to an end and right now i'm writing the final chapter of my first novel titled "Dreamers". It's going to be approximately 350 pages and it's a fantasy novel written in greek and this campaign is to raise money so i can self publish this book.

You can take a look about the plot here:http://dreamersthebook.wordpress.com/about/about/

This fund raising will not only help me raise money for the publishing but also for the site construction where i'll be selling my novel. I'm also trying to find an experienced translator so i can sell it to a broader range of readers. It will also help me pay for an editor and marketing services.

If all goes well i will be ready to publish about 200 copies of it by the end of this year and sell it via internet and various bookstores here in Greece.

So if you are interested to see my first novel published and read it for yourselves help me in this campaign.

The funding goal is 5000 euros as i am not sure yet how much all of this will cost.

To get the copyright for my book i will be needing about 100 euros. For the site construction i think i will need about 500-1000 euros for a site that will allow me to sell via internet. Finding an editor might cost me 500 euros more or less. The publishing of 200 copies of a book of approximately 350 pages will cost me about 1500-2000 euros. Marketing services will be cheaper since there are a lot of ways (facebook, blog) to make my book known, but i will be needing someone who can really make this work at least here in Greece. So let's say he'll get another 500euros for a small campaign (book presentation, advertising etc).

So that's about it. I think 5000 euros is an appropriate amount and if it costs less it's going to help me publish more than 200 copies. If i don't reach the 5000euros goal than i will try to find cheap solutions for this project to be complete.

I'm sure that if you read the plot you'll want to see it published. I'm only thinking that it's such a great story that it would be best if someone like Neil Gaiman or Clive Barker should have written it to be the best story ever... But it's just me and this is my first book and i really tried hard on it. I hope someday you'll read it and enjoy it!

As the author of a fantasy novel titled "Dreamers" i'm sure you understand i too i'm a dreamer. My dream is written in this book and it's about all of us getting better not only as individuals but as a species. I hope this book help people to understand that all that matters is that we don't need to be afraid of death, to have hope in our hearts and to dream about a better future for all of us and try to make it happen.

I know it sounds romantic but dreamers are...

So if you like to donate, please do. If you are willing to help me otherwise, you already know that i will need a translator, an editor, an advertizer, a site builder or even a manager and so on and so forth, so if you can help me this way you are welcome!

Thank you in advance and thanks Indiegogo for the conviences that offers like it's sharing tools which you can use to make this project succeed

Thank you for dreaming!

story:
MARRIED: BUT IT CAN HAPPEN.....

This book will talk about my life in the deepest way that nobody has yet to ever see. Not only will this book go into detail of how I became infected with the HIV virus but also the life I have had to live for the past 5 years dealing with my HIV diagnosis. Which includes dating, school, the birth of children, depression, suicidal thoughts, and what it takes for someone who has gone through all of this to move forward and come out on top. I will also give details on how I went through having my then husband put in jail for infecting me. 

At this very moment I have a deadline of July 1, 2013 to have the entire book completely done, revised and ready to be published. I am expecting the book to have about 9-10 chapters. Right now my outline calls for 10 plus the Introduction and Acknowledgements page. 

HIV/AIDS is a subject that many try to stay away from in conversation but I say let's make it the #1 topic in the world! 

Please join me in supporting my fight to put the number of newly infected individuals to zero by helping me to get this book published!

All funds raised will go towards the self-publishing of this book. 

If you're unable to donate then PLEASE SHARE!

This book will talk about my life in the deepest way that nobody has yet to ever see. Not only will this book go into detail of how I became infected with the HIV virus but also the life I have had to live for the past 5 years dealing with my HIV diagnosis. Which includes dating, school, the birth of children, depression, suicidal thoughts, and what it takes for someone who has gone through all of this to move forward and come out on top. I will also give details on how I went through having my then husband put in jail for infecting me. 
At this very moment I have a deadline of July 1, 2013 to have the entire book completely done, revised and ready to be published. I am expecting the book to have about 9-10 chapters. Right now my outline calls for 10 plus the Introduction and Acknowledgements page. 
HIV/AIDS is a subject that many try to stay away from in conversation but I say let's make it the #1 topic in the world! 
Please join me in supporting my fight to put the number of newly infected individuals to zero by helping me to get this book published!
All funds raised will go towards the self-publishing of this book. 
If you're unable to donate then PLEASE SHARE!

story:
Story of My Book

Our Design Challenge: Learning to Create and Build Your Own Way through Life’s Obstacles, Struggles and Traumas

My name is Rick Prater and I am the author of Our Design Challenge. I wrote this book because wanted to share an attainable, livable way to face life’s challenges.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover your own Mindset. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for the Design Mindset with you. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you Design the Life you want to live.

In this book, you'll learn about the Design Mindset and overcoming Life's Roadblocks.

Do Designers utilize their Mindset to ideate, model, evaluate and create a world different from the one they live in? What came first the Mindset or the Creation? - Meet Renowned Architect Peter Marino, the Maestro of Luxury. He’s the secret ingredient behind the unique flagship stores of Chanel, Dior and Louis Vuitton. Architectural Curator is the label coined to describe Peter’s unique mash-up of Art and Design. Mash-up indeed. Somehow, the worldly, wonderfully sophisticated label mashes and smashes the real image of a man from humble working-class Flushing Meadows roots and the real origins of Peter’s love of the Arts. Peter started his life trapped in his bedroom by a childhood illness with drawing or prototyping another world as his means of living a life outside his bedroom.

Interested in AI or Robotic Design, then you love learning how Improv has Infused Design’s use of Human Prototyping - For Product Designer Bryan Cooperridge – an Improv Mindset is a Design Mindset. What? Here’s the scoop. Bryan actually studied Improvisation Acting before Design and for him this link is unbreakable. Some background information, Bryan is an educator, designer, and Improv Actor with a masters in product design from Stanford University. He’s the go-to-guy on how to apply Improv to Design Prototyping.

Does a Human Centered Design Mindset help create tangible Business success - Yes. AirBnB was founded by a group of Industrial Designers, here’s learn what Joe Gebbia thinks about that out-of-the-box journey- “Airbnb didn’t have five- or 10-year metrics at day zero, we just focused on building something we thought could help solve a problem, while bringing people closer together,”

You will love this book if you want to expand your life, and map out a new journey for your life or career.

Our Design Challenge is a non-fiction book that speaks to anyone who needs to overcome a life challenge and anyone who loves a good career challenge. It’s for the person looking for personal agency and the how to of a design mindset for the first time.

The Book - Our Design Challenge

The book is written in 3 Parts....

The BE Part contains an introduction with three additional chapters. This section is designed to show how Human Centered Design benefits from be honestly and authentically - traits we all have but sometimes need to activate or use differently. You’ll learn how Peter Marino’s traumatic childhood illness transformed his mindset and how he still benefits and is grateful for the experience.

The DO Part also contains three Chapters. We’ll work on recognizing, enhancing, and owning the traits of Authenticity, Empathy and Intentionality all prime traits of a great Design Mindset.

The HAVE Part and it’s Five Chapters outlines Challenge we all face, Our Design Challenge and how we can create a mindset to achieve the life we want. You’ll learn how to develop your mindset and improve your career, relationships and joy.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

 

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2020.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this [season of year]

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Here’s some quote porn, by the Knoll Industrial designer, Harry Bertola that helped light my desire for life when I really needed it: “The urge for good design is the same as the urge to go on living. The assumption is that somewhere, hidden, is a better way of doing things”

Harry’s quote perfectly sums up the way I felt after regaining some clarity thanks to a week in detox.

My story isn’t original or even interesting. Life handed me lemons and I solved the problem by adding Vodka. I reached for a replacement for life and it worked. The replacement gave me broken bones, a few seizures and finally a stroke. Vodka never killed the lemons – by the way.

Now … I’m not suggesting Design is a Superpower able to leap over any 12 Step Program or even a bullet train to success. I’ve learned by living. I know Design Principles are Empathetic, Responsive and have Integrity. And the best way to learn is by sharing. For 7 wonderful years I’ve shared, mentored and trained individuals using basic design principles. I’ve been able to Shine, Refine and Redesign these principles and now I’d love to share them with you. You don’t have to be in Rehab, Hit Rock Bottom or have to redesign your entire life to benefit from these principles. But you will benefit by applying them. This is for anyone that feels stuck by life’s obstacles, struggles or traumas. This is for the person that wants to think outside of the box but needs a map on how to get there.

For more information you can connect with Rick at Rick@praterdesign.com Instagram: praterdesign , Facebook: rick prater design

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

 

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #DesignChallenge and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it.
  • Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Rick Prater

story:
You can still contribute to this project, get perks, and make a difference! You can send donations by mail to:

Didi Pershouse

The Center for Sustainable Medicine

P.O. Box 277

Thetford Center, VT 05075

or go to www.sustainablemedicine.org/about-2/donate/ and make sure to drop us an email to let us know what perk you are choosing at sustainablemedicine@gmail.com 

Please share this with a short personal message via Facebook and email even if you can't contribute. Each person who has shared it so far has led to someone I don't know giving a donation!

My Story:

I've been running an innovative clinic in Vermont since 1995, providing sliding-scale alternative and traditional medicine to a wide variety of patients, teaching peer counseling, and helping people to remember how to get close to other people and look out for each other without fear of becoming a bother to each other. When I became involved in the sustainability movement, I realized no one was talking about how to make our health care system more resilient, even though my own practice seemed like a good model of what small scale, local, low-carbon, non-polluting medicine might look like.  I set out to explore what post-oil medicine might look like on a larger scale.

 

This book, which will be published by Chelsea Green, specifically addresses the question of how to reclaim and revive our whole health-care system—from how we care for each other in a community, to how our hospitals will function in the age of dwindling resources—in a connected, loving, and powerful way. Using real life examples from places that are already starting to make changes, this book will teach you how to turn your own community into a place that is actively producing healthy people, and how to turn your local hospital or clinic into a place that functions as a community--growing its own food, powered by solar, wind, and geothermal, providing low-cost housing nearby for staff, and providing ways for patients to deepen their connection to each other and to the earth.


 

Why do I need you?

I am the single mother of two fabulous boys. Most of my patients are rural low-income people and my annual net income is between $18,000 and $24,000--and has been for years. In order to write this book well, I need to take some time off before April and I need to hire someone to help with research. 

 

The book is going to be published, no matter what. Chelsea Green (they publish all your favorite books on permaculture, renewable energy, green architecture, sustainable communities, and local economies) has already signed a contract with me. They are a small publisher and they give small advances, and I have already been working on this book for four years! I have several more months to go, and although I am close to finished, there is plenty of writing and research still to do! 

 

What will the money be used for?

  • If I raise the minimum of $5,000, that will allow me to take off several days a week to write, rather than squeezing my writing in after hours between work and my boys’ saxophone concerts and basketball games.
  • $8,000 to $10,000 will allow me to take off a more solid chunk of time, while still caring for my higher need patients and hire a researcher.
  • $15,000-$20,000 will allow me to cover my writing expenses during the editorial period of 6-9 months, when I will be working with editors at Chelsea Green to rewrite sections and add in additional chapters as they see fit, and help to pay for me to go on a book tour when the book comes out (it's not like the old days when publishers paid for these things!).
  • Any funds raised above and beyond that will help this project to have a greater impact than the book alone. It will allow me to travel and speak at conferences, hospitals, and retreat centers after the book is published (it is due out in the Fall of 2012) and to truly focus on implementing and sharing this model of health care on a larger scale by working with town and city planning commissions, hospital and medical school administrators, and Transition Town initiatives to develop health-care resiliency plans, as well as developing curriculum for a training program for community healers.

 

You can give any amount, it doesn't have to fit neatly into one of the perks, and you are free to choose any perk up to the amount you have contributed. 

If you would like to give a larger amount, and would like it to be tax-deductible, please contact me at sustainablemedicine@gmail.com, as there are several non-profits who have offered to be an umbrella for this project.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help but can't afford to contribute, that's fine! There are things you can do that may be even more important, for example, click on the heart button below the video, (so that I know you like it, and I can communicate with you) and use the other buttons to share it on Facebook or via email, word of mouth, or any other way you can get the word out to people you think might be interested.

Writing a short personal note  to a few key people is the absolute best approach (far better than sending it as a "forward" to thousands of people). It is also really helpful  when you do post it on Facebook, if you can say why you support this, and suggest  that people actually watch the video.. Passing it along via word of mouth and personal messages rather than just "liking" something helps us all maintain our human dignity. Keeping our communication human and personal is one of the most important things we can do in the world right now.  Thank you for keeping that tradition alive as you share this.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
Don’t Judge a Book… is a written word and photography book project that talks about perception, discrimination and passing judgment on people around us. It’s a combination of visually stunning work, story telling and social dynamic study all combined into one. Specifically, this project focuses on all of us passing judgement, making assumptions and outcasting others based only on the surface physical appearances. It’s a one-­of­‐a­‐kind project. Through this project with the help of some very recognizable names and faces we want to remind everyone that we are all just people with same joys, fears, worries, and insecurities. And through that encourage everyone to higher self-‐awareness, building a healthy confidence, self-love and understand that being your true authentic self is the most beautiful thing in the world, because out of self sustaining beauty, springs forth beauty and love for everything else around you hence eliminating discrimination, judgement and bullying.

This project has only one goal. To deliver a message... and hopefully, for everyone involved to have a great time doing it. All on­‐board are very excited about the project and it’s been nothing but pure labor of love from the day this idea was born, since everyone involved is donating their talent and time 100%.

THIS IS WHY I NEED YOUR HELP....

I have been wanting to do this project for many years. And now I  finally have all the pieces in place. An amazing behind the scenes team and two hands full of recognizable faces and names that agreed to be involved, I am just beside myself!!! It all lined up so perfectly. It's one of those things when you know you're doing something right and things just start falling into place. I just need the last push...to get the book finished, published and out to the world. And spread the message to as many people as possible. 

WHAT ARE THE FUNDS FOR?

Most of the funds will be used for graphic design, layout, editing, and actual publishing of the book . As I mentioned before this book has one goal in mind, to deliver a message and to make sure we get it out to as many people as possible we are going to need some help. That's why  a portion of the raised funds will be used for publicity and for launch campaign/event. And of course some if it is to cover the perk expenses like shipping etc... 

I thank every single one of you, whether you decided to support this project or not, just for taking time to stop by and read this. I hope it sparked an interest and some curiosity in you and you'll share it with your friends. Thank you and remember to LOVE YOURSELVES!!!

story:
Hi!

   We have been feeling God’s pressing on our spirit to join Northland on a mission trip for quite some time. With much excitement and answer to prayer, we have the wonderful opportunity to go to Swaziland, Africa for 10 days, June 14-24.  We are thrilled! We will be ministering with a team of about 20 adults from Northland Church. We will be mostly working at the Global Primary School in Siteki, Swaziland.  This includes children’s ministry in the school and construction on teacher housing, along with meeting some agriculture needs of the community, house visits, and even a little soccer with the kids.

   For some context, Swaziland is a country with 1.3 million people and has surpassed Botswana as the country with the world’s highest known HIV/AIDS prevalence.  This is bad news, indeed, but it is also to be seen as an opportunity.  God is at work and has much in store for the people of Swaziland-we get to join Him in serving however He leads.  Pray, pray, pray for the people of Swaziland to see Jesus as the One who can be their Savior.  We too are desperate for God in our daily life. 

   In order for us to make this trip, we need to develop a ministry team.  This is a group of people who want to join with us financially and prayerfully.  We need to raise a total of $6,000, which includes our airfare to Swaziland, Africa, transportation within town, lodging, and meals during the 10 days.

   Would you prayerfully consider helping to send our team and us to Africa?  Any amount would be appreciated and thoroughly encouraging.  

   There are no adequate words to express our gratitude. Thank you so much for considering this.  More than anything, we covet your prayers for this trip for not only us, but also the 20 others whom we will be joining.  This is an amazing opportunity for us and we would love to have you as part of our team!!

Blessings,

Tim and Michelle Kutcher

story:
Putting Humanity Back at the Center of Tech Journalism

WhiteHat Magazine is a digital news organization dedicated to putting humanity back at the center of technology journalism, featuring stories that examine how science and technology innovations change the way we live our lives.

We started WhiteHat Magazine because, after working in international news for several years, we started to see a gap between what technology media focused on and what was actually happening in people's lives. Tech media would focus on IPOs, gadget reviews, and the lines out the door to get the latest hot phone, but would rarely look at the conditions of the workers who mined the coltan that goes into that phone, any issues around people being able to access that technology, and how that gadget or software affects the way people interact with each other. 

The internet has become a space where the lines of public and private spaces are blurred, and technology itself has created new hierarchies of power. Accordingly, journalism must “[c]over technology as a human rights and political issue as if it were Parliament. […] It is just as interesting and about ten thousand times more important,” said Emily Bell, director of the Tow Center for Digital Journalism at Columbia University's Graduate School of Journalism, in a speech at the University of Oxford. “We have to stop coverage of technology being about queuing for an iPhone and make it about society and power. We need to explain these new systems of power to the world and hold them accountable.”

"Laptop from a mobile library in Ghana." Photo by Beyond Access.

WhiteHat Magazine was founded with the intention of putting humanity back at the center of technology journalism. With that in mind, WhiteHat Magazine's editorial focus covers four broad areas:

  • STEM in global sustainable development
  • Women and minorities in STEM
  • Social entrepreneurship
  • Global politics and public policy vis-a-vis tech

So what exactly does all that mean? What kind of stories can you expect from us? We have tons of story topics and ideas, so here's just a small sample of some of the stories we are looking at:

  • Technology in refugee crises: reuniting families, tracking migrations and outbreaks, etc
  • Analyzing technology and the United Nations' Sustainable Development Goals
  • Environmental technology: clean energy, clean oceans, clean air, food and water security
  • Advancements in health and education
  • Space: the final frontier
  • Social media in politics: elections, leadership, protests, and democracy
  • The global net neutrality debate
  • The internet & public vs private domains
  • Internet access & privacy as human rights
  • Law enforcement and legal systems addressing online crimes/harassment
  • Diversity in Silicon Valley & positive stories of role models
  • Global gender gaps in STEM
  • Video games beyond the 'games': education, conflict management, etc.
  • Cryptocurrencies and the global unbanked
  • Digital diplomacy
  • Impact investing and crowdfunding
  • Capitalism with a conscience
  • And more!

Journalism shouldn’t be limited to just one medium anymore. So that’s why we are building a network that will allow us to tell stories on whatever platform fits best. We have already produced the 2015 Women in STEM Summit in Salt Lake City. Next we will launch the website, whitehatmag.com, and the digital magazine, where you will find longform stories, analysis, and photo essays. After that, we will be expanding into other platforms, like social media streaming, podcasting, video series, native apps, and even creating our own platforms for telling stories in new ways.

Want to hear more about us? Editor-in-Chief Chrisella Herzog went on P3 Utah's P3 People Podcast to talk about her vision and inspiration for WhiteHat Magazine! Listen to the full episode here.

Why "WhiteHat"?

‘White hat’ is well-known term in the hacker community—as someone who works with the ‘good guys’. More generally, white hat hackers can be understood as those who break systems in order to make them better. WhiteHat Magazine is named for the efforts to use technology innovations for social good and creating a better world.

"The project "ICT in the teaching and learning process" reached out to 26 schools located in six of the poorest districts with a high percentage of illiteracy in Quispicanchi Province, in the Cusco Region of Peru." Photo by IICD.

Join In!

We need your help to launch our website and commission the first edition's articles. To help, you can pledge as must as you want -- as little as $5 to become a founding subscriber, or all they way up to $25,000 to become a Silver Launch Sponsor of WhiteHat Magazine -- or share this campaign with your networks.

As part of this campaign, we are opening up our membership community to supporters with extras and discounts included that you won't be able to get after our launch! Check out what these membership levels include:


How the Funds Will be Spent

If we reach our full goal, this is how we plan to spend the money:

  • Indiegogo Fees: $1000
  • Shipping & Taxes: $5000
  • Perks & Printing: $4000
  • Journalists & Freelancers (For Content): $10,000
Such nice round numbers! The fees, taxes, printing, and shipping costs are estimates, slightly rounded up to give us a bit of padding. If we stay under budget in any area, the extra money will go back into supplies and equipment to make our content even better quality. If you pledge more than our goal of $20,000, we are planning some awesome stretch goals, but that money will go back into hiring more people and getting more great content.

Our focus is creating quality content, and the majority of the funds we raise will be put toward this.


Participants at Paiwand, Afghanistan's first-ever social media summit. Photo by Impassion Afghanistan.
The Team

Just like our coverage aims to do, our founding team combines journalism and technology experience into a passion for talking about tech in a more intelligent and meaningful way. 

Chrisella Herzog, Co-founder and Editor-in-Chief
Chrisella comes from a background in international affairs journalism, where she covered institutions such as the World Economic Forum, United Nations General Assembly, and NATO; and events such as the Arab Spring, Ukraine's Euromaidan Revolution, and Occupy Wall Street. Before starting WhiteHat Magazine, she served as Managing Editor of Diplomatic Courier. She has also served as Managing Editor and later Editor-in-Chief of G7/G8, APEC, B20, and G20 official publications for multiple countries. Talk to her on Twitter at @Chrisella.

Kyle Herzog, Co-founder and Chief Technology Officer
Kyle comes from a background in Software Engineering. From web front-end and back-end development, to mobile applications, to enterprise products and APIs, and more, Kyle has done it all. Before WhiteHat Magazine, he served as CTO of Diplomatic Courier and Lead Engineer for Red Touch Media. In his spare time, he has also founded an IT and engineering consulting firm, Kyzog Enterprises. He is never on social media, which you can see for yourself on Twitter at @Herzog_Kyle.

Shireen Hosseini, Editor 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk we face in this campaign is not whether or not we launch WhiteHat Magazine; we are a stubborn and frugal bunch, and so that will be happening, funded or no.

The big risk here is in the quality of the content we are able to provide at launch. Obviously, with a fully funded campaign, we can pay more writers and provide better content, which turns into a cycle of attracting more subscribers --> getting more income --> paying for even better content. 

We have chosen to do a flexible funded campaign because every little bit helps us create this new platform, and every dollar brings potential for awesomeness.

I still have a question!

Leave a comment here or email us at info@jabirpublications.com. 
For updates on the project, you can find us on Instagram, Twitter, Periscope, Tumblr, and Facebook!

Thanks to our Sponsors and Partners!

A big thanks to the organizations that have helped us get this off the ground!

story:
Brooklyn has long been known as one of the most vibrant poetry communities in the world. But there has yet to be an anthology celebrating the many contemporary poets who call it home. Brooklyn Poets and Brooklyn Arts Press are teaming up to publish the Brooklyn Poets Anthology, a landmark collection celebrating Brooklyn's contemporary poetry scene, emphasizing a variety of voices, aesthetics and traditions.

170 poets will be included: Philip Levine, Bernadette Mayer, Vijay Seshadri, Edward Hirsch, Tina Chang, D. Nurkse, Aracelis Girmay, Martín Espada, Cathy Park Hong, Gregory Pardlo, Kimiko Hahn, Kim Addonizio, Lemon Andersen, Patricia Spears Jones, Timothy Donnelly, Tyehimba Jess, Dorothea Lasky, Matthea Harvey, Patrick Rosal, Joshua Mehigan, Leigh Stein, Rachel Eliza Griffiths, Jessica Greenbaum, Tom Sleigh, Nick Flynn, Angel Nafis, Matthew Rohrer, Morgan Parker, Meghan O'Rourke, Ana Božičević, Ocean Vuong, Rickey Laurentiis, John Murillo, Floyd Skloot, Cynthia Cruz, Amy King, Matvei Yankelevich, Natalie Eilbert, Ken Chen, David Tomas Martinez, Hala Alyan, Tommy Pico, Nicole Sealey, Wendy Xu, Bianca Stone, Robert Gibbons, Christopher Soto, Candace Williams and many more.

Why We Need Your Help

Because of the size of the anthology (450+ pages), this book will cost more than the usual poetry publication. We project the cost of publishing, shipping and promoting the anthology to be in the ballpark of $10,000. We have already applied for $5000 in grant funding, which we hope to use to cover the cost of the first print run in March 2017 and printing/shipping copies to contributors (as payment) in April 2017. Your contribution will help us cover the initial $3000 cost of design, production, supplies, shipping, review-copy printing and other pertinent presale aspects of publishing. Help us reach our stretch goal of $6000 and we can cover a good portion of our expenses even if we don't get the grant. And if we do, we can put any extra funds toward further publicizing the work of all of these amazing writers in our attempt to reach as wide an audience as possible.

The Impact

We’ve worked to create an anthology that offers a panoramic snapshot of the talent, richness and diversity found within the Brooklyn poetry community, which is itself of course a collection of different communities. Brooklyn remains a constantly shifting landscape of restless, unique voices, and this anthology attempts to give its readers a broad understanding of what is happening here now. And because no single anthology is ever definitive or completely representative, we intend this volume to be the first of a series, so that we might continue to present the ongoing evolution of poetry written within this extraordinary borough. 

Perk Details

$25 Anthology Launch Party

We'll be launching the anthology in April. This $25 perk gets you a copy of the anthology ($25 list price) and an advance ticket to our launch party in Brooklyn, with free food. Tickets will cost $15, as space will be limited. In fact, there's a good chance we won't have any room left for regular ticket sales after this campaign. Just sayin'.

$50 Borzutzky & Duplan

Get a copy of the anthology and a ticket to our launch party and these two hot titles published by Brooklyn Arts Press: Daniel Borzutzky's The Performance of Becoming Human, this year's National Book Award winner in poetry, and Anaïs Duplan's Take This Stallion, an SPD bestseller.

$100 BAP 3 & BKP T

Get the previous perks and another BAP poetry or fiction title of your choice, such as Alexander Boldizar's The Ugly or Jay Besemer's Chelate—choose from the BAP catalog. And a Brooklyn Poets T-shirt of your choice! Choose from the BKP swag store.

 

$125 BKP Membership

Add to the previous perks a Brooklyn Poets Voyager membership ($45 value), which includes free admission to the Brooklyn Poets Yawp for a year, named the “best poetry event in the borough” by Brooklyn Magazine and “one of the most innovative literary events in the city" by Time Out New York. Membership also gives you a $25 discount on our five-week workshops and our annual Hamptons retreat, a 25% discount on swag, and invitations to special events.

$200 ALL BAP PDFs

Get all them previous perks plus a PDF copy of every book BAP has ever published. Every photography book, poetry book, art monograph, short story collection, novel and essay collection.

 

$250 BKP Sweatshirt

This is the kind of sweatshirt you want to wear every day during the winter. While you enjoy all the previous perks you just got.

 

$1000 ALL BAP BOOKS

This is just insane. You get all the previous perks plus a PAPERBACK COPY OF EVERY BAP BOOK EVER PUBLISHED. So if you're keeping score at home, that means you get a PDF of every BAP book and a paperback copy of every BAP book, so you can switch from digital to print books whenever you want. Just because you can. While you wear a Brooklyn Poets sweatshirt. On top of a Brooklyn Poets T-shirt. While enjoying a Brooklyn Poets membership. And getting a special shoutout in the inaugural volume of the Brooklyn Poets Anthology.

Your Contribution Is Tax Deductible

Brooklyn Poets is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit, so your contribution is tax deductible!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to contribute but would prefer to buy a single BAP title or a BKP T-shirt/sweatshirt individually, you can visit our respective online stores and purchase them there—though you're getting a deal and saving on shipping through these perk packages. Or come to one of our events and purchase a book or swag item or make a donation. Or visit the BKP Memberships and Donations page and contribute that way. Or spread the word on social media (#BKPAnthology) or by writing an article or blogging about the anthology. Every little bit helps!

About Us

Brooklyn Arts Press (BAP) is an independent house devoted to publishing new works by emerging artists. We believe we serve our community best by publishing great works of varying aesthetics side by side, subverting the notion that writers and artists exist in vacuums, apart from the culture in which we reside and outside the realm and understanding of other camps and aesthetics. We believe experimentation and innovation, arriving by way of given forms or new ones, make our culture greater through diversity of perspective, opinion, expression, and spirit.

Brooklyn Poets is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization celebrating and cultivating the poets, poetry and literary heritage of Brooklyn, the birthplace of American poetry. Since our inception in 2012, our core program of small, intensive poetry workshops taught by award-winning poets in their own homes has served over 300 students and employed over 30 teachers, and we’ve grown to host 22 events per year attracting over 1000 attendees annually, fostering a more close-knit, homegrown, diverse community of poets and readers than what we see traditionally offered by graduate writing programs and the American literary community at large. Our community extends through The Bridge, a unique online network connecting poets and mentors throughout the world—a project we successfully funded on Indiegogo in 2013.

Since our inception in 2012, our core program of small, intensive poetry workshops taught by award-winning poets in their own homes has served over 300 students and employed over 30 teachers, and we’ve grown to host 22 events per year attracting over 1000 attendees annually, fostering a more close-knit, homegrown, diverse community of poets and readers than what we see traditionally offered by graduate writing programs and the American literary community at large. Our community extends through The Bridge, a unique online network connecting poets and mentors throughout the world—a project we successfully funded on Indiegogo in 2013.

story:
As SHE IS ONE nears publication, I am launching two special offers for readers interested in being the first to get this amazing new book and going more in depth into its subject matter, together with me.

For a limited time only, you can get a signed copy of my book for $22, which is a special opportunity to receive a personalized copy for your collection.

In addition, I will be launching an online book club for those who want to explore the themes of the book - together with me - in greater depth. For $33, you will receive the signed copy of the book as well as membership in this special book club group on Facebook. We will have interactive, in-depth discussions about the book and share feedback about the overall themes and content.

I am extremely excited to provide you with these two special offers, which will allow us to engage the book together on a personal level. The signed copy and book club provide a connected, compelling way to explore the book's content, while supporting efforts to bring this much-needed healing into the world. 

Quite simply, I have written the book that I myself wished to find when I was deep in the throes of my own healing process. I feel it has tremendous potential for others to connect and find healing through its extremely honest and potent revelations.

Thank you again for your support and I look forward to walking this exciting and important path with you. Together, we rise. <3

Sara Sophia Eisenman

story:
My goal of $6,000 has been reached! Thank you to everyone who made this possible.

I am excited to announce that all orders from this point on will be donated to the Canal Alliance, a nonprofit that empowers and uplifts immigrant communities in Marin County. Pre-order now while DONATING to a GREAT cause: https://canalalliance.org/

 

Story of My Book

Consequences of Flight is a collection of poems about grief, identity, and becoming a young woman in 21st-century America.

My name is Pei Ja Anderson and I am the author of Consequences of Flight. I wrote this book because I wanted to write a memoir about my experiences as a young, adopted, Asian-American woman in different forms of poetry.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that our childhood experiences shape us into the adults we become. I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for self-discovery. And ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you understand how grief impacts individuals and influences the people they become.

In this book, you'll learn about young adulthood and the reality of mourning in poems such as:

  • "To all the Starbucks employees I never loved"
  • "I wonder if my parents were good communists"
  • "When I left home for college and found myself in a dorm room of three strangers, in a part of California I didn’t recognize, I thought of you. September is the end of summer."

You will love this book if you like collections of poetry that deal with identity and coming of age.
Consequences of Flight is a poetry book that speaks to young women and victims of loss who are looking at adulthood and self-worth for the first time.

The Book - Consequences of Flight

The book is written in 3 Parts.

Part 1: "Wake" includes an epigraph by Joan Didion: "Life changes in the instant. The ordinary instant." You will learn about death, loss, family, and grief. The central story concerns the death of my brother from an undetected heart arrhythmia.

Part 2: "Shake" includes an epigraph by Pablo Neruda: "I want to do with you what spring does to the cherry trees." This section focuses on young womanhood and explores the roles of being a daughter, sister, friend, and lover. Specifically, the climate of "modern love" and intimacy.

Part 3: "Settle" includes an epigraph by Donte Simmons: "I am a quiet becoming. A better me is on the way." This section includes poems about independence and identity. It includes a poem about struggling with accepting a non-Western name as well as a story about the relationship with my mother.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2020.

  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

About the Author

Pei Ja Anderson studies Writing & Literature with a focus in creative nonfiction and poetry at UC Santa Barbara. She has been published in several literary magazines, including Laurel Moon at Brandeis University and the Mochila Review at Western Missouri State University.

Pei Ja wrote this book because she wants to help people understand the brevity and depth of loss and to hopefully provide a voice for those who are unable to articulate their experience with mourning. Pei Ja is curious about self-exploration and how identity informs our values and beliefs.

Pei Ja is originally from the Bay Area and is minoring in French and Journalism.

For more information, you can connect with Pei Ja at peijaanderson@gmail.com or on social media: @peijaanderson on Instagram.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ConsequencesOfFlight and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Pei Ja Anderson

story:
What is this book about?

Hi! We’re a group of impassioned Peruvian women (and one man!) who believe the stories we tell our children matter. Too often, children’s books tell history from a single vantage point, and don’t include diverse voices and ethnic groups. We’re here to change that.

Heroínas Afroperuanas is our fourth children’s book, and is the first book dedicated solely to the stories of Afroperuvian women who contributed immensely to Peru's cultural diversity, and for forward movement of their communities. 

This book celebrates the stories of Afroperuvian women, and gives representation to a group that has been historically and contemporarily marginalized, left out, and unheard, socially, economically and politically. Through the stories of different Afroperuvian women throughout history, this book teaches young children about courage, morality, and the ability to create change in their communities and their own world. 

Why did we create this book?

We created this book because no book like this exists in Latin America. 

We believe that representation matters. We want to tell our children stories that are full of diversity, in both gender and ethnicity, that will help raise them in a world that values everyone's contributions, capacity and abilities. A diverse world is a stronger and safer world. 

In Peru, the Afroperuvian community has suffered the most marginalization and oppression on behalf of Peruvian society and politics. Of course, the marginalization and oppression of black communities and of the African diaspora is not unique to Peru: we see it everywhere throughout the Americas. 

By telling stories of triumph of individuals in this community, we hope to challenge this narrative of marginalization and raise awareness of the many heroes their community is composed of, while giving young Afroperuvian boys and girls a book that represents them and their ancestors.  

We believe that bringing voice to the African diaspora is important, and connects us to a larger, global movement of social change and equality. 

Who is this book for?

This book is for everyone! 

While designed for children, it’s created in a way where everyone can learn, whether you’re a parent, an auntie, a big brother, a librarian, an activist, or anything in between. If you’re a human who believes in cultural diversity, this book is for you. 

And while we focus on the Peruvian context, this book isn’t only for Peruvians. The African diaspora is vast and diverse, and we hope that Heroínas Afroperuanas will be a catalyst to spark a broader conversation on the celebration of all black and brown voices, particularly the voices of women.

We are proud to be creating the first children’s book that is solely dedicated to celebrating Afroperuvian culture and history.

What We Need & What You Get

We're looking to raise $16,000 for the research, writing, illustrations, production and printing of this book. We put our money where our values are. 

All Heroínas Peruanas' materials are produced employing fair wages, and are printed using local, Peruvian companies. For Heroínas Afroperuanas, we have gathered a panel of amazing Afroperuanx individuals–activists, academics, educators and community leaders–to direct the trajectory of the book. This team worked together to choose the women to be featured, conducted the appropriate research to learn about their lives, created the content, and supervised the book’s overall direction. A young Afroperuana illustrator, Shana Arteaga, has made all of the illustrations for the book. 

This is their book. A book that celebrates their history, their ancestors, their community, and an opportunity for the youth to see empowering stories of people who look like them. 

This is a book made by Afroperuanxs, and we're ready to share it with the world. Heroínas Peruanas has provided the allyship in the production of the book by leading the administration, logistics, editing and printing of the book.

Once the book is available for sale, a percentage of the proceeds of all book sales will go to Afroperuvian initiatives, selected by the Afroperuvian panel. 

The breakdown of our budget is as follows:

Salaries: Executive Team (Afroperuana panel): $6,322 – 40%

Editorial Edition: $500 – 3%

Management and Operations: $5,000 – 31%

Marketing: $2,500 – 16%

Printing: $1,653 – 10%

If we are unable to meet our fundraising goal, the first money will be designated to paying the Afroperuvian panel that worked hard and long to make this book happen. 

 

Who we are, why you should support us, and our Impact to date:

Heroínas Peruanas is a Peruvian nonprofit organization that promotes gender equality, interculturality, human rights, active citizenship and the promotion of literacy among Peruvian youth. We produce books, educational materials, collaborative workshops and multimedia, interdisciplinary pedagogical guides, and utilize a ‘buy one, give one’ model to expand our impact to underserved communities throughout Peru. 

Founded by two Peruvian women who noticed that there were little to no children stories that promoted women’s empowerment and cultural empowerment in the local Peruvian context, Heroínas Peruanas uses educational materials to combat machismo, gender inequality and a lack of diverse voices and representation in Peruvian society and history. We do this primarily through telling the stories of unsung, diverse, women heroes (heroínas) throughout Peruvian history. A model that resonates with cultures and countries the world over, we imagine Heroínas ‘chapters’ (pun intended!) all over the world, starting soon with Heroínas Paraguayas.

We believe deeply that when children are shown stories that display empowerment, courage, morality and agency, particularly when the heroines of those stories look like them, we reinforce to our children that they can be change makers in their communities, too. 

Our impact to date:

  • Publication of 3 children’s books, Heroínas Peruanas Vol. I and Heroínas Peruanas Vol. II, and Micaela Bastidas story
  • Translations into English, Quechua and French
  • Distribution of over 10,000 educational materials to underserved youth in 15 regions in Peru
  • Grant recipient of UNESCO to launch a Heroínas Peruanas project with indigenous communities in Sarhua 
  • Grant recipient from US Embassy in Peru for Heroínas Paraguayas project 
  • Publication of 2 extra educational materials, including; a coloring book and memory card game
  • Featured partner of Peru’s Ministry of Education ‘Aprenda en casa’ (‘learn from home’) campaign during the COVID-19 pandemic

Timeline of the Campaign
