story:
La Novela

Un cuerpo ensangrentado a las puertas del único hotel de Portolara. Todo parece reducir el suceso a un accidente laboral o a un suicido, pero su muerte encierra mucho más en un pequeño pueblo pesquero al que prácticamente la mayoría de sus habitantes se les relaciona con el narcotráfico. Tras un minucioso estudio de la escena del crimen surgen las primeras dudas y comienza una particular lucha contra la idiosincrasia de un pueblo afincado en la más absoluta apatía... «Ha muerto, sí, como todos lo haremos algún día».

Hasta el individuo más idiota puede parecer inteligente.

El Autor

J. J. M. Veiga (Pontevedra), tras sus incursiones en el fantástico y la ciencia ficción con Las Montañas del Olvido y El reflejo dorado, se adentró con Cuando el destino nos alcance el maíz seguirá creciendo en la narrativa de género, una novela aclamada por la crítica especializada y que ha recibido las mejores calificaciones: «un soplo de aire fresco», «brillante», «obra maestra», «en la mejor tradición de la novela negra».

La apatía de los idiotas es su nueva novela, en la que continúa indagando en las claves y formas narrativas de la literatura de género.

Una muestra

«Amancio, al que todos apodaban el Topógrafo, se cruzó con Ramiro minutos antes del suceso en la puerta del hotel. Más tarde afirmaría que había notado algo anormal, tanto en su mirada triste como en la forma de caminar,  incluso habló de una sombra extraña que le acompañaba, de la que llegó a afirmar que era la Marta Eirabella, la hermana de Ramiro, muerta ocho años atrás. Pero al margen de cuestiones sobrenaturales u otras ciencias, si realmente pudo predecir que Ramiro iba a encontrarse con la muerte, lo cierto es que no hizo nada por evitarlo.
          Reinaldo en cambio, que lo conocía desde que era un niño, también coincidió con él ese día, pero no percibió nada raro, simplemente vio a un hombre atormentado por el pasado, uno del que era partícipe y en cierta medida responsable, cosa que tampoco le quitaba el sueño.
          Nieves fue la única persona que lo vio caer desde la azotea del hotel en el que trabajaba, poco después de saludar al Inglés, que fue el segundo en ver el cuerpo ensangrentado sobre la acera. Ramiro se estampó contra ella justo cuando el Inglés iba a entrar en la carnicería de Braulio Barreiro. Digamos que tuvo la fortuna por unos segundos o bien por un par de metros, tal vez por ambos factores, de no haber sido aplastado por él. Ya Einstein anticipó la ligazón entre el espacio y el tiempo, su curvatura, una consecuencia de la gravedad, la cual fue sin duda la causa final de la muerte de Ramiro, aunque no la inicial, pues ésta tenía esencialmente raíces en la ciencia de la psicología.
          Ramiro siempre anheló ser un hombre libre, ese día lo consiguió. Quiso el destino, o concretamente una parte interesada, que su muerte fuese considerada inicialmente como un accidente de la naturaleza».

El Objetivo

En esta campaña preventa nos hemos propuesto alcanzar el equivalente a 55 reservas, es decir, 880€, recibiendo quienes participen el libro en su casa sin gastos de envío (en España) antes de que entre en circulación... existiendo incluso la opción de reservar el libro con tu nombre en los agradecimientos por un poco más del precio de venta, como detalle exclusivo.

También, usando la opción BACK IT, podéis realizar donaciones a la edición; opción a través de la cual no se os pedirá dirección de envío porque no conlleva contraprestación de ningún tipo.

Media

Por otro lado, independientemente de que colaboréis realizando vuestra reserva o no, en ocasiones no se puede, sería una inestimable ayuda que os hicieseis eco de esta campaña a través del boca-oreja o por redes sociales... la Cultura, Distrito 93 y J.J.M. Veiga os lo agradeceremos.

Mil gracias por haberos tomado la molestia de leer toda esta información.
story_txt:
La Novela
Un cuerpo ensangrentado a las puertas del único hotel de Portolara. Todo parece reducir el suceso a un accidente laboral o a un suicido, pero su muerte encierra mucho más en un pequeño pueblo pesquero al que prácticamente la mayoría de sus habitantes se les relaciona con el narcotráfico. Tras un minucioso estudio de la escena del crimen surgen las primeras dudas y comienza una particular lucha contra la idiosincrasia de un pueblo afincado en la más absoluta apatía... «Ha muerto, sí, como todos lo haremos algún día».
Hasta el individuo más idiota puede parecer inteligente.
El Autor
J. J. M. Veiga (Pontevedra), tras sus incursiones en el fantástico y la ciencia ficción con Las Montañas del Olvido y El reflejo dorado, se adentró con Cuando el destino nos alcance el maíz seguirá creciendo en la narrativa de género, una novela aclamada por la crítica especializada y que ha recibido las mejores calificaciones: «un soplo de aire fresco», «brillante», «obra maestra», «en la mejor tradición de la novela negra».
La apatía de los idiotas es su nueva novela, en la que continúa indagando en las claves y formas narrativas de la literatura de género.
Una muestra
«Amancio, al que todos apodaban el Topógrafo, se cruzó con Ramiro minutos antes del suceso en la puerta del hotel. Más tarde afirmaría que había notado algo anormal, tanto en su mirada triste como en la forma de caminar,  incluso habló de una sombra extraña que le acompañaba, de la que llegó a afirmar que era la Marta Eirabella, la hermana de Ramiro, muerta ocho años atrás. Pero al margen de cuestiones sobrenaturales u otras ciencias, si realmente pudo predecir que Ramiro iba a encontrarse con la muerte, lo cierto es que no hizo nada por evitarlo.          Reinaldo en cambio, que lo conocía desde que era un niño, también coincidió con él ese día, pero no percibió nada raro, simplemente vio a un hombre atormentado por el pasado, uno del que era partícipe y en cierta medida responsable, cosa que tampoco le quitaba el sueño.          Nieves fue la única persona que lo vio caer desde la azotea del hotel en el que trabajaba, poco después de saludar al Inglés, que fue el segundo en ver el cuerpo ensangrentado sobre la acera. Ramiro se estampó contra ella justo cuando el Inglés iba a entrar en la carnicería de Braulio Barreiro. Digamos que tuvo la fortuna por unos segundos o bien por un par de metros, tal vez por ambos factores, de no haber sido aplastado por él. Ya Einstein anticipó la ligazón entre el espacio y el tiempo, su curvatura, una consecuencia de la gravedad, la cual fue sin duda la causa final de la muerte de Ramiro, aunque no la inicial, pues ésta tenía esencialmente raíces en la ciencia de la psicología.          Ramiro siempre anheló ser un hombre libre, ese día lo consiguió. Quiso el destino, o concretamente una parte interesada, que su muerte fuese considerada inicialmente como un accidente de la naturaleza».
El Objetivo
En esta campaña preventa nos hemos propuesto alcanzar el equivalente a 55 reservas, es decir, 880€, recibiendo quienes participen el libro en su casa sin gastos de envío (en España) antes de que entre en circulación... existiendo incluso la opción de reservar el libro con tu nombre en los agradecimientos por un poco más del precio de venta, como detalle exclusivo.
También, usando la opción BACK IT, podéis realizar donaciones a la edición; opción a través de la cual no se os pedirá dirección de envío porque no conlleva contraprestación de ningún tipo.
Media
Por otro lado, independientemente de que colaboréis realizando vuestra reserva o no, en ocasiones no se puede, sería una inestimable ayuda que os hicieseis eco de esta campaña a través del boca-oreja o por redes sociales... la Cultura, Distrito 93 y J.J.M. Veiga os lo agradeceremos.
Mil gracias por haberos tomado la molestia de leer toda esta información.

story:
Story of My Book

Play to Learn: How to Use Video Games to Learn a New Language 

As the title suggests the book is about learning using video games. In this book, I mention the benefits, applications, and concerns of video games. I cited research on how students learn a new language in situations when an educator is present or absent and supplement them with real gameplay examples and personal experiences if possible. Lastly, I give the readers my view on how to set goals and choose games to learn a new language.

My name is Tianshi and I am the author of Play to Learn: How to Use Video Games to Learn a New Language. I wrote this book because I want to share my experience of learning a language with video games.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how to learn a new language with video games along with teaching theories. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement I have for video games and education in you. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you become a better language learner.

In this book, you'll learn about video games and language learning theories:

Personal gameplay experience with video games

Research on language learning in both self and classroom settings using video games.

Detailed and personal verified steps to guide you to learn a new language using video games as a tool

You will love this book if you are a gamer, language learner, or educator.

Play to Learn: How to Use Video Games to Learn a New Language is a non-fiction book that speaks to video game players and language learners who are looking at video games and language learning for the first time.

 

The Book - Play to Learn: How to Use Video Games to Learn a New Language

The book is written in Five Parts....

Part [1] contains the introduction + general background of video games.

It introduces the detailed genre and platform of video games along with what video games do to keep player engaged and motivated. I mention nine genres of games defined by Griffiths in 1996, and mention in detail what is intrinsic and extrinsic motivation and how video games using those features to keep us motivated with many gameplay examples.

Part [2] contains Chapters [3-5]. These three chapters mention how video games do not cause violence and addiction, despite people’s negative perceptions on them. This is something easy to controlled, the benefits of using video games in language learning are discussed along with many education institutions, corporations, and organizations are still utilizing video games in their works. I tell of a notorious “internet addiction camp” in China where parents willingly send their uncooperative child to get rid of “addiction” and “bad habits” which, I believe, is just an excuse for their bad parenting.

Part [3] contains Chapters [6-8]. This part starts to show how educators could use video games in their own teaching. This sections starts by mentioning similar concept edutainment and then gradually moving to researchers and case studies in relevant fields of how teachers implement video games into their own class and help student to learn language and other subjects, also citing case studies done without a teacher. In such studies, it was found that just by playing games, the student’s language proficiency increased.

Part [4] contains Chapters [9-12]. The goal of this section is to show readers how to set goals with different language proficiency, how to choose video games to learn a new language, and share some of my own experience of using video games to learn English and reach rather high proficiency. In these chapters, I mention how to use education standards as a guide for your goals. To prove this method is feasible to different people and languages, I set myself a very tight schedule in an on-going semester and play games for a short time everyday within a month to learn Spanish, and I think I’m already starting to understand the basics of it.

Part [5] contains Chapters [13]. The conclusion. Where I briefly summarize the entire book.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author


Tianshi Hao is currently a student who is working on getting a Master of Arts in Teaching degree at USC (expect to graduate in Nov, 2020).

When I was young I was very interested into language learning I discovered I can talk to different native speakers in video games. After I was enrolled in a graduate education program at USC, I found video games has the potential of being an object to study or teaching from, I want to share my experience and results with others.

I am an avid gamer since elementary school, although I play extensively but I never miss social life - I use game as a way to make and connect my friends and asking them to go outside. At the same time, I managed not to miss class in university and get not the best - but some decent grades.

For more information you can connect with Tianshi Hao at tianshih@usc.edu or haots2308@gmail.com and tianshi_hao on instagram.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #PlayToLearn #videogamelearning and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Tianshi Hao

story:
Story of My Book

People with Impostor Syndrome are successful. Even if they can't internalize their achievements, they have personal characteristics inherent to Impostor Syndrome that actually enable their success. The Swan Effect explains what these characteristics are, how to leverage them in the Digital Age, and why feeling like an "impostor" is the start to your own success story.

The Swan Effect: Thriving with Impostor Syndrome in the Digital Age explores how technology, specifically social media, has impacted identity creation and prompted Impostor Syndrome in many individuals. Impostor Syndrome is characterized by feelings of self-doubt when someone believes that their own successes are due to luck or good timing rather than their own capabilities. This book explains the “Impostor Advantage”, or the key advantages of being an “impostor” in the Digital Age as the ways in which we work evolve due to innovation, and companies seek to build a workforce of people who can adapt and excel in these changes.

Hello! My name is Caroline and I am the author of The Swan Effect. I wrote this book with the intention of sharing what I have learned about harnessing Impostor Syndrome and developing the Impostor Advantage through research into psychological studies, the interviews that I have conducted, and my own personal experiences. Much of the discourse on Impostor Syndrome explains how to overcome feeling like an "impostor," but it does not explain why people with Impostor Syndrome are successful, even if they cannot internalize their own success.

Impostor Syndrome is experienced by 70 percent of people at some point in their lives, usually during life milestones or transition periods such as starting a new job or graduate school. These are points when someone may question whether they truly deserve the next step or if the admissions officer or hiring manager has made a mistake. Though Impostor Syndrome can be experienced at any age, with so many major milestones and new life experiences that occur between the ages of 20 to 30, it makes sense why this decade is extremely vulnerable to the impostor phenomenon. This is increased by social media because of the pressure to display achievements and qualifications online. I was compelled to write this book because I wanted to start a discussion on a topic that is not often openly discussed because people usually don’t want to admit that they are feeling like an impostor. I wanted to further explore how technology has impacted Impostor Syndrome and why people who experience it have been successful in the Digital Age.

I hope that this book will shift the narrative on how we look at Impostor Syndrome and provide clarity on the inherent advantages to feeling like an “impostor.” We are in a time where the tenets of Impostor Syndrome have become invaluable assets to individuals working in the Digital Age. It is no longer a syndrome, but an advantage to success in the world of smart machines and automation because the personal characteristics innate to having Impostor Syndrome are irreplaceable by technology.

You will want to read this book if:

  • You have ever thought to yourself “How did I get here?” when you were stepping into a new office or onto a new campus because you questioned whether the hiring manager or admissions officer made a mistake
  • You would like to learn more about Impostor Syndrome and the associated personal characteristics that enable workplace success in the Digital Age
  • You would like to explore how technology and social media have impacted how we form our identities and how we think about our own qualifications and achievements

This book will ultimately show you why having and leveraging your own Impostor Syndrome is key to unlocking success professionally and personally in the Digital Age.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a signed copy of my book with a personalized message when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Caroline Ritter is a consultant with experience in strategy and business transformation, project management, and risk in the financial services industry. She has assisted senior executives at Fortune 500 financial institutions in navigating their unique challenges in complex business and regulatory environments.

Caroline wrote this book to share her own experiences and encounters with Impostor Syndrome while working in a field driven by technology. She hopes to help others with similar experiences see how they can also create the Impostor Advantage and reach their full potential in a world where it’s becoming normal to feel “unqualified” due to rapid innovation and increasing pressure to post achievements online.

Outside of consulting and writing, Caroline can be found creating elaborate charcuterie boards, doing some sort of art project, trying new recipes, and running after her Golden Retriever, Pax.

For more information, you can connect with Caroline Ritter at car237@georgetown.edu and on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/car237/. 
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheSwanEffect and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your support! 

Thanks again, 

Caroline Ritter

story:
Barry! A Citizen Blogger's Commentary on the 44th President

In the summer of 2013, I drafted a list of affirmations; one of them was to "Finish what I started." In 2010 I decided to write a book of poetry and essays, which included a chapter on President Barack Obama. Now three years later driven by the power of my affirmations, I am on the verge of finishing the book. My book offers what I call a "Citizen Bloggers'" perspective on the 44th President. Barry! Is a book that is fair and balanced, it offers praise when necessary, criticism when deserved, but also looks at the historic rise of Barack Obama through the lens of history, comparing him to former Presidents Jimmy Carter, and Lyndon Johnson as it appeared he was headed for a "One and Done" term.

I also viewed President Obama through the lens of what I see as the eroding power of the President in my blog The Emasculated POTUS. In 2012, I urged him to bring "fire" to the 2012 Democratic National Convention with a blog titled “Fire Next Time, and after his disastrous first debate, I suggested that President Obama was “Throwing the election, not “Blowing” it.  applauded his remarks in the aftermath of the George Zimmerman verdict. Finally it was impossible to discuss the Obama Presidency without discussing race, as I did often including my 2012 blog where I wrote the GOP 2012 strategy was reduced to “Blame the Black Guy”. While my words are mine, the photos that I want to add to the project are not.

This IndieGoGo Project is to assist me in purchasing photos like the one with then candidate Senator Obama in my home town in St. Louis, as well as other iconic photos that mark both the 2008 and 2012 campaigns and his first term. My book goes to publication in late December, it is my hope to include between 1 - 15 copyrighted photo files with the submission.  Finally a note about the importance of this project, as I mentioned completing this book allows me not only to complete what I started, but this book helps to serve notice of a new voice is clamoring to be heard, a voice that speaks  to a larger narrative of individual and community empowerment, social justice, political awareness, and the need to follow one’s passion. This book project is one of many ways I am introducing myself to the larger public. I appreciate those who decide to be a part of this process.

Phillip W. Johnson

October 24, 2013

story:
Cancer's Not Funny...

My name is Catheryn Brockett. 

I am an actor and writer living in Los Angeles.  In the spring of 2011 I was diagnosed with breast cancer.  Here's an understatement; cancer sucks.  It's scary, it's gross, it's heartbreaking, lonely and absurd...  

At first I didn't want to talk about it.  I couldn't even say the word.  It was, I don't know  private, embarrassing, and pretty much a conversation killer.  I looked around for other women to tell me their stories, I wanted to hear the truth about what they went through, about life with cancer.

"Stories can conquer fear you know, they can make the heart larger." Ben Okri

... and then, well - I'm an actor, a comedian for Pete's sake - and things just kept happening...

"We're not laughing at the cancer - we're laughing at you."  

How could I not tell the story...

  • About how during reconstruction - I ended up with one 600cc boob? (yes, that's the size of a bowling ball, a baby's head.. and my other remained an unenthusiastic 'b.' I called them Porn Boob and Sad Banana) and it was inflatable!
  • About working as an actor during this time to keep my insurance eligibility and having a wardrobe girl (after discovering she could not dress me in a halter top) ask me, "was it elective?"
  • About having to tell my date I had cancer?!  (you sure you don't want another glass of wine?)
  • About sleeping on my couch for two years (first it was medical, then it was mental).
  • About deciding to have a bilateral mastectomy after all and about how that felt brave and cowardly all at the same time.

So, I started a blog.  CancerCation

“I read the entire cancercation story…enthralled, inspired, in tears, and…in prayer. Keep blogging and keep healing!”

And I started telling my stories out loud. 

“This touched my heart. Made me cry. Too many people I love or are close to have been afflicted by this. This is a brave and honest report of breast cancer." 

So now I want to turn these stories into a book - and here's what I need the money for.

Cancer is expensive, and I've used up all my "mad money" on silly things like copays and gauze...   I have a unique opportunity over the next several months to work with a writing coach and turn my blog into a book, a full length memoir!  It's an expensive undertaking and that's where I need your help.

  • Editing/Writing services $5,000.00
  • Cover Design $850.00 - $2,000.00
  • Interior $700.00 - $1,200.00
  • Publicity $1,000.00 - $5,000.00
  • Web Support/Design $800.00 - $3,500.00

I would love to get a traditional publisher, and if that happens I will only have to pay for the editing/writing services and publicity (it's true, publishers don't pay for your publicity!) In this case I will donate 30% of all Indiegogo funds over $5,000.00 to Team H.O.P.E. and Pink Lotus.  Cool? Anybody want to be my publisher?

One in eight women will get breast cancer.  

I tell you this not to scare you, just know that when you look around a crowded room, there is someone who is affected by this disease and it can be hard to talk about. From my own personal experience, I still feel a weird taboo.  In publishing my memoir I hope to reach people with my story and either inspire them to tell their own, or at least remind them that in the darkest moments there is always the potential to laugh as well as cry. * 

PERKIE PERK REWARDS! - PERKIE PERK REWARDS! - PERK REWARDS!

Check out what I've come up with to thank you!  Any contribution over $15.00 gets you a funny pin up postcard of my new girls (very rated G) Haven't you always wondered what a $486,000.00 boob job looks like!?  At different reward levels I will also come and speak at your event, tell stories or keynote  - and there will be a number of limited edition mini blog books, which are stinkin' cute!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a donation at this time, no worries!  Please pass this along to your friends and family and share it on your Facebook and Twitter accounts and all of those fancy social media things.  Also use the Indiegogo share tools on this site to help spread the word, tell my story.  Thank you so very very much!

"We are lonesome animals. We spend all of our life trying to be less lonesome. One of our ancient methods is to tell a story begging the listener to say-and to feel- ‘Yes, that is the way it is, or at least that is the way I feel it.’ You’re not as alone as you thought."  John Steinbeck

*Given the choice to laugh or cry, I choose laughter every time (but sometimes you're not given a choice, and in that case, I say cry like a big fat baby!)

Thank you!  Truly!

Catheryn J. Brockett

"From there to here and here to there, funny things are everywhere!"  Theodor Geisel

story:
The Settlement House American Poetry Prize acknowledges the importance of the immigrant legacy and potential as a force for social justice, tolerance and goodwill in the United States.

Initiated in 2014, the Settlement House American Poetry Prize includes publication by Settlement House of a collection of poems in English by a first-generation American (including both immigrants and children born of immigrants to the United States.) The inaugural recipient of the award is Alicia Partnoy for her book Flowering Fires/Fuegos florales, translated into English by the poet Gail Wronsky.

The Prize alternates annually between a book written in the language of a poet’s ancestry and translated into English and a collection of poems written in English. The 2015 award will honor a book written in English and will include a cash stipend and a standard publishing contract.

Your support will help defray publishing and distribution costs of Flowering Fires / Fuegos Florales as well as publication costs for the Settlement House American Poetry Prize first open competition in 2015. In addition, we hope to offer two free copies of each winning collection to the more than 100 active settlement and neighborhood houses in the United States. (Note: We are not a settlement house and have no such affiliation.)  Please visit our blog. 

                                                                    WHO WE ARE                                     

                             

Settlement House is an independent book publisher founded in 2007. We take our name from the settlement houses of the late 19th, 20th and current centuries that continue to provide community through their social and cultural support and service to the urban poor and immigrant populations. In that spirit, we think of ourselves as a home for some of the fine—and frequently disparate—voices of poetry deserving of greater readership today . Please visit our website.

                                                              

                            from FLOWERING FIRES/FUEGOS FLORALES
                                                            by ALICIA PARTNOY

     Rapid Eye Movements

Sometimes in dreams

we encounter a man

or  a woman from the past.

We make love to them

by mistake

fervently.

We talk to them about things

that ought to matter to them

now.


What betrays them

is the excessive enthusiasm

or the excessive sadness of their bodies.

What betrays us

is this foolish insistence on the present.

In any case,

they almost always respond

as if nothing had . . .

as if nothing.                             

                                  English translation   by   GAIL WRONSKY

                                                                                             

                                   

                            A FEW FIRST GENERATION AMERICAN POETS

As far back as Emma Lazarus, the voices of first generation American poets have been a vital and influential force in American literature.  .  .  . 

                   SANDRA CISNEROS       PHILIP LEVINE

         WILLIAM CARLOS WILLIAMS     MAY SARTON                AND .  .  .  Carl Sandburg * Anthony Hecht * Josephine Jacobsen *  Hillary Tham             Li-Young Lee  * Theodore Roethke  *  Jimmy Santiago Baca *   Andrei Codrescu         Stanley Kunitz * Cathy Song * Louis Simpson *  Garrett Hongo *  Charles Simic   Naomi Shihab Nye * Denise Levertov * Charles Bukowsk * Julia Alvarez   .   .   . 

                                       ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~    

                   THE NEW COLOSSUS                                 

                                                                                                     

Not like the brazen giant of Greek fame,

With conquering limbs astride from land to land;

Here at our sea-washed, sunset gates shall stand

A mighty woman with a torch, whose flame

Is the imprisoned lightning, and her name

Mother of Exiles. From her beacon-hand

Glows world-wide welcome; her mild eyes command

The air-bridged harbor that twin cities frame.

“Keep ancient lands, your storied pomp!” cries she

With silent lips. “Give me your tired, your poor,

Your huddled masses yearning to breathe free,

The wretched refuse of yoiur teeming shore.

Send these, the homeless, tempest-tost to me,

I lift my lamp beside the golden door!”

                                                                                                    

                    —EMMA LAZARUS, 1849-188

                                    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

                   

                               ALL GOOD BOOKS UNDER ONE ROOF


                                                

      WINNER OF THE 2013 NATIONAL JEWISH BOOK AWARD IN POETRY

                                              VISIT OUR CATALOG

                                                                       

                                                   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~

story:
Please follow the

Travels with an African Husky

Blog

for regular updates.



Amy the African Husky                    Copyright JohnBradleyPhotography.com

Extract from the first chapter: 

She looked at me with such pain in her sunken eyes and whispered in a hoarse voice “ I feel so ashamed”.

“Six years ago we said “in sickness and health””. I whispered back, looking into her eyes, stroking her face, still so beautiful in spite of everything, and said as reassuringly as I could, my voice shaking as I fought back the tears, “Nothing is too much trouble. Nothing”. 

We held each other and sobbed. It was the worst moment of my life and hers too I think. 

It was also the best. 

She had become too weak to go to the bathroom on her own and of all the slings and arrows of sickness, this robbing of her dignity was one of the worst for her. 

There was one thing worse. Something that weighed so heavily on her, in spite of her constant efforts to remain positive and strong, and that was the terrible realisation she would not get to see her children grow up. This, of all things, was too painful to bear.

Harriet passed away on April the 3rd 2005. Tilly was a week away from her second birthday and Thomas was not quite five.

   

Harriet and Tilly

__________________________________________

Overview:

Travels with an African Husky is an uplifting true story of an English photographer and his two kids who lose their mother to cancer and adopt an abandoned husky found on the streets of small rural town at the very bottom end of Africa.

It is about loss, love, travel, food, humour and the triumphs and disasters of a man raising two kids. 

And it is about a husky. A beautiful, adorable, naughty, independently-minded husky who mothers two children and a man. 

The book will include a lot of photos from the journey.

This is a dog-centric story, but only to the extent that it provides a thread to bring a lot of disparate non-dog stories together. It is as much a story about love, and my children and the amazing places we have lived in and some extraordinary people.

On a different note, raising kids as a single parent is not easy and, for us, the past few years have presented some difficult financial challenges. So I have to say one of my motivations for writing this book is that it might go some way to feeding my kids (and my dog). I am, however, also concerned that in benefitting from something terrible that happened, it is a bit tactless and I am not showing respect to Harriet and all the people who loved her, but my sense is that she is willing me on to do this. Especially because her soul is also in this book and lives on through her kids.

Harriet and Tilly

Thomas and Harriet
__________________________________________

Another extract from the first chapter:

18 months later we swapped gloomy wet England for a new life in Cape Town, a city so full of light and energy it filled the senses. My face hurt from smiling so much. This was my cue to stop grieving and start living again. And for the kids too. Even Ian and Bertie, the street dogs we bought with us from England, had a new zing in their step.

Ian was a Greyhound German Shepherd mix who was always up to no good, often leaving me to pick up the pieces. Sometimes literally. Like the time he bit the tail off a Greyhound and had a determined go at removing the testicles from her mate. 

The dogs arrived in Cape Town a few days after us. I picked them up from the airport and took them straight to beach. Ian got out of the car and walked purposefully up to two guys lying on the sand. With some trepidation I watched wondering what mischief he was about to do, when, to my astonishment, he cocked his leg and peed on the head of one of them. Mayhem ensued. Especially when Bertie the Jack Russell decided to get in on the excitement by peeing on the guy’s leg as I proffered obsequious apologies. At which point the guy told me to just stop talking and go away. Although, I hope you understand, those were not the actual words he used. He was after all quite cross. And wet.

 

Thomas and Amy at the beach

Images copyright JohnBradleyPhotography.com

__________________________________________

Background:

I am English, but I have spent a lot of my life living in the sunnier parts of the world. 

In 1997, when I lived in London, I met a woman I quite fancied. Her name was Harriet. In fact I fancied her a lot and, I'm pleased to say, she seemed to like me. We got married, bought a small farm, rescued a couple of mad dogs and had two kids. In July 2004 Harriet had a very bad bleed. The next day they found a 7cm tumour on her cervix. Nine months later my wonderful 38 year old wife was dead.

18 months later I closed down my life in England and took my children, dogs and stuff to South Africa where I trained as a photographer at the Cape Town School of Photography.  I did a big project off my own bat where I photographed and interviewed 26 WWII pilots in then-and-now formats. This will be made into a photo book next year. I am also collating images and stories of women pilots who flew for the Soviet Union in WWII.

After Harriet died I kept a diary of sorts - often just hastily written vignettes scribbled down before I fell asleep. Travels with an African Husky has polished extracts from that diary and hopefully leaves out most of the boring, morose, libelous and woe-is-me stuff. And includes some of the interesting, juicy, scandalous and amusing bits. It also includes a lot of the photos of my journey to and from Africa, England, France and Portugal - where we now live.

In April 2015 it will be ten years since Harriet died and I want to mark that anniversary with this book. The race is on to bring together all the bits and pieces, put them into some order and get the book published by that date. You can play a part in this by pledging for one of the perks and for that I shall be hugely grateful. 

Thomas and the horse he befriended.

__________________________________________

Another extract from the first chapter:

She dropped her voice to a purr. “This is not just any dog, you wait until you see it”. I knew I was totally powerless as soon as she started her charm offensive on me.

And so it was, at the bottom end of Africa, at 12h40 on the 26th of February 2011, my life changed forever. I laid eyes for the first time on a very special six month old Siberian Husky. “My word!” I said. “She has the most amazing blue eyes”. I was smitten. This was Amy and this is her story. 

Amy the day we got her.
Image copyright JohnBradleyPhotography.com
__________________________________________

What I Need:

I have set the funding goal at $5000. Based on four quotes I have received this will be enough to get the book printed and cover the costs of printing portraits of Amy for the signed portrait perk.
Please visit the perks section and if there is something there that presses a button for you, I would be delighted if you would make a pledge. I shall personally despatch your signed book or print. 

Amy and Tilly
 

What You Get:

Perks:
The perks are explained in the Perks section, but they include an eBook, a signed hardcopy photo-rich book, and photographic prints with Amy's paw mark. 
What if the funding goal is not reached?
If the funding goal is not reached I shall carry on and do this book anyway, it will just be a whole lot more difficult to get it finished by the anniversary of my wife's death. It also means the printed version may take a lot longer.

The Impact

I hope my book will bring pleasure to people - both the words and the images . They are part of my soul. I hope it will make people laugh (and cry - yes, I want to make you cry!) and, without thrusting it in peoples' faces, get across a couple messages about looking after our health and huskies (explained below). 

Risks & Challenges

The main risks and obstacles to finishing this project are related to time and money. In other words juggling my short term needs to look after my kids and get things done with the book. I am now an old-hand at doing this and I shall continue to carry on as I have.  In fact as my kids are now a bit older, some aspects of looking after them are easier and I have more time to work - particularly when they are at school and after they have gone to bed, which gives me at least eight or nine hours a day to work. 

    Other Ways You Can Help If You Can't Donate Money

    If you can't donate money, there are other ways you can help. I would be really really grateful if you could please use the Indiegogo share tools at the top of the page and tell everyone you know so they also know about the book.

    Hermanus - where we lived for a while and not far from where we found Amy. 
    Image copyright JohnBradleyPhotography.com

    You Can Also Help By

    TELLING EVERYONE YOU KNOW TO STAY UP-TO-DATE WITH THEIR HEALTH CHECKS:

    The book will also gently make the point that we take good health for granted, but the reality is life can be a fragile thing and we should stay up to date with our health checks and make the most of every moment with the people we love.  Please please dwell on these thoughts for a moment and if you or someone you know are behind on your health checks, please fix that right now!

    Tilly with her mad hair on the trampoline.

    You Can Also Help By

    TELLING EVERYONE YOU KNOW THAT HUSKIES CAN BE VERY DIFFICULT TO KEEP AS PETS - YOU NEED TO DO YOUR HOMEWORK BEFORE YOU GET ONE:

    A second gently mooted theme will be to dissuade people from getting a husky as a pet unless they have done their homework and to make mention of the plight of husky rescue charities. Huskies are not for everyone in spite of their widespread appeal stemming from their cute appearance. They are not easy dogs to keep as pets and many are mistreated or abandoned as a result - putting great strain on dog rescue centres. 
       

    The author and Thomas and Tilly.
    Image copyright JohnBradleyPhotography.com
story_txt:
Please follow the

Travels with an African Husky
Blog
for regular updates.



Amy the African Husky                    Copyright JohnBradleyPhotography.com
Extract from the first chapter: 

She looked at me with such pain in her sunken eyes and whispered in a hoarse voice “ I feel so ashamed”.
“Six years ago we said “in sickness and health””. I whispered back, looking into her eyes, stroking her face, still so beautiful in spite of everything, and said as reassuringly as I could, my voice shaking as I fought back the tears, “Nothing is too much trouble. Nothing”. 


We held each other and sobbed. It was the worst moment of my life and hers too I think. 


It was also the best. 


She had become too weak to go to the bathroom on her own and of all the slings and arrows of sickness, this robbing of her dignity was one of the worst for her. 


There was one thing worse. Something that weighed so heavily on her, in spite of her constant efforts to remain positive and strong, and that was the terrible realisation she would not get to see her children grow up. This, of all things, was too painful to bear.


Harriet passed away on April the 3rd 2005. Tilly was a week away from her second birthday and Thomas was not quite five.





   
Harriet and Tilly__________________________________________



Overview:
Travels with an African Husky is an uplifting true story of an English photographer and his two kids who lose their mother to cancer and adopt an abandoned husky found on the streets of small rural town at the very bottom end of Africa.
It is about loss, love, travel, food, humour and the triumphs and disasters of a man raising two kids. 
And it is about a husky. A beautiful, adorable, naughty, independently-minded husky who mothers two children and a man. 
The book will include a lot of photos from the journey.
This is a dog-centric story, but only to the extent that it provides a thread to bring a lot of disparate non-dog stories together. It is as much a story about love, and my children and the amazing places we have lived in and some extraordinary people.
On a different note, raising kids as a single parent is not easy and, for us, the past few years have presented some difficult financial challenges. So I have to say one of my motivations for writing this book is that it might go some way to feeding my kids (and my dog). I am, however, also concerned that in benefitting from something terrible that happened, it is a bit tactless and I am not showing respect to Harriet and all the people who loved her, but my sense is that she is willing me on to do this. Especially because her soul is also in this book and lives on through her kids.


Harriet and Tilly


Thomas and Harriet__________________________________________Another extract from the first chapter:
18 months later we swapped gloomy wet England for a new life in Cape Town, a city so full of light and energy it filled the senses. My face hurt from smiling so much. This was my cue to stop grieving and start living again. And for the kids too. Even Ian and Bertie, the street dogs we bought with us from England, had a new zing in their step.


Ian was a Greyhound German Shepherd mix who was always up to no good, often leaving me to pick up the pieces. Sometimes literally. Like the time he bit the tail off a Greyhound and had a determined go at removing the testicles from her mate. 


The dogs arrived in Cape Town a few days after us. I picked them up from the airport and took them straight to beach. Ian got out of the car and walked purposefully up to two guys lying on the sand. With some trepidation I watched wondering what mischief he was about to do, when, to my astonishment, he cocked his leg and peed on the head of one of them. Mayhem ensued. Especially when Bertie the Jack Russell decided to get in on the excitement by peeing on the guy’s leg as I proffered obsequious apologies. At which point the guy told me to just stop talking and go away. Although, I hope you understand, those were not the actual words he used. He was after all quite cross. And wet.



  Thomas and Amy at the beach
Images copyright JohnBradleyPhotography.com
__________________________________________

story:
THE DARK SIDE OF H1B….Visa

I wanted to introduce my Son’s Book as he had written the experiences he had faced during his time in the United States of America on a work visa.

Summary:

The story begins with an individual entering the United States with a lot of hope and enthusiasm. This individual is the reflection of the average Indian student’s dream to be in America as an IT professional, achieving their destiny. But the writer goes on to explain through his personal experiences that it is not a cake walk, the main hurdle being the practices followed for H1B work visas by consultants and consultancy companies.

How can it impact?

As this book is a cautionary true life story it would help others to understand the Nitti gritty details of the extent consultants go through to place themselves and the methods used by consultancy companies who promote such activities.

This Book explains how people on this path can grab the chances of other appropriate candidates; it also explains the effects of H1B which can impact anyone, native residents as well as immigrants.

Funding:

*The costs associated towards the editing, formatting and designing of the book (Done)
*Funds to market the book on media outlets and social platforms
*Getting some inventory of the books for marketing purposes

Contribution Perks:

Initial copy of the Kindle edition not yet released for all the contributors

Copy of the Kindle edition of this book and my book on Simple Indian Vegan

Links for the books:

The Dark Side Of H1B:

http://www.amazon.com/Dark-Side-H1B-Mr-Kuppa/dp/1500357502/ref=sr_1_8?ie=UTF8&qid=1419395079&sr=8-8&keywords=Kuppa

Simple Indian Vegan:

http://www.amazon.com/SIMPLE-INDIAN-VEGAN-Lakshmy-Kuppa-ebook/dp/B00QBLR5Y6/ref=sr_1_2?ie=UTF8&qid=1419395118&sr=8-2&keywords=simple+indian+vegan

I would sincerely appreciate for all the help, please forward the link to all of your friends.

Thank You.

story:
“The lesson I have to teach is this: Leave all creative energies uninhibited. Merely organize society to act in harmony with this lesson. Let society's legal apparatus remove all obstacles the best it can. Permit these creative know-hows freely to flow. Have faith that free men and women will respond to the Invisible Hand. This faith will be confirmed. I, Pencil, seemingly simple though I am, offer the miracle of my creation as testimony that this is a practical faith, as practical as the sun, the rain, a cedar tree, the good earth.”

— Leonard E. Read, I, Pencil

For us at ReadLiberty.org, Leonard. E. Read's essay I, Pencil was one of the most eyes opening works and a great inspiration for our liberty oriented activities.

To make his life work more accessible for anyone to read, we've decided to publish his whole library in ePub, Mobi, HTML and PDF formats without reserving any rights, making it free for everyone to read, share, edit and sell.

Since we're producing this edition of Leonard E. Read's library for you, it seems right to offer you a chance of becoming a part of this venture.

Starting with Accent On The Right, you can join us in creating this electronic edition of Leonard E. Read's library and influence the final look of the whole library, have your name forever a part of it or get your own edition of the whole library dedicated namely to you.

When Can You Expect the Library?

An early draft version of the first book, Accent On The Right, is already available at http://www.readliberty.org/books/leonard-e-read-accent-on-the-right

As you can see, there's still a lot of work to be done on the cover and formatting of the book. But happy reading anyway.

In What Order Will the Books be Published?

Book Phase of Production
Accent On The Right Published
Anything That's Peaceful Published
Awake For Freedom's Sake Published
Castles In The Air Published
Comes The Dawn In Progress
Coming Aristocracy In Preparation
Deeper Than You Think
Elements of Libertarian Leadership
Free Market And Its Enemy
Freedom Freeway
Government: An Ideal Concept
Having My Way
How Do We Know
Let Freedom Reign
Liberty: Legacy of Truth
Love of Liberty
Path of Duty
Seeds of Progress
Talking To Myself
Then Truth Will Out
Thoughts Rule the World
To Free Or Freeze
Vision
Who's Listening
Why Not Try Freedom

What Do We Need the Funds For?

Leonard E. Read's Pamphlets

Once the whole library is published, a ThunderClap.It campaign for its spreading will be started.

For every five hundred Twitter, Facebook or Thumblr posts above 499 a pamphlet from the list below will be published as a part of the library.

Pamphlet Published Social Media Supporters
Conscience on the Battlefield 999
Endowed by Their Creator 1 499
I, Pencil 1 999
Instead of Violence 2 499
Meditations on Freedom 2 999
Outlook for Freedom 3 499
Pattern for Revolt 3 999
Students of Liberty 4 499
Where Lies This Fault? 4 999

Questions and Answers

Q: What license will be the library subject to?
A: For the original editions of the books and their content, "Permission to reprint granted without special request."

The library as such will be a subject to the CC0 "license". Although you don't have to we'll be thankful if you choose to mark us as the authors of this edition of Leonard E. Read's library and let others to use the work in the same way in case you derive your own work from it. Happy reading, sharing, editing and selling!

Q: Does it mean that I can print and sell the books?
A: Yes, you can! We'd definitely buy the books in a printed form. Just make it clear that we're not printing and selling it. Also if you are selling the books for profit, consider accepting a cryptocurrency of your choice, sharing part of that profit with Foundation for Economic Education or to support our activities at ReadLiberty.org and MiceEatCheese.co.

Q: I'm a libertarian writer and always wanted to write a preface for one of Leonard E. Read's books. Will you include it in the book if I do?
A: Sure, go ahead and write it! In case we like it, we will include it in our edition of the library. Otherwise, you can publish your own edition anytime you want.

Q: Do you accept Bitcoin donations? 
A: Not only we accept Bitcoin donations, but also for every two books fully funded by Bitcoin, we will publish a total of three books from the library of Leonard E. Read, along with the credit "Fully funded by Bitcoin."

In case you'd like to join us in this venture and support us using Bitcoin instead of USD, use one of the Coinbase links below to claim your perk (please don't forget to fill in your contact email or BitMessage address so we can deliver you your chosen perk):

Q: Is there any other way I can help?
A: It would be great if you can spread the word about our venture — The more liberty you share, the more you get.

Since we are not native English speakers, another proofreader is always welcomed. When was the last time you got paid for reading a great book? Let us buy you a beer for proofreading Pattern for Revolt or other books from our edition of Leonard E. Read's Library and reporting typos & major formatting issues. Powered by Bitcoin.

Or find an innovative way of monetizing the final library and making it even more accessible this way.


Thanks for your support.

Cheese, Martin

A MiceEatCheese production.

story:
Dear Ethical Hedonist readers and contributors! Please watch the video above to learn more about this campaign to raise funds for Alison Jane Reid's latest big interview project - an in-depth, inspirational interview and feature on British actress Eleanor Tomlinson, star of the White Queen and Poldark. I am a world-renowned journalist and feature writer. I have interviewed more than 500 icons during an 18-year carer at the top of British journalism on The Times, The Lady, You, Country Life and Mirror Group. My supporting this interview with your donations, you are supporting an inspiring start up magazine devoted to living well sustainably. 

 In this beautifully crafted and thought- provoking interview, leading journalist, Alison Jane, will chart Eleanor's inspiring journey from teenage starlet to leading lady. Alison Jane will examine her great passion for the craft of acting, her remarkable determination to succeed in such a elusive, competitive profession and her rare ability to utterly inhabit the roles she plays. She will examine her seminal film and drama roles and why she is an inspired, clever casting choice for the iconic role of Demelza in Poldark.  ( Please note, Alison Jane already has the interview with Eleanor, you are funding the writing, additional research and creative process).

As well as funding the publishing of this interview, the money raised also includes costs for fulfilling Perks which include: paper, fine art printing, stationery, postage and travel costs.  The budget for the writing and background research for the Eleanor interview is £850. The cost of sending out and the perks and rewards is £300.

Mentoring Young Journalists

Alison Jane mentors undergraduate and graduate trainee journalists - your donations help Ethical Hedonist to grow and support Alison Jane to help the next generation of writers.

These are the wonderful rewards that you will receive for your donations:

Reward 1 -  £3.00 - Coffee for Journalism - Donate the price of a good cup of coffee to a journalist who has informed, captivated &amp; entertained millions of people since she was 24 years old.  Alison Jane has moved online to continue writing - help Alison Jane &amp; Ethical Hedonist, a sustainable SME magazine on culture, luxury and sustainability to thrive and flourish. Everyone who donates will be entered in random draws for giveaways from fashion to DVDs, luxury organic skincare and tickets to  exciting events. Min value £25

Reward 2 -  £10.00 - Exclusive Live Webinar - Donate £10 for a live webinar with Alison Jane Reid within one month of the Eleanor Tomlinson Interview being published on The Ethical Hedonist. Alison Jane will discuss the interview and her own career as a leading feature writer with fans. Also includes a social media shout-out.

Reward 3 -  £15.00 – Iconic, Collectable, Fashion Postcard Print - Donate £15 for a postcard print of Eleanor Tomlinson from Alison Jane's iconic Queen's Jubilee fashion feature published by The Lady Magazine, with photography by celebrated fashion photographer Mike Owen – plus your name and a thank you at the end of the story on EH! Also includes a social media shout-out and the exclusive live webinar.

Reward 4 - £25.00 - Keepsake Printed Interview - Donate £25 for a keepsake printed copy of the Eleanor interview, hand-tied with ribbons and signed and dated by Alison Jane Reid. Also includes a social media shout-out and the exclusive live webinar.

Reward 5 - £60 - 2 Tickets to an Exclusive Art Show - Do you yearn to be a patron of the arts? From rare antiquities to abstract art, design and twinkling jewelled masterpieces, don't miss your passport to a world that acts like a  glittering showcase for the art and craftsmanship of the world's greatest artisans. Snap up two tickets now to the collecting event of the season - The Masterpiece Show in London - where you can immerse yourself in marvellous, inspirational talks - soak up the bet advice, and then invest in gems from the world's most sought after luminaries. Also includes a social media shout-out and the exclusive live webinar - so the combined value is priceless!

Reward 6 -£ 50 - Luxury Goody Hamper – Donate £50 for an Ethical Hedonist surprise goody hamper, worth over £100! Featuring a selection of organic and natural skincare products, foody surprises, tickets to shows and/or fashion, jewellery and accessories, personalized according to gender. Also includes a social media shout-out and the exclusive live webinar.

Reward 7 - £55.00 - Donate £55 and you get your hands on the gorgeous boudoir set  -  fabulous Lancaster and Cornish 'Eleanor, retro' knickers and an organic cotton cushion worth £70 (both pictured below). They are made in Cornwall where Poldark is filmed - Amazing! We'll also give you a special shout-out on social media as a thank you!

Reward 8 - £150 - Signed Prints of Eleanor - Donate £150 for each limited-edition, fine art, iconic fashion print from Alison Jane's Lady Magazine Queen's Jubilee Fashion Story with Eleanor Tomlinson wearing British couture by Lucy Tamman. We have two prints to give away, which will be signed by Alison Jane and specially created by celebrated fashion photographer Mike Owen! Also includes a social media shout-out and the exclusive live webinar.

Thank you!
story_txt: Dear Ethical Hedonist readers and contributors! Please watch the video above to learn more about this campaign to raise funds for Alison Jane Reid's latest big interview project - an in-depth, inspirational interview and feature on British actress Eleanor Tomlinson, star of the White Queen and Poldark. I am a world-renowned journalist and feature writer. I have interviewed more than 500 icons during an 18-year carer at the top of British journalism on The Times, The Lady, You, Country Life and Mirror Group. My supporting this interview with your donations, you are supporting an inspiring start up magazine devoted to living well sustainably.  In this beautifully crafted and thought- provoking interview, leading journalist, Alison Jane, will chart Eleanor's inspiring journey from teenage starlet to leading lady. Alison Jane will examine her great passion for the craft of acting, her remarkable determination to succeed in such a elusive, competitive profession and her rare ability to utterly inhabit the roles she plays. She will examine her seminal film and drama roles and why she is an inspired, clever casting choice for the iconic role of Demelza in Poldark.  ( Please note, Alison Jane already has the interview with Eleanor, you are funding the writing, additional research and creative process).As well as funding the publishing of this interview, the money raised also includes costs for fulfilling Perks which include: paper, fine art printing, stationery, postage and travel costs.  The budget for the writing and background research for the Eleanor interview is £850. story:
Our Idea

Buffalo is a great arts town. We have over twenty working theaters, major galleries, the historic poetry program at UB, live music, independent painters and sculptors galore.

But there is one major hole in our scene: literary events.

Every year, we get a few big names that come through town. But regular authors - who write the books that people pick up and read on their own just because they're entertaining and informative - they tend to skip Buffalo on their book tours. We're off the beaten path.

Matt Higgins and Brian Castner have a plan to put Buffalo on the path, and do it in a  fun way that reboots the standard stuffy and uptight book event. Matt wrote BIRD DREAM, a story of wingsuit pilots trying to land without a parachute. Brian wrote THE LONG WALK, a memoir of his time as a bomb technician in Iraq. Both of us were published by major houses and have done book events around the country, and we want to bring the best of what we've seen back to Buffalo.

We're starting Buffalo, Books & Beer (B3), a fun new author series at Resurgence Brewing on Niagara Street. We'll organize two semesters, three events in the spring and three in the fall, and pair up a national author with a great local one. We'll drink a few beers, listen to a reading, chat at the bar afterward.

But we need to pay to bring the national authors here. In time, once we put Buffalo on the map, and the big publishing houses know how successful B3 is, the series will pay for itself. But in the meantime, we have plane tickets and hotel rooms to buy, in order to get this project off the ground.

With your help, we can bring some great writers to Buffalo, and showcase the talent already here. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

All of your contributions will go directly to the cost of doing events: travel costs for the authors and the associated logistics. If we meet our goal, we'll pay for three events, in February, March and April 2015. Any unused funds will pay for events in the fall. And if we beat our goal, we'll be that much closer to planning another semester.

For perks, we have a mix of available swag: pint glasses, t-shirts, signed books, plus entrance to the event itself. For our top contributors, we also have a special opportunity: dinner with an author we bring to town. Yes, writers are just regular people who put on their pants one leg at a time, but it's fun to pick their brain, and we'll do it over dinner before each event.

We have two great partners for this author series: Resurgence Brewing and local icon Talking Leaves....Books. All perks will be available at Resurgence on the night of the events, and we'll be procuring all books through Talking Leaves.

Spring 2015

We have some great authors already confirmed for the spring, including Clay Risen, author of AMERICAN BOURBON, WHISKEY & RYE, a great history lesson as well as a definitive guide to these American spirits.



We also are honored to have Sherill Tippins, author of INSIDE THE DREAM PALACE, winner of the 2014 Marfield Prize for best writing on the arts, about the historic Chelsea Hotel in New York City, and the many actors, musicians, and scoundrels who lived a bohemian life there. 


With your help, we'll fill out the rest of the lineup and start planning for the fall. And if there is an author you'd love to see come to Buffalo, let us know at b3buffalo [at] gmail.com. We'll do our best!

Risks & Challenges

This author series relies on our ability to do two things: raise money, and convince authors to come to Buffalo. If we don't raise sufficient funds, this series will sputter out of the gate and fizzle quickly. Likewise, if no one agrees to come to Buffalo, we won't have authors to do events. However, Matt and Brian have made enough connections in the publishing world, we are confident we can keep finding great talent if we have the wherewithal to bring them to town. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute to this campaign, please tell your friends, share on social media, and, most importantly, attend our inaugural Spring Semester of events on February 11th, March 18th, and April 15th, 2015.

See you there - Cheers!

story:
Short Summary

Hello again, we at Yes Kirriemuir have been busy just as thousands of others have been right across Scotland, taking the positive reasons to vote Yes in Septembers Referendum to as many as possible.  We have held open public meetings in Kirriemuir and villages in the surrounding area, we have organised at great effort a debate between Yes and No for the benefit of 5th and 6th year pupils and the wider public. Our Yes shop now opens to help people get the real facts, and we are currently discussing with younger voters how we can keep the shop open longer during the school holidays. We have events planned for the future, and plan to have stalls at all the local events we can get to during the summer.  All of this has been made possible thanks to you and your generous donations, and the many hours given by our volunteers, but we need to finish what we have started.   There has been a real change recently with polls continuing to move towards yes, and when out talking to people, the positive response you get is a real buzz, but to get the result we want, we need to keep going, and that's where you come in.  We have done all we have achieved on a shoe string budget, we have had donations of computer equipment for the shop, we have had people drive from the other end of the country to donate furniture, I have met people who have donated stake for the shop, its been a wonderful thing to have been part of, but a shop comes with bills, bills which we have had to set aside money to pay, and this is frustrating, as this is money that could be booking village halls, or buying a gazebo for a stall, buying more internet time for the shop, this is all stuff that can be done now, the bills can be paid after the referendum. The idea of this small fundraiser is to free up funds now for campaigning, and use the proceeds from this fundraiser to pay the bills later. We are going to win this Referendum, but we are going to have to work for it, Yes Kirriemuir can do this but we need to do it now. Please give what you can, I am only too aware of all the appeals for your hard earned money that are on the go at the moment, but even if you can only give a pound, it will help us get to our target of £600 and  we can finish this thing with the outcome that we have all worked so very hard to reach. Thank you for reading.   

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
One of the greatest feelings a young athlete can experience is to represent their school in a sport they love. To many athletes in south west Winnipeg, cricket is that sport.

Dakota Collegiate Institute (DCI) had been informally playing cricket for a number of years, but by 2013, the number of high schools forming their own cricket teams had grown so great, that it necessitated the creation of the High School Cricket League in Winnipeg, Manitoba.  In addition to DCI, Fort Richmond Collegiate, Maples Collegiate and Kildonan East Collegiate along with Sisler and Gordon Bell High Schools comprise  the League.

Our challenge now is to build cricket facilities that nurture and expand this growing interest and that bring benefit to the schools, their students and the greater community. 

The first need is for the DCI Cricket Practice Facility.  We have the support of M.L.A., City Councillor, Principal, students, parents and Manitoba cricketers.

Cricket is an accessible and inexpensive sport to play; requiring only a bat, a ball, and 3 sticks. It is a grassroots sport that is the SECOND most popular sport in the world. With the increase in experienced foreign athletes settling in the city, there is a need for facilities to allow these athletes a place to instruct, practice and to integrate into the local sporting community.

We propose to build a two lane cricket batting and bowling practice facility outdoors at Dakota Collegiate Institute (DCI) at 661 Dakota in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada. 


This facility will:

  • Make the sport more accessible. DCI has the community, the interest and a keen local market.  The neighboring area has a very high population density, the result of many high-rise apartment complexes. Many residents are experienced cricket players, but lack the means to travel to a facility
  • Build from the grassroots. The DCI feeder Schools include Darwin, Hastings, Lavalee, Victor Mager, and Victor Wyatt, all within walking distance of the proposed facility, resulting in a successful and sustainable community resource.
  • Create a visible social connection for many new Canadians settling int the St. Vital area. Encouraging healthy lifestyle and community integration.

OUR SUPPORTERS INCLUDE:

“I am delighted to support the cricket practice facility at Dakota Collegiate.  When I graduated from Dakota in 1980, St. Vital was a much less diverse place, and no one could have imagined cricket players out behind the building.  But St. Vitalers now come from all over the world, and the growth of cricket is an exciting part of this new dynamic.  I look forward to seeing this project come to reality.” 

Brian Mayes, City Councillor, St. Vital Ward

“With more and more Manitobans eager to learn cricket and the recent formation of a youth team at Dakota Collegiate Institute, the community could not be more excited about the proposed practice facility at DCI.  This will provide all of South East Winnipeg with a fantastic new facility to practice and play one of the fastest growing sports in Canada.”
Nancy Allan, Member Legislative Assembly, St. Vital

"This will be an excellent practice facility for the new cricketers and the existing players in the area. This will encourage players to practice more often, which will enhance their development. We are thrilled to support this initiative, and know it will improve the visibility and access to cricket in South Winnipeg."

Garvin Budhoo, President, Manitoba Cricket Association

"This will help the development for the future generation of cricketers in Manitoba. Building a brand new facility in this area is amazing for our growth because of how much easier it will be for youngsters to find a place to practice and to learn the game, with out having to travel far distances.  Now that the schools in Winnipeg are beginning to participate in cricket, they require a safe and reliable place (locally) to practice and develop."

Trevor Manoosingh, U-19 Team Canada Cricket Member


BUT WE NEED YOUR HELP!

The budget for the project is $45,000. Our goal is to raise $15,000. We have already received a $30,000 commitment from government sources. It's now time for the community of cricket lovers, players, supporters and friends to join together and raise $15,000 for the final piece of the puzzle.

Help to make this dream a reality. Donate today, and be a part of raising funds for this vital community facility. Your donation will go to the construction and ongoing maintenance of the DCI Cricket Practice Facility.

1500 WICKETS

In cricket, getting a wicket is the equivalent of a strike out in baseball.

For every $10 donation, we'll add a wicket to our total.  When we've collected 1500 wickets, we will have reached our fundraising goal of $15,000.

All money raised will go direct to the Trust Fund for the construction and ongoing maintenance of a facility.

1 wicket = $ 10

5 wickets = $ 50

10 wickets = $ 100

Buy any amount of wickets in multiples of $10

WHERE WILL WE BUILD IT?

As with any permanent sporting facility, initial funds will be required to purchase materials, dig the 8' w x 60’ l x 12'' d surface (x2) and labour to lay the surfaces and install required fencing. 

The Facility will be located at Dakota Collegiate Institute 661 Dakota Street, Winnipeg, Manitoba in the grassed schoolyard adjacent to the Beliveau Avenue fencing on the Northeast field. The area to be fenced would be adjacent to the existing East Parking lot.


WHEN

We propose to build in May/June 2014 - Opening in July 2014.

MANITOBA CRICKET FACTS

  • The first known cricket was played in Manitoba in 1847 at Lower Fort Garry.
  • The Manitoba Cricket Association was established in 1937.
  • 1967 Pan-Am Games reformed the Assiniboine Park pitches for Senior League
  • 2011 - Assiniboine Park Conservancy improves Assin. Park Facility
  • In 2013 the Winnipeg Senior League  registered 19 senior teams, setting a league record.
