story:
Hey Indiegogo! Two years ago, we came up with an idea about how to create a new kind of flip book. We wanted to upgrade the classic format and bring it to a whole new level, and this is the result:

 

 

 

 

Molecularis is also an animated coloring book. You can use it in plenty of ways, by coloring, redrawing and varying its content with an endless number of possibilities. Use pencils, markers, watercolors, graphite, brushes, technical pens or whatever technique you prefer.

 

By alternating the colors gradually from one picture to the next and using your favorite color palette, you can not only give the sequences their very own personality, but also bring them to life – as you see them ‘move’ when you flip through the pages.

 

Inside Molecularis, you’ll find a group of small and restless organisms that interact with each other as if they were being observed through a microscope.

Like all flip books, Molecularis relies on the principle of persistence of vision, which in other words, is exactly what your eyes and brain do when you watch a movie. In a flip book, every picture varies gradually from one page to the next, so by flipping the pages with your thumb, they generate the illusion of movement. This simple technique has been around since 1868 and played an important role in the birth of cinema.

Because the sequences are loop animated, after coloring or redrawing, you can create GIFs like this!

The sequences were designed and animated by Jossie Malis, co-founder of Flipboku and best known for his award-winning animated series Bendito Machine. Maybe you've come across this video from the first flip book we created for the show a couple of years ago. Find out more here.

 
 
 
If you observe the flip book in closer detail, you will notice that the edges are cut in a specific way, so that you can swap between the different sequences. This is the key to the optical illusion that gives Molecularis its unique feature of showing you six different animations in just one flip book. You'll have a blast watching people's faces when they see Molecularis for the first time and try to understand how it works! :D
 
 

And here's the secret: it all depends on the position of your thumb. You can switch between sequences by placing your thumb either in the upper corner, the center or the lower corner of the front edge of the book.

As there are 3 sequences on each side of the book, the images are arranged alternately. This means that you will have sequences 1, 2 and 3 on one side and 4, 5 and 6 when you turn the book around. To proceed with the coloring simply follow each sequence by jumping every 3 pages. You will have better control of the coloring process if you follow each animated element in every sequence. 

 

Every single Molecularis is largely hand-produced and the whole process requires a number of steps that rely on careful supervision. We spent a lot of time testing different paper qualities and consulted with several experts until we found the perfect match: high quality 100% recycled heavy paper with a semi-rough surface and a nice smooth finish. It's suitable for all kinds of different techniques and prevents colors from passing through it. Each Molecularis comes with 180 pages (90 sheets). 

 We have a weakness for good packaging, and that’s why we included a sleek slip case to keep your Molecularis safe after you use it. It prevents the pages from wearing out and by the way, it looks awesome on your shelf or wherever you want to keep it.

 

 

As a perfect complement to Molecularis we have created a learning flip book for anyone who wants to try ‘freestyle’ animation :

 

Blanko is a flip book that contains 320 blank pages on which you can animate whatever comes to your mind. If you're new to animation, learn how to get started with 6 of the basic principles we have included: squash and stretch, anticipation, ease in - ease out, arcs, timing and exaggeration. You can use both sides of the flip book.

Watch this terrific animation by our good friend Nacho Rodríguez created on Blanko, featuring his character Mr. Coo:

 

 
 
Molecularis and Blanko make a great couple, that's why we have bundled them up in a practical and sleek protective sleeve. You can also choose between several combinations:
 
We have partnered with Winsor&Newton, leading Brithish color-maker for more than 180 years, to create an awesome limited edition reward that includes a set of 12 assorted Watercolor Markers. This is a top quality marker set that will suit either the casual artist or the professional.
 
 
Each pen has a fine point tip on one end and a flexible brush tip on the other end. The colors are bright, lightfast and highly pigmented and they're designed to make gorgeous washes when combined with water. Because they have dual nibs, you can also use them for fine detail and sweeping line thicknesses. You won't find another marker quite like these ones.
 
 
 
 
Many of you asked us for more Winsor & Newton sets so we just unlocked a new limited edition reward! Those of you who have tried the Cotman Water Colours will agree with us, they are simply the best. Inside of this set you’ll find 12 high-quality, vibrant Cotman colours, an ergonomically designed brush pen with its own water reservoir and a mixing palette inside the lid. All packed into a slim, beautifully curved case that fits in your pocket, together with your Molecularis and/or Blanko. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Despite its small size, a lot of work goes into creating a flip book like Molecularis. We've spent hours and hours on the design board, working hand in hand with our local printing house, cutting, binding and testing to achieve this result. Printing projects such as this one are only cost effective if you reach a certain quantity threshold, which is why we need your help to complete the final step – to finally bring the flip book to life and get it into the printers.
Flipboku is a project which comes straight from the hearts of animator and designer Jossie Malis and music composer Julie Reier. We love animation, design and flip books and we are thrilled at the idea of creating something you can manipulate with your hands, without any need for cables or batteries, just by using your thumb! 
 
 
 
 
Based on the Mediterranean island of Mallorca, Spain, Flipboku is meant to grow slowly as a side project, while we continue making films and sounds in our studio, Zumbakamera. The team is completed with the invaluable hands of illustrator, designer and official coloring artist Noemi Aiolo, and in the near future, with the collaboration of independent animators from planet earth.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
We are extremely grateful for your support and would love to see you on board.
 
 
This campaign is promoted by Backercamp. Since 2012, Backercamp has helped 5,000+ creators make their projects a reality, raising over $150MM through crowdfunding.

Risks and challenges

We have over 15 years of experience in the fields of animation, design, and printing. Developing Molecularis has been a great challenge, but after a few years perfecting the technique in close collaboration with our printing house we can say that every aspect of the production process is perfectly solved. Everything is ready to go into production once the campaign is over. We have also included a buffer in our timeline to allow for delays and to deliver on time. Unexpected issues may arise and if they do we will always deal with them at the top of our priorities list.
story_txt:
Hey Indiegogo! Two years ago, we came up with an idea about how to create a new kind of flip book. We wanted to upgrade the classic format and bring it to a whole new level, and this is the result:
 

 
 



 


Molecularis is also an animated coloring book. You can use it in plenty of ways, by coloring, redrawing and varying its content with an endless number of possibilities. Use pencils, markers, watercolors, graphite, brushes, technical pens or whatever technique you prefer.
  
By alternating the colors gradually from one picture to the next and using your favorite color palette, you can not only give the sequences their very own personality, but also bring them to life – as you see them ‘move’ when you flip through the pages.

 


Inside Molecularis, you’ll find a group of small and restless organisms that interact with each other as if they were being observed through a microscope.
Like all flip books, Molecularis relies on the principle of persistence of vision, which in other words, is exactly what your eyes and brain do when you watch a movie. In a flip book, every picture varies gradually from one page to the next, so by flipping the pages with your thumb, they generate the illusion of movement. This simple technique has been around since 1868 and played an important role in the birth of cinema.
Because the sequences are loop animated, after coloring or redrawing, you can create GIFs like this!

The sequences were designed and animated by Jossie Malis, co-founder of Flipboku and best known for his award-winning animated series Bendito Machine. Maybe you've come across this video from the first flip book we created for the show a couple of years ago. Find out more here.

 
 
 

If you observe the flip book in closer detail, you will notice that the edges are cut in a specific way, so that you can swap between the different sequences. This is the key to the optical illusion that gives Molecularis its unique feature of showing you six different animations in just one flip book. You'll have a blast watching people's faces when they see Molecularis for the first time and try to understand how it works! :D
 

 

And here's the secret: it all depends on the position of your thumb. You can switch between sequences by placing your thumb either in the upper corner, the center or the lower corner of the front edge of the book.

As there are 3 sequences on each side of the book, the images are arranged alternately. This means that you will have sequences 1, 2 and 3 on one side and 4, 5 and 6 when you turn the book around. To proceed with the coloring simply follow each sequence by jumping every 3 pages. You will have better control of the coloring process if you follow each animated element in every sequence. 
 
Every single Molecularis is largely hand-produced and the whole process requires a number of steps that rely on careful supervision. We spent a lot of time testing different paper qualities and consulted with several experts until we found the perfect match: high quality 100% recycled heavy paper with a semi-rough surface and a nice smooth finish. It's suitable for all kinds of different techniques and prevents colors from passing through it. Each Molecularis comes with 180 pages (90 sheets). 

 We have a weakness for good packaging, and that’s why we included a sleek slip case to keep your Molecularis safe after you use it. It prevents the pages from wearing out and by the way, it looks awesome on your shelf or wherever you want to keep it.


 

 

As a perfect complement to Molecularis we have created a learning flip book for anyone who wants to try ‘freestyle’ animation :
 

Blanko is a flip book that contains 320 blank pages on which you can animate whatever comes to your mind. If you're new to animation, learn how to get started with 6 of the basic principles we have included: squash and stretch, anticipation, ease in - ease out, arcs, timing and exaggeration. You can use both sides of the flip book.


Watch this terrific animation by our good friend Nacho Rodríguez created on Blanko, featuring his character Mr. Coo:



 

 

 

Molecularis and Blanko make a great couple, that's why we have bundled them up in a practical and sleek protective sleeve. You can also choose between several combinations:
 

We have partnered with Winsor&Newton, leading Brithish color-maker for more than 180 years, to create an awesome limited edition reward that includes a set of 12 assorted Watercolor Markers. This is a top quality marker set that will suit either the casual artist or the professional.
 

 
Each pen has a fine point tip on one end and a flexible brush tip on the other end. The colors are bright, lightfast and highly pigmented and they're designed to make gorgeous washes when combined with water. Because they have dual nibs, you can also use them for fine detail and sweeping line thicknesses. You won't find another marker quite like these ones.
 
 
 

 
Many of you asked us for more Winsor & Newton sets so we just unlocked a new limited edition reward! Those of you who have tried the Cotman Water Colours will agree with us, they are simply the best. Inside of this set you’ll find 12 high-quality, vibrant Cotman colours, an ergonomically designed brush pen with its own water reservoir and a mixing palette inside the lid. All packed into a slim, beautifully curved case that fits in your pocket, together with your Molecularis and/or Blanko. 
 

 
 

 
 
 
 

 
Despite its small size, a lot of work goes into creating a flip book like Molecularis. We've spent hours and hours on the design board, working hand in hand with our local printing house, cutting, binding and testing to achieve this result. Printing projects such as this one are only cost effective if you reach a certain quantity threshold, which is why we need your help to complete the final step – to finally bring the flip book to life and get it into the printers.

Flipboku is a project which comes straight from the hearts of animator and designer Jossie Malis and music composer Julie Reier. We love animation, design and flip books and we are thrilled at the idea of creating something you can manipulate with your hands, without any need for cables or batteries, just by using your thumb! 
 
 

 
 
Based on the Mediterranean island of Mallorca, Spain, Flipboku is meant to grow slowly as a side project, while we continue making films and sounds in our studio, Zumbakamera. The team is completed with the invaluable hands of illustrator, designer and official coloring artist Noemi Aiolo, and in the near future, with the collaboration of independent animators from planet earth.
 
 
 
 

 

 

 

 

 
 
 

 
We are extremely grateful for your support and would love to see you on board.
 

 
This campaign is promoted by Backercamp. Since 2012, Backercamp has helped 5,000+ creators make their projects a reality, raising over $150MM through crowdfunding.


Risks and challenges
We have over 15 years of experience in the fields of animation, design, and printing. Developing Molecularis has been a great challenge, but after a few years perfecting the technique in close collaboration with our printing house we can say that every aspect of the production process is perfectly solved. Everything is ready to go into production once the campaign is over. We have also included a buffer in our timeline to allow for delays and to deliver on time. Unexpected issues may arise and if they do we will always deal with them at the top of our priorities list.

story:
¿Qué?

La otra dimensión marida realidad y leyenda en una historia entrañable y llena de emoción.

Alba decide pasar el verano con su abuela en la localidad de Vélez-Málaga, un pueblo creciente atrapado en una hondonada a la sombra de las montañas de La Maroma. Entre las altas temperaturas que allí se cuecen y la angustia que la alberga al enterarse de la traición de sus amigos, Alba conoce a Ángel, un vecino de su edad, el cual le introduce en su grupo de amigos que la ponen al día de todas las historias del pueblo y sus leyendas.

Los chicos se ceban hablando de la más famosa de las historias que cuentan sus abuelos: gente que desaparece después de perder la cordura. Espectros, que sin vida, no dejan rastro al borde de la muerte. Abrumada por tan elocuentes disparates, Alba al principio no es consciente de que ella es la próxima víctima de la leyenda; una leyenda que ha estado dormida años y que con su llegada ha despertado.

Un viaje apasionante por el pasado en busca de respuestas donde nuestra protagonista se ve forzada a atravesar portales en el tiempo para saber qué está ocurriendo y de alguna manera, poder escapar del trágico final, salvaguardando su cordura y aprendiendo una importante lección de vida.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Yohana Recio.

Estudió Psicología en la Universidad de Málaga especializándose en tratamiento infanto-juvenil. Un día lluvioso, muy atrás en el tiempo, comenzó a escribir ideas y desde entonces no paró. Siendo una ávida lectora de misterio, fantasía y terror, sus creaciones recorren los mismos senderos cargados de un trasfondo de realidad y magia a partes iguales. Su relato «El Caballero de Plata» fue seleccionado para formar parte de la octava edición de la Revista Falsaria de Hispanoamérica.

Actualmente estudia interpretación musical en la Escuela Superior de Arte Dramático de Málaga, lugar que le ayuda en su estudio profundo del alma de las historias.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«─No son leyendas, es cierto, mira escucha Alba… ─Sofía se incorporó en su asiento y comenzó a el relato─. Se trata de una historia que comienza desde que los guerrilleros, ya sabes los maquis, tomaran esta zona tras la guerra civil española, se dice que fue tanto el odio con el que luchaban contra el bando franquista, que todo este se acumuló y formaron entradas a otros mundos…
          ─Leyendas urbanas… ─susurró Ángel que ahora se había tumbado.
          ─…Ha habido muchos desaparecidos y desde entonces a la gente le da bastante miedo esta hecho por que se dice, que los que han visto esas especies de puertas secretas y no han entrado a otro mundo, están locos y no reconocen ni a sus familias
          ─Leyendas urbanas… ─repitió, pero Sofía lo ignoró.
          ─… Se cuenta que son una especie de puertas a otro lado, con el fin de salvar a los que entren de la maldad de este planeta… pero al estar creados con odio, al otro lado no hay nada más que maldad y venganza…»    

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 920€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de La otra dimensión que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona a la autora, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Yohana Recio vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
So why a... five-quel?

HELLO EVERYBARDY! This is Stephanie Dogfoot, Desmond Kon Zhicheng-Mingdé, Ng Yi-Sheng, and Rodrigo Dela Peña, Jr.

We are the editors of SingPoWriMo 2018: The Anthology, veterans of this month-long, write-a-poem-a-day challenge. Singapore Poetry Writing Month is really more than just a thing you do on Facebook for the heck of it – it's an annual gathering of like-minded people; a rigorous exercise both demanding and rewarding; as well as a bold, balls-out foray into the literary scene.

Our dear Facebook group has grown to nearly 5,700 members in our fifth year counting, which is just, I don't know, it's a tad overwhelming. But daunted we are not! Thousands of poems were generated this month by poets both seasoned and fresh onto the party boat. Verses inspired by hip hop? Yaaaz. Oodles of odes and heaps of haikus? Owo. Poems flowering from your favourite deadly sins? Ding-a-ling.

In short: Singapore writing simply shows no signs of abating, and this year's edition of the anthology seeks to collect the best of these poems in a sizeable volume, published and released by Math Paper Press by the end of this year.

Poetry. Is. Coming!!

How does the money work?

The sheer amount of poetry generated this year is larger than it's ever been, and this time we had to utilise special software on top of a team junior moderators just to make sure everything got read and sifted through. They've nevertheless compiled a massive longlist, and we'll need to work through that before we can have a good sense of what this year's collection will look like, and we hope to keep the final manuscript to under 200 pages. So the approximate cost of producing an anthology will be (all costs in SGD):

1. Printing costs: ~$2500
2. Design/Layout costs: ~$1000
3. Marketing/Distribution costs: ~$500
4. Administrative/Editorial Costs: ~$500
5. Royalties: ~$2000 (~$20 per book x <100 contributors??); we're giving out contributors' copies, not cash at this stage. Contributors retain all their rights.

Math Paper Press will be covering items 2 and 3, but in the community-driven spirit of SingPoWriMo, we're going back to Indiegogo to raise funds for this anthology and ease the financial burden off Math Paper Press / BooksActually, the little independent press / bookstore that could!

A cut will also go to Sing Lit Station, our newly-founded literary non-profit that organises SingPoWriMo, puts together the moderating team, and provides all the free food and booze at the parties, all with additional support from the Arts Fund this year (because we need it!!). Finally, if we do manage to raise more funds than expected, we want to give out copies of the anthology to schools and other places that can afford more exposure to local literature!

Why should I care?

Because Sing Lit matters. Because you love all things to do with the making of books, the making of stories, the making of exquisite things with words alone. Because, for some strange reason, you feel inspired to write poetry of your own, but don't know how to go about doing it and making your own voice heard.

Because you just have a lot of spare cash lying around, and you want to throw it to a project whose editors and publishers are starving, like, literally. Because your friend is in the anthology and you know, yeah, you know.

Because there are young kids in schools who are made to think that literature is not important, not essential to our daily lives, and simply not fun at all to do or read or study. Because this book is testament that literature is all games and hard work and rainbows and the small miracles that happen when a good poem comes together. And because this book is about a thousand people, telling one another to have another go at this wonderful, frustrating, and yet altogether mind-defying smorgasm of a poetry challenge.

Because SingPoWriMo is not simply about you, or me – it's all about all of us, and that same yet strangely variegated language we all speak in: poetry.

Alright alright, now tell me: what do I get for being awesome?

You're gonna like what we're offering this year (all donations in USD):

$3 – Our Undying Love: We will love you. We really will.

$13 – #firststrike: A pre-order copy of the anthology at a special price (~$17 SGD). Only for the first 15 orders. Collection only at our launch event, BooksActually (9 Yong Siak St, Singapore 168645), or Sing Lit Station (3A Jalan Kubor, Singapore 199201).

$15 – Early oWo Gets the Worm: A pre-order copy of the anthology at ~$20 SGD. Collection only at our launch event, BooksActually (9 Yong Siak St, Singapore 168645), or Sing Lit Station (3A Jalan Kubor, Singapore 199201).

$20 – DeliveroWo: A pre-order copy of the anthology delivered to your doorstep via post.

$38 – DeliveroWo Plus: Everything in the $20 tier, plus your name in the acknowledgments. People will know you as That Guy, and they will love you for it.

$48 – Pretty Pretty Tee Pls: Everything in the $38 tier, plus a limited edition of our SPWM T-Shirt in the size of your choosing. Designs include: white with black logo; black with rainbow logo; white with artwork by Elizabeth Fen Chen.

$68 – oWosome: Everything in the $48 tier, plus a beautifully designed, A3-sized poster on tracing paper, featuring a unique poem by the editors written only for you.

$88 – So Extra oWosome: Everything in the $68 tier, except you get four posters instead, featuring a unique, specially written poem from each of our four editors.

$128 – Complete Infinity Stones: Everything in the $88 tier, plus a one-of-a-kind canvas tote bag featuring a poem from one of the editors!

$38 – DeliveroWo Plus: Everything in the $20 tier, plus your name in the acknowledgments. People will know you as That Guy, and they will love you for it.
$48 – Pretty Pretty Tee Pls: Everything in the $38 tier, plus a limited edition of our SPWM T-Shirt in the size of your choosing. Designs include: white with black logo; black with rainbow logo; white with artwork by Elizabeth Fen Chen.

story:
Short Summary

For years the Indo-American Arts Council has supported artistic disciplines in classical, fusion, folk and innovative forms influenced by the arts of India. Essentially, we help celebrate all forms of Indian artistic disciplines by people from India, of Indian heritage, of the diaspora, or by anyone who is influenced in any way by the Indian subcontinent. 

The IAAC literary festival is an annual IAAC event that allows authors from all over the world who have been influenced by the Indian subcontinent to showcase and talk about their work. The festival features veteran as well as emerging authors along with publishers and literary agents in order to create exciting discussions surrounding the various genres and themes represented.


What We Need & What You Get

As a non-profit organisation, we need funding from contributors in order to meet the festival expenses and make it a success. Every small amount will go towards  logistical expenses and trying to get veteran authors.  We therefore request you to be generous in your donation to add to the total amount of our "ask" of  $50,000 which might include the cost of bringing some authors over from India and other parts of the world. Any small amount helps us get to our goal, so please try and give whatever you can. 

The lit fest is spread out over the course of three days, where we have different panel discussions, interviews, book launches, author sessions, networking sessions, as well as other literary themed activities. 


The Impact

The IAAC presents several annual festivals throughout the year. Our film festival (New York Indian Film Festival) just completed its 15th year, our annual travelling Erasing Borders Art Exhibition is in its 13th year and our Dance festival has enjoyed amazing audiences and accolades. Our literature festival began last year, and was a big success. This year, with your funding, we hope to make our  literature festival bigger and better than it has ever been before!  

Other Ways You Can Help

You can apply to and/or spread the word about the IAAC lit fest by sharing a link to our website: http://www.iaac.us/Literary-Festival2015/index.htm

The IAAC is a 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization. All donations are tax-deductible to the fullest extent allowable by law.
story_txt:
Short Summary 
For years the Indo-American Arts Council has supported artistic disciplines in classical, fusion, folk and innovative forms influenced by the arts of India. Essentially, we help celebrate all forms of Indian artistic disciplines by people from India, of Indian heritage, of the diaspora, or by anyone who is influenced in any way by the Indian subcontinent. 
The IAAC literary festival is an annual IAAC event that allows authors from all over the world who have been influenced by the Indian subcontinent to showcase and talk about their work. The festival features veteran as well as emerging authors along with publishers and literary agents in order to create exciting discussions surrounding the various genres and themes represented.
   

What We Need & What You Get 
As a non-profit organisation, we need funding from contributors in order to meet the festival expenses and make it a success. Every small amount will go towards  logistical expenses and trying to get veteran authors.  We therefore request you to be generous in your donation to add to the total amount of our "ask" of  $50,000 which might include the cost of bringing some authors over from India and other parts of the world. Any small amount helps us get to our goal, so please try and give whatever you can. 
The lit fest is spread out over the course of three days, where we have different panel discussions, interviews, book launches, author sessions, networking sessions, as well as other literary themed activities. 



   The Impact 
The IAAC presents several annual festivals throughout the year. Our film festival (New York Indian Film Festival) just completed its 15th year, our annual travelling Erasing Borders Art Exhibition is in its 13th year and our Dance festival has enjoyed amazing audiences and accolades. Our literature festival began last year, and was a big success. This year, with your funding, we hope to make our  literature festival bigger and better than it has ever been before!  


Other Ways You Can Help

 

You can apply to and/or spread the word about the IAAC lit fest by sharing a link to our website: http://www.iaac.us/Literary-Festival2015/index.htm

story:
VONA is the only multigenre writing workshop for people of color. i've been fortunate to be able to attend the VONA writing workshop in 2013 and 2014, and very much looking forward to returning in June. The insight that Elmaz Abinader and Junot Díaz have brought to my writing and to my process has been been incomparable. Moreover, the community that i've inherited since my first visit has sustained me through the rough terrain of writing, life.

i strive to write short stories that highlight experiences that intersect language, race, class, gender, sexuality. About being Xican@ in California's Central Valley. About family dynamics. About transplanting oneself from a town that shuts down at 8 pm to a land of subways and 24 hour bodegas. All compelling. All honest. i've had the fortune of having some of my short stories published. And though i'm proud of my accomplishments thus far, i know that there is still so much more for me to learn and apply and grow.

And this is my chance to continue on that path. i know that finances are tough. Last year i was able to save up enough money to pay for the workshop. However, this year, due to cutbacks i won't been able to do the same. So, i need your help. Any and all donations are appreciated. Nothing is too little; it all goes a long way. And whether or not you're able to help, i want to thank you all. Ultimately, i know that i owe any success and talent to my ancestors and to those around me, who have inspired and touched me in some way or another. i wouldn't be here without you.

story:
¿Qué?

Un pie entre dos mundos aborda un tema de rabiosa actualidad, como es el tráfico de personas en Europa en tiempos de crisis, haciéndonos pensar si realmente la sociedad acutal se fundamenta en los principios de equidad y justicia.

Nos encontramos ante un fenómeno cuya relevancia en la actualidad mundial no hace sino crecer: la emigración. En épocas de bonanza, la mano de obra llegada de fuera es bienvenida. Pero en los momentos en los que la crisis socioeconómica no parece tener fin, con millones de refugiados y emigrantes que intentan encontrar su lugar para vivir y trabajar, ¿seguimos pensando lo mismo?

Alexandru es uno de los miles de jóvenes rumanos que salen de su país en busca de un camino más llano hacia el futuro que siempre ha soñado. ¿Qué hay detrás de cada historia y de cada persona que decide o se ve obligado a dejar su tierra, su gente, su presente, para encontrarse con situaciones contradictorias y tener que construir una vida nueva? ¿Empatizaremos con este ingeniero que un día llega a El Dorado español y rompe con su pasado?

Haciendo un interesante repaso de los eventos más recientes de su historia, Un pie entre dos mundos también intenta dar a conocer facetas que descubran un país hermoso, con gente hospitalaria, trabajadora y honrada. ¿Lo conseguirá?

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy se nos presenta Alina Popescu.

Desde que tiene uso de razón, esta «rumana castellana» o «ciudadana del mundo», como le gusta autodenominarse, es una gran apasionada de entornos Babel y espacios de multiculturalidad. Licenciada en Filología Hispánica y Francesa por la Universidad de Bucarest y doctoranda de Traducción en la Universidad de Valladolid, es pucelana adoptiva desde hace más de quince años. Todos sus relatos, algunos de ellos ya galardonados, dejan traslucir la pasión que siente por la gente más variopinta y sus testimonios, los idiomas, los viajes y la escritura.

Literata precoz, a los nueve años redactó, ilustró y encuadernó a mano su primer manuscrito como regalo para una amiga, publicando posteriormente poesías y relatos en varias revistas infantiles y juveniles de su país de origen. Su profunda vocación escritora la impulsa a trabajar con denuedo cada uno de sus relatos y la ha llevado a hacer del español el idioma en el que difundir sus raíces pasadas y presentes, de las que se siente inmensamente orgullosa.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 850€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Un pie entre dos mundos que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Alina Popescu vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
CLICCA QUI PER IL TESTO IN ITALIANO


Florence is a bilingual city: its native tongue has always been double-edged in English and Italian. Florence embraces both languages not because it needs to, but as a vehicle of endless exchange, creation, sharing and learning. Florence receives, through tourism, study abroad and international attention, but now it is time for it to give. The new Renaissance—when it comes—will be bicultural and it will extend well beyond the city. Florence is the muse and means for a movement that reaches out to Italy lovers, Italians abroad and patrons of the arts worldwide.

To this end, there’s a new bilingual magazine on the horizon: TheFLR. The Florentine Literary Review.

TheFLR is a magazine featuring engaging and entertaining short stories, plus two collectible poems. Tales and verses by Italian authors will be published for the first time alongside the finest English translations. A further layer of interpretation will be provided by the illustrations commissioned for each issue from a contemporary artist.


Why TheFLR

TheFLR fills an important gap: the translation of Italian short stories (as well as full length contemporary literature) into English is sorely lacking and much needed to promote Italian culture around the world.

Readers and lovers of Italian culture have a limited range of authors available to them, based often more on market factors than on their actual representation of contemporary thought in Italy today.

Professors of contemporary Italian literature who attempt to teach in translation find it almost impossible to assign readings, so this magazine will become an immediate reader in schools and universities with these courses.


(Mockup cover - Marco Badiani / illux Leo Cardini)


TheFLR format

TheFLR is a stylish magazine intended for collectors, a work of art and illustration, finely designed and printed in Italy on excellent paper, and featuring an up-and-coming illustrator in every edition.

FORMAT:

  • 64 pages in full colour, 16x24cm

  • 1 introduction in Italian and English

  • 6 short stories in Italian by invited Italian authors / 6 translations in English by experienced translators

  • 2 poem collectors’ pieces / translated

  • Fully illustrated and with creative layout

  • Integrated “artvertising” when available, providing a creative form of promotion and subvention of editorial costs

  • Print run 1000 copies on 140 gram paper

ISSUES: Issue One will come out in October 2016. Further issues will come out when they’re ready, or on demand, or when the time is right and the season feels good. Once, twice, twelve times a year. Creativity happens when it wants to.


TheFLR Topics

Each issue starts with an open theme. The Fall 2016 issue One springs forth – pun intended – from the concept of “Invasion” to remember a massive invasion of water: this year marks the 50th anniversary of the flood of 1966 in Florence. A moment that brought together Italians and Americans, as well as volunteers from around the world, kick-starting a new era in the city. A moment that perhaps ought to have generated new contemporary movements and collaborations – though we’re only getting round to that now.

But above(water) and beyond, the concept can be extended to themes such as the influx of tourism, information overload, the “invasion” of migrants and immigrants, the parallel flow of cultures and languages. Is the concept of invasion always a negative one?


TheFLR and the community

A magazine doesn’t stop at the printing press. Every issue is part – and not the end part – of a process that includes events, workshops and readings.

The topic will be launched at an event during the Notte Bianca in Florence, Italy, on April 30, 2016, consisting of a debate with authors and organizers on the proposed theme of “Invasion”. A closing event will be a fun way to distribute the magazine to backers and other members of the public, with readings, a DJ Set, and a social aperitivo (scheduled for October 28, 2016 in Florence, Italy). Workshops and additional events may be organized in between, wherever and whenever there is opportunity and demand.

The magazine will be produced with the involvement of American and Italian students during the selection, translation and development stages (interviews, online coverage, social networks and promotion, in Italian and English). The work of the translator becomes central to the process, and the professional translator meets with students in a workshop to discuss the process.


Team TheFLR

TheFLR is a project by The Florentine, the English language news magazine in Florence since 2005, in collaboration with the association Forward, based on an idea by Alessandro Raveggi. Quality is assured by the editorial board, as well as by the presence of a prestigious honorary committee.


Editor / Alessandro Raveggi: (Florence, Italy 1980) is an author, scholar and teacher of Modern Italian Literature at several top American universities and schools in Florence. Amongst his publications are the novel “N?ella vasca dei terribili piranha” (?Effigie, 2012), the collection of short stories “Il grande regno dell’emergenza” (LiberAria, 2016), the essays “C?alvino Americano” (?Le Lettere, 2012), the first Italian introduction to David Foster Wallace (Doppiozero, 2014), and the collections of poems “L?a trasfigurazione degli animali in bestie” (Transeuropa, 2011), as well as shorter works in numerous Italian magazines. Amongst his collaborations with newspapers, his series “Romanzo da Spiaggia” was published in Italian and English for Corriere della Sera.

Editorial Board  / Giuseppe Girimonti Greco (translator), Raoul Bruni (critic and scholar), Vanni Santoni (writer and journalist), Paolo Maccari (poet and teacher), Alessandro Raveggi (writer and scholar), Luca Baldoni (writer, translator and scholar), Diego Bertelli (poet and scholar), Martino Baldi (librarian and poet), Daniele Pasquini (writer and journalist), Niccolò Scaffai (critic and scholar)

Publisher / The Florentine: with 11 years of experience in the publishing industry, The Florentine prints a monthly newspaper and is followed by a large international community of Italy lovers online and via social media. In addition, The Florentine Press has published almost a dozen books on art and the experience of living in Italy.

Authors / Selected and invited by the Director, editorial board and curators, the authors will be invited from all around Italy – not necessarily from Florence.


TheFLR costs


This bilingual invasion, this Renaissance, this extension of the contemporary Italian community into the English-speaking world, will only take place if we know there is sufficient demand for it. We believe there is, and that’s why we’re putting the magazine up for pre-order on Indiegogo. With just a few hundred copies sold, we know we can afford to go ahead with the project.

Our costs: Author fees, professional translation, illustration, printing: €4300

The FLR rewards

This is your chance to nab a PDF or paper copy of issue One of The FLR!

But we also have a few special rewards from our sponsors and we know you’ll want more information about that.

FLaunchR: We’ll be having a party at a secret, super hip location on Thursday October 28th in Florence. There will be a reading from the brand new magazine, a DJ set, and an amply stocked aperitivo buffet. This reward gets one person on the guest list (and you’ll get your copy of The FLR when you arrive).

LiteraLunch: Lunch at The Florentine is legendary. You and a friend will be our guests with our simpatico editorial group for a home-cooked, Italian lunch. Of course we’ll give you the magazine and all the newspapers you can carry :)

LiteraTour: Context Travel has generously offered spots on their excellent Dante’s Florence tour. Book the tour for you and a friend any time (no expiry date). The tour lasts 3 hours. We’ll make sure you have a copy of the magazine waiting for you at the start.

PaTRon: Lungarno Collection has generously offered a luxury prize pack in Florence. 2 nights at their Hotel Lungarno, a fabulous five-star overlooking the Ponte Vecchio. Dinner for 2 at their Michelin-starred restaurant Borgo San Jacopo (drinks excluded). The FLR will be waiting for you in your hotel room. The voucher is valid for 1 year from the date of issue.


Finally, if you’re a COMPANY, consider becoming an “Artvertiser”. Up to four select companies will have their advertisement drawn by our illustrator in line with the rest of the magazine’s illustrations.

Be Florentine, Be Literary, Be Lingual.

Be TheFLR




Italiano

Firenze è una città oramai totalmente bilingue: parla in inglese al passato e in italiano al futuro, e viceversa: vive entrambe le lingue non come motivo di stretta necessità ma come motivo di scambio, di creazione, di condivisione, di formazione. Firenze riceve molto e costantemente, grazie al turismo, ai programmi di studio all’estero, e alle continue attenzioni internazionali, ma ora è arrivato il momento di dare. Il nuovo Rinascimento, se sarà, sarà bilingue e si estenderà ben oltre i confini della città. Firenze è la musa, ed esige la nascita di un movimento che riesca a coinvolgere non solo gli amanti dell’Italia ma anche gli italiani all’estero e i sostenitori delle arti di tutto il mondo.

Per raggiungere questo obiettivo, ecco che fa capolino all’orizzonte una nuova rivista bilingue: The Florentine Literary Review.

TheFLR: una rivista basata solidamente su racconti avvincenti, profondi e divertenti, più due poesie collezionabili per ogni numero. Testi e versi di autori italiani appariranno per la prima volta accompagnati da accurate traduzioni in lingua inglese, a cui si aggiungerà un ulteriore spessore artistico grazie alle illustrazioni per ogni numero, che saranno affidate alle visioni di un illustratore contemporaneo.


Perché TheFLR


TheFLR andrà a colmare un vuoto: si sente fortemente la mancanza di traduzioni in inglese di racconti italiani (così come testi integrali di letteratura italiana contemporanea), così necessari a promuovere la cultura italiana nel mondo.

Lettori e amanti della cultura italiana dispongono di un ventaglio assai limitato di autori, scelti più sulla base di scelte di mercato che sulla loro fedele rappresentazione della condizione contemporanea dell’Italia di oggi.

Professori di letteratura contemporanea Italiana che provano a insegnare la lingua, la cultura e le tematiche dell’Italia contemporanea in traduzione, riscontrano una grande difficoltà nel reperire e assegnare letture ai loro studenti. Pertanto questo magazine si inserirebbe idealmente da subito nell’elenco di letture delle scuole e delle università con questo tipo di corsi.


(Mockup di copertina - Marco Badiani / illux Leo Cardini)

Il formato di TheFLR


TheFLR sarà una rivista elegante pensata anche per collezionisti, un lavoro che racchiude opere di arte ed illustrazione, progettato con cura e stampato in Italia su carta di ottima qualità. Ogni numero sarà corredato dalle immagini di un diverso illustratore.

FORMATO:

  • 64 pagine in quadricromia, 16x24cm

  • 1 testo introduttivo in italiano ed inglese

  • 6 racconti in italiano / 6 traduzioni in inglese fatte da traduttori professionisti

  • 2 poesie in formato da collezione (strappabile o sticker) / traduzione in inglese

  • Illustrazioni e layout creativo

  • Quando possibile, verrà proposto un “ARTVERTISING” integrato, che offre al cliente una forma di promozione creativa e permette al giornale di coprire i costi editoriali.

  • Tiratura 1000 copie, carta 140g

NUMERI: Il numero Uno uscirà nell’Ottobre 2016. I numeri successivi usciranno quando pronti, o su richiesta, o quando le tempistiche e la stagione lo permetteranno. Una, due, dodici volte l’anno. I tempi della creatività hanno un ritmo tutto loro.

I Temi di The FLR

Ogni numero si apre con un tema unico. L’Autunno 2016 si aprirà per la rivista con il concetto di “invasione”, per ricordare una massiccia inondazione: quest’anno infatti cade il 50° anniversario dell’alluvione che nel 1966 sconvolse Firenze. La forza devastante di questo evento venne contrastata dall’unione tra italiani ed americani che, insieme a volontari di tutto il mondo, diedero vita ad una nuova era in città. Un momento storico che forse all’epoca avrebbe potuto generare movimenti contemporanei e collaborazioni (anche se forse questi processi si stanno attivando solo ora.)

Ma sopra la superficie (dell’acqua) e oltre, il concetto sarà esteso anche a temi quali il flusso del turismo, l’“invasione” di migranti ed immigrati, il viavai continuo tra culture e linguaggi differenti. Il concetto di invasione deve forse sempre avere una connotazione negativa?


TheFLR e la sua comunità

La vita di una rivista non si limita alla stampa - ogni numero è solo una parte di un processo ininterrotto che include eventi, workshop e letture. Il tema verrà presentato il 30 Aprile 2016 durante un evento programmato all’interno della Notte Bianca a Firenze, che ospiterà un dibattito sul tema “Invasione” con gli autori prescelti e i curatori di TheFLR. Si prevede anche un evento di chiusura della campagna che sarà un modo divertente per distribuire la rivista ai sostenitori e al pubblico, con letture, DJ set e aperitivo (al momento previsto in data 28 Ottobre 2016 a Firenze). Nel frattempo non si esclude la progettazione di ulteriori eventi e workshop, ovunque ve ne sia la richiesta o la possibilità.

Durante le fasi di selezione, traduzione e sviluppo (interviste, copertura online, social media e promozione, in Italiano ed in inglese) la rivista si avvarrà dell’aiuto di studenti americani ed italiani. Il lavoro del traduttore diventa cruciale all’interno di questo processo e gli studenti approfondiranno il suo ruolo grazie ad una serie di incontri mirati.

La squadra dietro TheFLR

TheFLR è un progetto ideato da The Florentine, la rivista in lingua inglese che da undici anni copre le notizie di attualità fiorentina, in collaborazione con l’associazione Forward, concepita da Alessandro Raveggi e Valeria Farill. La qualità della rivista è assolutamente assicurata dal comitato editoriale e dalla presenza di un prestigioso comitato d’onore che verrà nominato in questi mesi.

Direttore / Alessandro Raveggi (Firenze, italia 1980) Autore, studioso e docente di letteratura moderna italiana presso vari programmi e scuole americani di livello a Firenze. Tra le sue pubblicazioni si trovano il romanzo “Nella vasca dei terribili piranha” (Effigie, 2012), la raccolta di racconti “Il grande regno dell’emergenza” (LiberAria, 2016),  il saggio “Calvino Americano” (Le Lettere, 2012), la prima introduzione italiana a David Foster Wallace (Doppiozero, 2014) e il libro di poesia “La trasfigurazione degli animali in bestie” (Transeuropa, 2011), oltre ad una serie di testi pubblicati all’interno di importanti riviste italiane. Tra le sue numerose collaborazioni con giornali, è da sottolineare il suo romanzo a puntate “Romanzo da Spiaggia”, uscita in Italiano ed Inglese per Il Corriere della Sera.

Consiglio Editoriale & Curatori / Giuseppe Girimonti Greco (traduttore), Raoul Bruni (critico e studioso), Vanni Santoni (scrittore e giornalista), Paolo Maccari (poeta e insegnante), Alessandro Raveggi (scrittore e studioso), Luca Baldoni (scrittore, traduttore e studioso), Diego Bertelli (poeta e studioso), Diego Bertelli (poeta e studioso), Martino Baldi (bibliotecario e poet), Daniele Pasquini (scrittore e giornalista), Niccolò Scaffai (critico e studioso)

Editore/ The Florentine: con 11 anni di esperienza alle spalle nell’industria editoriale, ogni mese The Florentine dà alle stampe un giornale apprezzato e seguito da una vasta comunità internazionale di appassionati d’Italia, che oltre a leggere il cartaceo interagiscono giornalmente e generosamente con i canali online e social media della testata. Inoltre, la casa editrice The Florentine Press ha pubblicato almeno una dozzina di libri sull’arte e su cosa significa vivere in Italia.

Autori / Selezionati ed invitati di volta in volta da Direttore, dal consiglio editoriale e curatori, gli autori verranno da tutta Italia.


TheFLR costi

Questa “invasione “bilingue, questo rinascimento, questa apertura della comunità italiana contemporanea verso il mondo anglofono potrà avvenire solo se risponde ad una necessità reale, un bisogno esistente. Noi crediamo che ci sia, e per questo abbiamo deciso di lanciare il magazine con una formula di pagamento anticipato su Indiegogo. La vendita di poche centinaia di copie ci darebbe la conferma della validità del progetto e ci permetterebbe di pianificare future edizioni.

I nostri costi: onorari autori, traduzione professionale, illustrazioni, stampa: €4300


I premi TheFLR

Cogli subito l’occasione per ricevere un PDF o una copia cartacea del numero Uno di TheFLR!

Ma non è finita qui: se vuoi rendere la tua esperienza con TheFLR ancora più memorabile, allora dai un’occhiata ad alcuni premi speciali offerti dai nostri sponsor.

FLaunchR: Stiamo progettando una festa in una location superesclusiva a Firenze. L’evento si terrà Giovedì 28 Ottobre e prevede una lettura dei testi freschi di stampa, sgambettanti DJ set e un abbondante aperitivo con buffet. Questo premio ti consente di entrare in lista (e riceverai la tua copia personale di TheFLR quando arriverai)

LiteraLunch: Il pranzo a The Florentine è leggendario. Tu e un tuo amico sarete i nostri ospiti ed assieme alla nostra simpatica redazione potrete gustare la semplice bontà di un pranzo casalingo. Ovvio: riceverai la tua copia del magazine e tutti i giornali The Florentine che vorrai :)

LiteraTour: Context Travel ha generosamente offerto l’opportunità a pochi fortunati di prendere parte all’emozionante tour della Firenze di Dante (in inglese). Prenota e porta un amico/a quando vuoi (questo premio non ha una scadenza!). L’itinerario dura 3 ore e alla partenza ti saluteremo con una copia della rivista!

PaTRon: Lungarno Collection ha generosamente offerto un pacchetto lusso per chi vuole vivere Firenze in stile: 2 notti presso il loro albergo Hotel Lungarno, un meraviglioso cinque stelle con vista suggestiva sul Ponte Vecchio. Il premio include una cena per due al ristorante Borgo San Jacopo, premiato con 2 stelle Michelin (Bevute non incluse). Troverete una copia di TheFLR ad aspettarvi direttamente dentro la vostra stanza d’albergo. Questa offerta ha una validità di 1 anno.

Infine, se hai un’azienda potresti considerare di diventare un “Artvertiser”. Fino a 4 aziende selezionate potranno usufruire delle abilità dei nostri illustratori che disegneranno per ogni realtà un’inserzione pubblicitaria ad hoc, in linea con l’estetica del numero.


Be Florentine, Be Literary, Be Lingual.

Be TheFLR
story_txt:
CLICCA QUI PER IL TESTO IN ITALIANO
Florence is a bilingual city: its native tongue has always been double-edged in English and Italian. Florence embraces both languages not because it needs to, but as a vehicle of endless exchange, creation, sharing and learning. Florence receives, through tourism, study abroad and international attention, but now it is time for it to give. The new Renaissance—when it comes—will be bicultural and it will extend well beyond the city. Florence is the muse and means for a movement that reaches out to Italy lovers, Italians abroad and patrons of the arts worldwide.To this end, there’s a new bilingual magazine on the horizon: TheFLR. The Florentine Literary Review. TheFLR is a magazine featuring engaging and entertaining short stories, plus two collectible poems. Tales and verses by Italian authors will be published for the first time alongside the finest English translations. A further layer of interpretation will be provided by the illustrations commissioned for each issue from a contemporary artist.Why TheFLRTheFLR fills an important gap: the translation of Italian short stories (as well as full length contemporary literature) into English is sorely lacking and much needed to promote Italian culture around the world. Readers and lovers of Italian culture have a limited range of authors available to them, based often more on market factors than on their actual representation of contemporary thought in Italy today.Professors of contemporary Italian literature who attempt to teach in translation find it almost impossible to assign readings, so this magazine will become an immediate reader in schools and universities with these courses.(Mockup cover - Marco Badiani / illux Leo Cardini)TheFLR formatTheFLR is a stylish magazine intended for collectors, a work of art and illustration, finely designed and printed in Italy on excellent paper, and featuring an up-and-coming illustrator in every edition.FORMAT:
64 pages in full colour, 16x24cm
1 introduction in Italian and English
6 short stories in Italian by invited Italian authors / 6 translations in English by experienced translators
2 poem collectors’ pieces / translated
Fully illustrated and with creative layout
Integrated “artvertising” when available, providing a creative form of promotion and subvention of editorial costs
Print run 1000 copies on 140 gram paper

ISSUES: Issue One will come out in October 2016. Further issues will come out when they’re ready, or on demand, or when the time is right and the season feels good. Once, twice, twelve times a year. Creativity happens when it wants to.TheFLR TopicsEach issue starts with an open theme. The Fall 2016 issue One springs forth – pun intended – from the concept of “Invasion” to remember a massive invasion of water: this year marks the 50th anniversary of the flood of 1966 in Florence. A moment that brought together Italians and Americans, as well as volunteers from around the world, kick-starting a new era in the city. A moment that perhaps ought to have generated new contemporary movements and collaborations – though we’re only getting round to that now. But above(water) and beyond, the concept can be extended to themes such as the influx of tourism, information overload, the “invasion” of migrants and immigrants, the parallel flow of cultures and languages. Is the concept of invasion always a negative one?TheFLR and the communityA magazine doesn’t stop at the printing press. Every issue is part – and not the end part – of a process that includes events, workshops and readings. The topic will be launched at an event during the Notte Bianca in Florence, Italy, on April 30, 2016, consisting of a debate with authors and organizers on the proposed theme of “Invasion”. A closing event will be a fun way to distribute the magazine to backers and other members of the public, with readings, a DJ Set, and a social aperitivo (scheduled for October 28, 2016 in Florence, Italy). Workshops and additional events may be organized in between, wherever and whenever there is opportunity and demand.The magazine will be produced with the involvement of American and Italian students during the selection, translation and development stages (interviews, online coverage, social networks and promotion, in Italian and English). The work of the translator becomes central to the process, and the professional translator meets with students in a workshop to discuss the process.Team TheFLRTheFLR is a project by The Florentine, the English language news magazine in Florence since 2005, in collaboration with the association Forward, based on an idea by Alessandro Raveggi. Quality is assured by the editorial board, as well as by the presence of a prestigious honorary committee.Editor / Alessandro Raveggi: (Florence, Italy 1980) is an author, scholar and teacher of Modern Italian Literature at several top American universities and schools in Florence. Amongst his publications are the novel “N?ella vasca dei terribili piranha” (?Effigie, 2012), the collection of short stories “Il grande regno dell’emergenza” (LiberAria, 2016), the essays “C?alvino Americano” (?Le Lettere, 2012), the first Italian introduction to David Foster Wallace (Doppiozero, 2014), and the collections of poems “L?a trasfigurazione degli animali in bestie” (Transeuropa, 2011), as well as shorter works in numerous Italian magazines. Amongst his collaborations with newspapers, his series “Romanzo da Spiaggia” was published in Italian and English for Corriere della Sera.Editorial Board  / Giuseppe Girimonti Greco (translator), Raoul Bruni (critic and scholar), Vanni Santoni (writer and journalist), Paolo Maccari (poet and teacher), Alessandro Raveggi (writer and scholar), Luca Baldoni (writer, translator and scholar), Diego Bertelli (poet and scholar), Martino Baldi (librarian and poet), Daniele Pasquini (writer and journalist), Niccolò Scaffai (critic and scholar)Publisher / The Florentine: with 11 years of experience in the publishing industry, The Florentine prints a monthly newspaper and is followed by a large international community of Italy lovers online and via social media. In addition, The Florentine Press has published almost a dozen books on art and the experience of living in Italy.Authors / Selected and invited by the Director, editorial board and curators, the authors will be invited from all around Italy – not necessarily from Florence.TheFLR costs
This bilingual invasion, this Renaissance, this extension of the contemporary Italian community into the English-speaking world, will only take place if we know there is sufficient demand for it. We believe there is, and that’s why we’re putting the magazine up for pre-order on Indiegogo. With just a few hundred copies sold, we know we can afford to go ahead with the project.Our costs: Author fees, professional translation, illustration, printing: €4300 

The FLR rewardsThis is your chance to nab a PDF or paper copy of issue One of The FLR!But we also have a few special rewards from our sponsors and we know you’ll want more information about that.FLaunchR: We’ll be having a party at a secret, super hip location on Thursday October 28th in Florence. There will be a reading from the brand new magazine, a DJ set, and an amply stocked aperitivo buffet. This reward gets one person on the guest list (and you’ll get your copy of The FLR when you arrive).LiteraLunch: Lunch at The Florentine is legendary. You and a friend will be our guests with our simpatico editorial group for a home-cooked, Italian lunch. Of course we’ll give you the magazine and all the newspapers you can carry :)LiteraTour: Context Travel has generously offered spots on their excellent Dante’s Florence tour. Book the tour for you and a friend any time (no expiry date). The tour lasts 3 hours. We’ll make sure you have a copy of the magazine waiting for you at the start.PaTRon: Lungarno Collection has generously offered a luxury prize pack in Florence. 2 nights at their Hotel Lungarno, a fabulous five-star overlooking the Ponte Vecchio. Dinner for 2 at their Michelin-starred restaurant Borgo San Jacopo (drinks excluded). The FLR will be waiting for you in your hotel room. The voucher is valid for 1 year from the date of issue.Finally, if you’re a COMPANY, consider becoming an “Artvertiser”. Up to four select companies will have their advertisement drawn by our illustrator in line with the rest of the magazine’s illustrations.Be Florentine, Be Literary, Be Lingual.Be TheFLR

Italiano
Firenze è una città oramai totalmente bilingue: parla in inglese al passato e in italiano al futuro, e viceversa: vive entrambe le lingue non come motivo di stretta necessità ma come motivo di scambio, di creazione, di condivisione, di formazione. Firenze riceve molto e costantemente, grazie al turismo, ai programmi di studio all’estero, e alle continue attenzioni internazionali, ma ora è arrivato il momento di dare. Il nuovo Rinascimento, se sarà, sarà bilingue e si estenderà ben oltre i confini della città. Firenze è la musa, ed esige la nascita di un movimento che riesca a coinvolgere non solo gli amanti dell’Italia ma anche gli italiani all’estero e i sostenitori delle arti di tutto il mondo.Per raggiungere questo obiettivo, ecco che fa capolino all’orizzonte una nuova rivista bilingue: The Florentine Literary Review.TheFLR: una rivista basata solidamente su racconti avvincenti, profondi e divertenti, più due poesie collezionabili per ogni numero. Testi e versi di autori italiani appariranno per la prima volta accompagnati da accurate traduzioni in lingua inglese, a cui si aggiungerà un ulteriore spessore artistico grazie alle illustrazioni per ogni numero, che saranno affidate alle visioni di un illustratore contemporaneo.Perché TheFLRTheFLR andrà a colmare un vuoto: si sente fortemente la mancanza di traduzioni in inglese di racconti italiani (così come testi integrali di letteratura italiana contemporanea), così necessari a promuovere la cultura italiana nel mondo.Lettori e amanti della cultura italiana dispongono di un ventaglio assai limitato di autori, scelti più sulla base di scelte di mercato che sulla loro fedele rappresentazione della condizione contemporanea dell’Italia di oggi.Professori di letteratura contemporanea Italiana che provano a insegnare la lingua, la cultura e le tematiche dell’Italia contemporanea in traduzione, riscontrano una grande difficoltà nel reperire e assegnare letture ai loro studenti. Pertanto questo magazine si inserirebbe idealmente da subito nell’elenco di letture delle scuole e delle università con questo tipo di corsi.(Mockup di copertina - Marco Badiani / illux Leo Cardini)Il formato di TheFLRTheFLR sarà una rivista elegante pensata anche per collezionisti, un lavoro che racchiude opere di arte ed illustrazione, progettato con cura e stampato in Italia su carta di ottima qualità. Ogni numero sarà corredato dalle immagini di un diverso illustratore. FORMATO:
64 pagine in quadricromia, 16x24cm
1 testo introduttivo in italiano ed inglese 
6 racconti in italiano / 6 traduzioni in inglese fatte da traduttori professionisti
2 poesie in formato da collezione (strappabile o sticker) / traduzione in inglese
Illustrazioni e layout creativo
Quando possibile, verrà proposto un “ARTVERTISING” integrato, che offre al cliente una forma di promozione creativa e permette al giornale di coprire i costi editoriali.
Tiratura 1000 copie, carta 140g

NUMERI: Il numero Uno uscirà nell’Ottobre 2016. I numeri successivi usciranno quando pronti, o su richiesta, o quando le tempistiche e la stagione lo permetteranno. Una, due, dodici volte l’anno. I tempi della creatività hanno un ritmo tutto loro.I Temi di The FLROgni numero si apre con un tema unico. L’Autunno 2016 si aprirà per la rivista con il concetto di “invasione”, per ricordare una massiccia inondazione: quest’anno infatti cade il 50° anniversario dell’alluvione che nel 1966 sconvolse Firenze. La forza devastante di questo evento venne contrastata dall’unione tra italiani ed americani che, insieme a volontari di tutto il mondo, diedero vita ad una nuova era in città. Un momento storico che forse all’epoca avrebbe potuto generare movimenti contemporanei e collaborazioni (anche se forse questi processi si stanno attivando solo ora.)Ma sopra la superficie (dell’acqua) e oltre, il concetto sarà esteso anche a temi quali il flusso del turismo, l’“invasione” di migranti ed immigrati, il viavai continuo tra culture e linguaggi differenti. Il concetto di invasione deve forse sempre avere una connotazione negativa?TheFLR e la sua comunitàLa vita di una rivista non si limita alla stampa - ogni numero è solo una parte di un processo ininterrotto che include eventi, workshop e letture. Il tema verrà presentato il 30 Aprile 2016 durante un evento programmato all’interno della Notte Bianca a Firenze, che ospiterà un dibattito sul tema “Invasione” con gli autori prescelti e i curatori di TheFLR. Si prevede anche un evento di chiusura della campagna che sarà un modo divertente per distribuire la rivista ai sostenitori e al pubblico, con letture, DJ set e aperitivo (al momento previsto in data 28 Ottobre 2016 a Firenze). Nel frattempo non si esclude la progettazione di ulteriori eventi e workshop, ovunque ve ne sia la richiesta o la possibilità.Durante le fasi di selezione, traduzione e sviluppo (interviste, copertura online, social media e promozione, in Italiano ed in inglese) la rivista si avvarrà dell’aiuto di studenti americani ed italiani. Il lavoro del traduttore diventa cruciale all’interno di questo processo e gli studenti approfondiranno il suo ruolo grazie ad una serie di incontri mirati.La squadra dietro TheFLRTheFLR è un progetto ideato da The Florentine, la rivista in lingua inglese che da undici anni copre le notizie di attualità fiorentina, in collaborazione con l’associazione Forward, concepita da Alessandro Raveggi e Valeria Farill. La qualità della rivista è assolutamente assicurata dal comitato editoriale e dalla presenza di un prestigioso comitato d’onore che verrà nominato in questi mesi. Direttore / Alessandro Raveggi (Firenze, italia 1980) Autore, studioso e docente di letteratura moderna italiana presso vari programmi e scuole americani di livello a Firenze. Tra le sue pubblicazioni si trovano il romanzo “Nella vasca dei terribili piranha” (Effigie, 2012), la raccolta di racconti “Il grande regno dell’emergenza” (LiberAria, 2016),  il saggio “Calvino Americano” (Le Lettere, 2012), la prima introduzione italiana a David Foster Wallace (Doppiozero, 2014) e il libro di poesia “La trasfigurazione degli animali in bestie” (Transeuropa, 2011), oltre ad una serie di testi pubblicati all’interno di importanti riviste italiane. Tra le sue numerose collaborazioni con giornali, è da sottolineare il suo romanzo a puntate “Romanzo da Spiaggia”, uscita in Italiano ed Inglese per Il Corriere della Sera.Consiglio Editoriale & Curatori / Giuseppe Girimonti Greco (traduttore), Raoul Bruni (critico e studioso), Vanni Santoni (scrittore e giornalista), Paolo Maccari (poeta e insegnante), Alessandro Raveggi (scrittore e studioso), Luca Baldoni (scrittore, traduttore e studioso), Diego Bertelli (poeta e studioso), Diego Bertelli (poeta e studioso), Martino Baldi (bibliotecario e poet), Daniele Pasquini (scrittore e giornalista), Niccolò Scaffai (critico e studioso)Editore/ The Florentine: con 11 anni di esperienza alle spalle nell’industria editoriale, ogni mese The Florentine dà alle stampe un giornale apprezzato e seguito da una vasta comunità internazionale di appassionati d’Italia, che oltre a leggere il cartaceo interagiscono giornalmente e generosamente con i canali online e social media della testata. Inoltre, la casa editrice The Florentine Press ha pubblicato almeno una dozzina di libri sull’arte e su cosa significa vivere in Italia.Autori / Selezionati ed invitati di volta in volta da Direttore, dal consiglio editoriale e curatori, gli autori verranno da tutta Italia.TheFLR costi
