story:
Writers Retreat at The Stanley Hotel - October 20-23rd, 2016


My name is RJ Cavender and I'm fortunate enough to get to work with horror writers and other macabre artists for a living. And I absolutely love meeting their readers and other 'fans of all things creepy' each year at horror industry events.

So it's my pleasure to host our annual Halloween writers and readers retreat at the historic and haunted birthplace of Stephen King's The Shining, The Stanley Hotel in beautiful Estes Park, Colorado. It's a trip  to remember forever...and ever! REDRUM! 

If you want to join us, simply register by choosing a package perk from the campaign and I'll send you a conformation email back within 24-hours.

*Editing Packages and Event Registration does not include your hotel room or transportation fees. Hotel room rates are listed at the bottom of the page.*

Your registration does include limited time group discount perks, select editing packages, and inclusion in outings/trips over the weekend. REDRUM!





We don't want to set a rigid schedule or any programming that would take away from your writing time, since this is a retreat and not a convention or conference. So no dealers room, and other author events will be relaxed and informal meetings over coffee or beers. I consider my events to be modern day symposiums. Oft times more is accomplished in the bar than in the panel room. Let's just have fun, do some writing, see what happens next. The Writers Retreat at The Stanley Hotel 2016 is a unique experience with a great group of authors, readers, and fans in a fantastic hotel with a haunted history steeped in horror (fiction?)

Each package includes different perks that should fit the need of all authors, whether you're looking for some feedback and a polishing of your work...or you're just needing a great place to write and get away. Let us host your once-in-a-lifetime weekend escape, and we'll promise you a great time in a scenic and spooky locale.

I hope you find this idea as exciting as I do, and I invite you to join us for this unique and haunting writing experience! The Stanley Hotel is truly an amazing place...



Advance tickets will be available through the hotel for the Friday Night Murder Mystery Dinner at The Stanley Hotel and the annual Shining Masquerade Ball on Saturday night, as well!

Event registrations/packages for The Writers Retreat at The Stanley Hotel 2016 are transferable, but non-refundable. If you're not entirely sure if you can make it, please don't register. Funds for this event will be spent as they come in, securing rooms, vehicles, and event expenses. Cancellations will create problems, so commit to this now...don't flake out...we'll see you in October! Our thanks to you in advance.

Fees for cancellation with the hotel and every last detail to reserve your guest rooms are listed below. Confirmation of perk/package redemption will be within 24-hours, group discount code for your room at The Stanley Hotel sent via email.

ONLY 40 ROOMS WILL RECEIVE OUR SPECIAL GROUP DISCOUNT THIS YEAR.

To ensure that you don't have to pay the going price for a room, follow the directions I send with registration and RESERVE EARLY. Room Registration for The Writers Retreat at The Stanley Hotel 2016 will open on OCTOBER 20th, 2015. You MUST call the hotel and use the code I give you at registration to receive the group discount for your 4-day stay. If you fail to do so, you may be paying full rates for your room. Any reservations made after October 20th, 2015 may be subject to full rates, as well. So reserve early, and on the date specified, or full rates may apply.

AGAIN, ONLY 40 ROOMS WILL RECEIVE OUR GROUP DISCOUNT THIS YEAR.

Hotel Reservations will begin via phone only starting on October 20th, 2015. No Online reservations will be accepted for this special group rate. Calls only.

When you register, call and reserve your room if you want a discount at The Stanley Hotel, register ASAP. THIS EVENT WILL SELL OUT. Reserve early for discount.

We hope to see you October 20-23rd, 2016 in Estes Park, Colorado! REDRUM!






Keep in mind, we're just minutes away from Rocky Mountain National Park and some fantastic drives and sights to see, weather permitting. We've just decided that a yearly excursion into the park as a group contains too many variables, most of them weather-related, so no official group convoys or trips into the park are scheduled at this time. Sorry for this, snow got us last year.



*Hotel Reservation Information* 


Attendees will be responsible for phoning in their reservations at The Stanley Hotel reservation line at (970) 577-4040 Monday – Friday 9am-4pm.

To receive special group rates, attendees must give the group discount code they received upon registering through this campaign. Reserve your room on October 20th, 2015 for best chances of getting our special group discount. Call then!

Website provided only for reference, you must call with the code I give you at event registration to receive the group rates. Code does not work on the website.

http://www.stanleyhotel.com/

Individuals will be responsible for paying their own room, tax and incidental charges. Guests will call The Stanley Hotel to make a reservation from the group room block and will be required to pay a deposit equal to 1 night  room rental.

Group rate of $209.00 per room, per night will be applied to guest’s entire 4-night stay-- October 20-23rd, 2016. Single or double occupancy.  Only 40 rooms will receive this special group discount, so reserve your room on 10/20/2015. If you reserve your room later than that date, it's conceivable that you may not receive the group discount and will be paying full price on the room subject to hotel's quote.

Individual Cancellation Policy: Individual cancellations received within 30 days of arrival will be charged at the full rate for the entire stay, whether or not the group block commitment has been met or exceeded.

Cutoff Date

The block of rooms will be held until then fill. ONLY 40 DISCOUNT ROOM WILL BE AVAILABLE. Double up, check out other places if town if you have to. Reservations requests after our block fills will be taken on a space available basis at the higher, normal rate.  You can still stay at The Stanley Hotel, but if you reserve later than specified here you're not going to receive a group discount. Reserve your room on October 20th, 2015 to ensure you get the group discount. No seriously. Do it then.

Room Assignments

The reservation department will attempt to accommodate specific requested room types, but cannot guarantee specific room types, locations, or room numbers.  Requested room types that are not included in the group block will be charged the prevailing  guestroom rate at the time the reservation is made. Room 217 is reserved exclusively for your event host and subject to his use and discretion.

Pre/Post Group Rates

The group rates will be honored on space available basis for group attendees up to 3 days before or after the group’s scheduled stay. That's pretty sweet!

Check-in/Check-out/Change Rooms

Check in time begins at 4:00 pm.  Room availability cannot be confirmed until that time.  Check out time is 11:00 am. 

No Shows & Early/Late Departures

Rooms which have been reserved by and whose occupants fail to show on scheduled day of arrival will be billed for the total lodging amount for the contracted time.  Early departures and/or late arrivals will be charged the contracted nightly rate for the entire reserved stay.

Splitting Room Charges

If group attendees are to pay for their own rooms, tax and incidentals AND are sharing rooms, the following must be considered: The Stanley Hotel is unable to divide certain charges (telephone calls, restaurant charges, incidentals, etc.).  It is the responsibility of the individual whose name appears on the reservation folio to finalize all charges between the occupants BEFORE check out.

It is the responsibility of the group leader or meeting planner to inform all attendees of the above.

Package Delivery and Storage

All incoming boxes will incur a $5.00 per box handling fee.  All outgoing boxes will incur a $5.00 per box handling fee in addition to the shipping charges (if the hotel incurs these shipping charges) and must be made via FedEx or UPS with appropriate tracking information. 

Materials for your function may be sent to The Stanley Hotel no earlier than 72 hours prior to the beginning of your event. All packages must be properly addressed to the both client and the conference services manager; they must also outline the name of the group/event and the dates of the function. 

Shipment contents and delivery schedules are not the responsibility of The Stanley Hotel.  Return shipments must be completed within 48 business hours after the close of the event; clients are responsible for packaging and completing all shipping documents prior to departure from the hotel.


Year One - 2014 - Stanley Hotel Writers Retreat Group - Masquerade Ball


The Stanley Hotel Writers Retreat Keytag - $5 each or 5-for-$20!
story_txt:
Writers Retreat at The Stanley Hotel - October 20-23rd, 2016
My name is RJ Cavender and I'm fortunate enough to get to work with 
horror writers and other macabre artists for a living. And I absolutely 
love meeting their readers and other 'fans of all things creepy' each 
year at horror industry events. So it's my pleasure to host our annual Halloween writers and readers retreat at the historic and
haunted birthplace of Stephen King's The Shining, The Stanley Hotel
in beautiful Estes Park, Colorado. It's a trip  to remember forever...and ever! REDRUM!  
If you want to join us, simply register by choosing a package perk from the campaign and I'll send you a conformation email back within 24-hours. 

*Editing Packages and Event Registration does not include your hotel room or
transportation fees. Hotel room rates are listed at the bottom of the page.* 

Your registration does include limited time group discount perks, select
editing packages, and inclusion in outings/trips over the weekend. REDRUM! 
We don't want to set a rigid
schedule or any programming that would take away from your writing time, since
this is a retreat and not a convention or conference. So no dealers room, and other author events will be relaxed and informal meetings over coffee or beers. I consider my events to be modern day symposiums. Oft times more is accomplished in the bar than in the panel room. Let's just have fun, do some writing, see what happens next. The Writers Retreat at The Stanley Hotel 2016 is a unique experience with a great
group of authors, readers, and fans in a fantastic hotel with a
haunted history steeped in horror (fiction?) 

Each package includes different perks that should fit the need of all authors,
whether you're looking for some feedback and a polishing of your work...or
you're just needing a great place to write and get away. Let us host your
once-in-a-lifetime weekend escape, and we'll promise you a great time in a
scenic and spooky locale. 
I hope you find this idea as exciting as I 
do, and
I invite you to join us for this unique and haunting writing 
experience! The Stanley Hotel is truly an amazing place...Advance tickets will be available through the hotel
for the Friday Night Murder Mystery Dinner at The Stanley Hotel and the annual
Shining Masquerade Ball on Saturday night, as well! 
Event registrations/packages for The Writers Retreat at The Stanley Hotel 2016 are transferable, but non-refundable.
If you're not entirely sure if you can make it, please don't register.
Funds for this event will be spent as they come in, securing rooms, vehicles,
and event expenses. Cancellations will create problems, so commit to this
now...don't flake out...we'll see you in October! Our thanks to you in advance. 

Fees for cancellation with the hotel and every last detail to reserve your guest rooms are
listed below. Confirmation of perk/package redemption will be within 24-hours, group discount code for your room at The Stanley Hotel sent via email. ONLY 40 ROOMS WILL RECEIVE OUR SPECIAL GROUP DISCOUNT THIS YEAR.To ensure that you don't have to pay the going price for a room, follow the directions I send with registration and RESERVE EARLY. Room Registration for The Writers Retreat at The Stanley Hotel 2016 will open on OCTOBER 20th, 2015. You MUST call the hotel and use the code I give you at registration to receive the group discount for your 4-day stay. If you fail to do so, you may be paying full rates for your room. Any reservations made after October 20th, 2015 may be subject to full rates, as well. So reserve early, and on the date specified, or full rates may apply. 
AGAIN, ONLY 40 ROOMS WILL RECEIVE OUR GROUP DISCOUNT THIS YEAR.Hotel Reservations will begin via phone only starting on October 20th, 2015. No Online reservations will be accepted for this special group rate. Calls only. When you register, call and reserve your room if you want a discount at The Stanley Hotel, register ASAP. THIS EVENT WILL SELL OUT. Reserve early for discount. 
We hope to see you October 20-23rd, 2016 in Estes Park, Colorado! REDRUM! 
Keep in mind, we're just minutes away from Rocky Mountain National Park and some fantastic drives and sights to see, weather permitting. We've just decided that a yearly excursion into the park as a group contains too many variables, most of them weather-related, so no official group convoys or trips into the park are scheduled at this time. Sorry for this, snow got us last year.

responsible for phoning in their reservations at The Stanley Hotel 
reservation line at (970) 577-4040 Monday – Friday 9am-4pm.To 
receive special group rates, attendees must give the group discount code
 they received upon registering through this campaign. Reserve your room on October 20th, 2015 for best chances of getting our special group discount. Call then! Website provided only for reference, you must call with the code I give you at event registration to receive the group rates. Code does not work on the website. http://www.stanleyhotel.com/Individuals

If you reserve your room later than that date, it's conceivable that you may not receive the group discount and will be paying full price on the room subject to hotel's quote. Individual

story:
About Runes for Writers

I'm passionate about Story. I believe stories have the power to transform lives and to help readers better understand themselves, their value, and their place in the world.

I've been writing fiction and studying various forms of esoteric and shamanic practices for more than 20 years. This project is an outgrowth of this experience, harnessing the divinatory power of the Norse Runes (Elder Futhark) for application to the writing process.

I created Runes for Writers to help writers (and storytellers in any medium) access their deepest levels of creativity, break through writer's block, and develop characters and stories that are deep, rich, and transformative.

The complete system will be comprised of rune cards, tiles, and dice, each of which can be used to solve specific challenges of writing and creativity. We're also developing an introductory booklet, full-length manual, runecasting notepads, and mobile app.

What We Need & What You Get

While independent book publishing has become more and more accessible, custom production of card and dice sets is a much more expensive project. Your generous funding will help us with:

  • Printing of custom Rune Cards and notepads
  • Production of custom Rune Dice
  • Laser-engraving of custom Rune Tiles
  • Publication of user's manual (print and digital)
  • Print and assembly of packaging
  • Publicity and promotional materials
  • Mobile app development (stretch goal)

The target funding level of $15,000 is for an initial production run of 200 sets each of cards, tiles, and dice sets.

Perks include complete sets of the cards, tiles, and/or dice sets, print and digital materials, special limited-edition items (e.g., T-shirts), and consulting services. Depending on funding levels, more unique perks may be offered. Stay tuned!

Risks & Challenges

A number of successful crowd-funding campaigns have been launched for Tarot cards. The Runes are comparable in use and power, though less well known than the Tarot.

As part of my efforts to get the word out, I'll be conducting blog tours and in-person workshops to help build a deeper base of interest.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you're able to contribute, you can help spread the word and generate interest in this project. Please share this campaign in your social media circles and among your writing community. If you are part of a critique group or other writer's organization, please contact me to arrange a workshop (in-person or online).

story:
The project

Originally published in 1998, The Road of Ice and Salt is an award-winning, cult horror novella by Mexican author José Luis Zárate. Although Zárate is one of the most important speculative fiction writers of his generation, his work has not been translated into English. Innsmouth Free Press will produce an English-language, print and digital edition (translated by David Bowles) of The Road of Ice and Salt, with an accompanying essay and afterword.

The book will be commercially available to the public on April 20, 2020. Backers of this campaign will receive their copies on March 20, 2020.

 

Why translate this book?

The Road of Ice and Salt is told from the point of view of the captain of a ship headed from Varna to Whitby with an unusual cargo: fifty boxes filled with Transylvanian soil. The name of this ill-fated ship is the Demeter. Yes, that Demeter which brings Dracula to England. Like Mary Reilly and Pym, The Road of Ice and Salt is a re-exploration of the Gothic. It provides an important and unusual look at speculative fiction in Latin America outside of the category of the magic realist.

It is also a heady, gloriously ornate work of vampire fiction that tackles homosexual desire, Victorian repression and  traditional horror fixtures. Click on the image below to read a sample or follow this link.

 

The team behind the book

The novella will be published by Innsmouth Free Press, a Canadian micro-press owned and operated by Silvia Moreno-Garcia, who together with Paula R. Stiles, won a World Fantasy Award for the anthology She Walks in Shadows. She Walks in Shadows was also a crowd-funded project. Rest assured, we know what we are doing.

David Bowles is a Mexican-American author and translator from south Texas, where he teaches at the University of Texas Río Grande Valley. He has written several books, most notably They Call Me Güero: A Border Kid's Poems (Tomás Rivera Mexican American Children's Book Award, Claudia Lewis Award for Excellence in Poetry, Pura Belpré Honor Book, Walter Dean Myers Honor Book).  In 2017, Bowles was inducted into the Texas Institute of Letters.

Silvia Moreno-Garcia has edited and published many anthologies, including the World Fantasy Award-winning She Walks in Shadows (a.k.a. Cthulhu's Daughters).  She is a co-editor at the horror magazine The Dark. She is also the author of several novels, including the Jazz Age fantasy Gods of Jade and Shadow. 

The author

José Luis Zárate is a key figure of the Mexican fantastic literature of the 1980s. Together with Gerardo Porcayo, he created the first online Mexican science fiction magazine, La Langosta se ha Posado, in 1992. He is a winner of the Premio Internacional de Novela de Ciencia Ficción y Fantasía MECyF and Premio Kalpa. Zárate is best-known for a trilogy of short novels centred around key popular culture figures – Dracula, Superman and El Santo. He studied Linguistics and Literature and now teaches a course on fantastic literature in his native city of Puebla.

 

The perks

Get The Road of Ice and Salt or opt for one of our packages containing other Innsmouth Free Press titles, including: 

  • Prime Meridian: An introspective, near-future novella about a young Mexican woman who wants to go to Mars.  Locus magazine called it one of the best novellas of 2017. 
  • She Walks in Shadows: Winner of the World Fantasy Award, this all-woman anthology collects stories inspired by the work of H.P. Lovecraft.
  • And for the dedicated collector there's a paperback, Turkish edition of She Walks in Shadows.

story:
Story of My Book

The book is called Momentum, How You can Leverage Positivity and Leadership to Live a Life Worth Living.  This book shares the stories and experiences of all types of people with varying backgrounds and career paths. They all, however, offer advice that can apply to anyone. 

My name is Logan Kamer and I am the author of Momentum. I wrote this book initially I knew I would want to write a book at some point in my life, and I love taking on challenges. It’s also served as a great way to network, gain knowledge, and share that knowledge with others. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how you can leverage an authentic, positive mindset and self-leadership techniques in order to achieve your own goals and dreams. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for mindset and leadership in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you become the best version of yourself.

In this book, you'll learn about Positivity and Leadership:

  • How I have benefited from an authentic positive mindset
  • The difference between good and great leaders
  • How you can leverage the concept of “self-leadership” to kick-start your life! 

You will love this book if you are ambitious, looking to grow in any way, and want to maximize your potential. Momentum  is a non-fiction book that speaks to college students and young adults, who are looking to lead themselves first, inspire others as a result and harness a positive mindset for the first time. 
 

The Book - Momentum

The book is written in 16 chapters, all dealing with a different person 

You’ll see stories from a...

•2x World Cup Champion and 2x Olympic Gold Medalist, Kristine Lilly
•An entrepreneur who built her life around pickles and positivity 
•A Chick-fil-A employee who has a wildly inspiring life motto

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2019 
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this December.

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

About the Author

Logan Kamer studied at High Point University and currently is looking to kickstart his career with Gartner in Fort Myers, Florida. He served as President of Alpha Kappa Psi, Chi Rho Chapter at HPU, VP of Social Media for the Sales Club, and he continues to strive daily to achieve personal goals and balance his core values of health, wealth, love, and happiness. 

He wrote this book because he is extremely passionate about embodying an authentic positive mindset and taking control of your own life first, in order to be able to give to others. He became really interested in what makes a great leader from a good leader, how to build culture in the workplace, and the importance of knowing when to be an optimist, and when to come back down to earth. 

Outside of this book, Logan is passionate about playing golf with friends, staying fit between going to the gym regularly and eating clean, as well as spending quality time with friends and family. 

For more information, you can connect with Logan at logankamer16@gmail.com. Also find him on Instagram and Twitter at @lkamer301 and LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/logankamer/

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

I completely understand if you can't purchase a copy at this moment, but would really appreciate some shares across social media, and it would be incredible if you could open this up to your network:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #MomentumBook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page!
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media. 

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Logan Kamer

He became really interested in what makes a great leader from a good leader, how to build culture in the workplace, and the importance of knowing when to be an optimist, and when to come back down to earth. Outside of this book, Logan is passionate about playing golf with friends, staying fit between going to the gym regularly and eating clean, as well as spending quality time with friends and family. For more information, you can connect with Logan at logankamer16@gmail.com. Also find him on Instagram and Twitter at @lkamer301 and LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/logankamer/Risks & ChallengesThe biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.Other Ways You Can HelpI completely understand if you can't purchase a copy at this moment, but would really appreciate some shares across social media, and it would be incredible if you could open this up to your network:
Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #MomentumBook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page!
Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media. 
Thank you so much of all of your love and support!Logan Kamer

story:
Story of My Book

Spinning Threads is the story of a young girl who reluctantly flies down to a retirement community in Florida on a writing assignment for work. To her surprise, she becomes friends with one of the residents and not only learns her story, but also becomes involved in an adventure with elements of mystery and romance. Throughout this process, she also learns about herself. 

My name is Maria and I am the author of Spinning Threads. I wrote this book because I’ve always wanted to write a creative fiction novel that explores the art of storytelling and incorporates elements of my great grandma’s out-of-this-world love story. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you’ll be more curious about other people’s stories, no matter how different they may be from your. This book can be an opportunity to think about how you connect with others and see, in the process, what you can learn about yourself. Through the mystery and romance sub-plots, you’ll find yourself cheering for my protagonist, Penelope, and learning alongside her the importance of listening to others to better understand yourself. 

Penelope is a young woman who got her first job out of college at a luxury magazine in NY. For her first assignment, she is sent down to Naples, Florida to write an article on one of the residents at a retirement community. Although she’s at first reluctant to take on the assignment, Penelope finds herself developing a friendship with another resident in the community: Juliana. Through this friendship, Penelope gets involved in a mystery and a romance that changes the way she thinks about herself and her relationships with others. 

As she learns to listen and not just hear, Juliana’s love story inspires Penelope. By allowing herself to care for her new friend, Penelope delves into an unsolved mystery in her past. As it becomes clear that this mystery is not contained to the past but rather still developing, Penelope finds herself playing a crucial role in its unravelling, consolidating a very profound friendship with Juliana and those involved in it. Moreover, she gains a new perspective on herself and starts rethinking her previous perspectives on life. 

You will love this book if you’re interested in seeing characters develop meaningful, interpersonal connections through storytelling and the act of uncovering details about their past. You’ll love this book if you’re looking for a fun but also thought-provoking read that will have you invested in the protagonist and start asking questions about the relationships in your life.  

Spinning Threads speaks to both older and younger generations who want to delve into the concepts of intergenerational storytelling and self-discovery in a new way. 

Ultimately, I hope that Spinning Threads inspires reflection and dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:
  • How can the act of hearing other people’s stories, especially those you initially think are uninteresting, help you better understand yourself?
  • Young people think old people have antiquated beliefs, and old people think the young ones lack empathy and are too individualistic. How often are these beliefs furthered by confirmation biases and, hence, hampering meaningful intergenerational connections?
  • People talk a lot about diversity in gender or race, but not as much in age. Why is it important to include people from all generations in contemporary dialogue?
I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe that discussing the power of intergenerational storytelling to foster empathy and lead to self-discovery will change us all for the better. 
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.

  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this upcoming Spring!
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Maria Suarez is an Emory University BBA and Creative Writing graduate who’s now working at Azul Arc, a digital design and software development firm in Atlanta as a Marketing and Product Manager associate. 

After hearing her great-grandmother’s out-of-this-world love story, unlike any contemporary modern romance story, and seeing the power of intergenerational storytelling to bring generations together, she was inspired to write this book. Moreover, she’s always had a passion for hearing and reading stories as a means to understand other people’s realities, so she’s always wanted to write a novel that can transport readers from all walks of lives into the world of her protagonist. 

Maria has a big sweet tooth and she loves exploring new coffee shops with friends and family. She’s also enthusiastic about traveling as a means to learn more about the history of different places and their people. When it comes to what she reads and watches for fun, Maria loves anything crime/ thriller and she’s always looking for new recommendations!

For more information, you can connect with Maria Suarez at maria.f.suarez@alumni.emory.com and at @fictionauthormariasuarez, www.linkedin.com/in/mariafsuarez/ or ... 
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #SpinningThreads and tag me (@fictionauthormariasuarez) as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Maria Suarez

story:
¿Qué?

Nunca pretendí ser un héroe es una novela de personajes, que ahonda en la humanidad de los mismos, con el telón de la guerra como fondo recordando por momentos a las mejores obras de Tomás Salvador o Sven Hassel

¿Cuál es el camino para escapar de la pobreza, de la miseria, de la deseperación? ¿Qué recursos, actitudes, empeños son necesarios? Esta es la historia de un luchador, un valiente, un héroe que nunca se consideró como tal. ¿Sus hazañas?: luchar con todas sus fuerzas por escapar del pozo en el que la vida le había sumido. Pero no en una escapada individual, egoísta, sino llevando consigo a todos cuantos quería.

Una novela de guerra donde lo que importa es la generosidad rodeada de ternura y con las dosis de picaresca que, por qué negarlo, a veces, requiere la lucha diaria por la supervivencia.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Miguel Ángel Durán.

Nacido en Madrid en 1948, es ingeniero, y apasionado por la escritura en todos sus géneros. Nunca pretendí ser un héroe es su cuarta novela, tras Entre dos juramentos, Encuentros y 4.999.999. En todas sus historias, lo que importa es el ser humano, sus esperanzas y anhelos de felicidad. El autor siempre propone el camino necesario para alcanzarlos. 

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Un domingo de junio yo estaba tomando un vino con varios amigos en un bar de la plaza; a nuestro lado, otro grupo de chavales hablaban de la guerra en Rusia y de la posibilidad de apuntarse en lo que unos llamaban la División Española de Voluntarios y otros la División Azul»  

«Me despedí de toda mi familia; mis hermanos lloraban; mi padre se acercó hasta mí, y quitándose la boina, me dio con ella un trallazo en la cabeza diciéndome: “Ya eres un hombre. A ver cómo te portas”, a la vez que me ponía un duro en el bolsillo. Mi madre me abrazó con todas sus fuerzas, de forma que era imposible soltarse»

«Van cayendo combatientes como moscas. Caen de un bando y del otro, pero la enorme superioridad numérica de los rusos enseguida se hace patente, cada uno de nuestros hombres se enfrenta simultáneamente a tres de los suyos»

«Comprendí que solo había una salida: luchar; continuar la lucha. No con fusiles ni tanques, pero sí con el mismo arrojo, con la misma valentía, con la misma furia»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción BACK IT es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Miguel Ángel Durán vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad

story:
Short Summary

A Compendium of Unnatural Black Magic is a striking tome. It contains seven different, previously-untranslated, texts pertaining all to the same school of magic, which grew apart from its contemporary Faustian Tradition. The texts included are:

  • Kornreuther's Magia Ordinis and The Legitimate Kornreutter.
  • Herpentil's The Book of the Mightiest Spirits, The Embodiment of the Unnatural Magic, and the Herpentills Salomonis.
  • Michael Scot's Compendium of Unnatural Black Magic.
  • St. Gertrude of Nivelles' Libellus St. Gertrudis.

We also include the original texts so that the readers are able to compare the translation against their Latin or German counterparts.

With your help we can make this book a reality! We expect to be able to fund the first edition of this book with this Pre-Sale. (UPDATE: We have reached our goal so this book is definitely beign released!)

How does this work?

Although we have chosen a "crowdfunding" format for our pre-sale, we are not asking for your money in exchange for nothing. Here you can buy your copy of the book in advance before it goes on sale, and you may also buy 2 copies with a 10% discount.

It is important to mention that if we do not reach the desired goal (2200 USD) we will be cancelling the publication of this book. In that case every person who has put some money into it will get it refunded.

The Plans on the Book

The book has been finished in its digital form, which means that it is ready to go to the printers. Of course it will still take some time after we have gotten all the pre-orders to have it printed as we still need to check that the printed version of the book is in the requested quality.

This pre-order is for the deluxe edition only. Which means that it will be limited to 200 copies. It will be a cloth-bound hard-cover with a sigil stamped on the front and the title on the spine.

story:
Journalism is under attack

We're a group of dedicated journalists and San Jose natives who grew up here, worked here, lived here and care about giving back to our community. Our local news landscape continues to shrink at a time when journalism is under attack across the country. We're here to fill the gap.

Introducing San Jose Spotlight, the city's first nonprofit news organization dedicated to political and business reporting.

Our community needs another voice, an alternative source for high-quality, independent local news. Our stories will search for truth, shed light on wrongdoing and hold the powerful accountable. We are the community's newsroom and we're powered by your support and donations.

Please help us meet our goal to bring independent journalism to San Jose in 2019.

Our community needs another voice, an alternative source for high-quality, independent local news. Our stories will search for truth, shed light on wrongdoing and hold the powerful accountable. We are the community's newsroom and we're powered by your support and donations.
Please help us meet our goal to bring independent journalism to San Jose in 2019.

story:
¿Qué?

Lo que no te conté es un thriller acerca del pasado que se cierne amenazador sobre un personaje en continuo descubrimiento de quién es y de dónde procede.

Jorge regresa a su pueblo para pasar unos días junto a su padre, y se encuentra por accidente con el diario oculto de Alicia, su madre, a la que perdió siendo un crío. Su lectura le permite descubrir que toda su vida se cimienta en una gran mentira, marcada por un crimen del que fueron cómplices seres queridos, empujándolo hacia una búsqueda obsesiva de una verdad sepultada en el olvido.

Una historia sobre la determinación de aquellos que buscan desagravio para los que ya no pueden luchar por sí mismos. Un crisol de misterio, aventura, crimen, amor.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy se nos presenta Alberto Puyana.

Nací en Cádiz en el convulso 1974, y crecí entre programas de TV de Alfred Hitchcock presenta y las Historias para no dormir de Chicho Ibáñez Serrador. Siendo adolescente, descubrí a Poe, HP Lovecraft, Stephen King y Clive Barker, de ahí posiblemente mi pasión por la literatura de misterio. Tanto para leer como para escribir.

Fruto de esta inquietud por la creación narrativa y de mis experiencias de pasillo por distintos hospitales, publiqué en el año 2012 mi primera novela, El Preticante, que sin embargo es una sátira basada en anécdotas reales… un humilde homenaje a otro de los escritores que me marcaron: Tom Sharpe.

 A partir de entonces, me atreví a probar suerte en el mundo de los concursos literarios, consiguiendo hasta ahora 25 premios por toda la geografía española y varias publicaciones en distintas antologías de relato, publicadas por distintas editoriales.

Colaboro cada semana como columnista de opinión del periódico La Voz del Sur desde 2015.

Lo que no te conté, mi segunda novela (esta que te presento), fue semifinalista del Premio Ateneo Ciudad de Valladolid de Novela en el año 2013, y es mi primera incursión en la ficción novelada de misterio.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 840€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Lo que no te conté que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Alberto Puyana vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Why does the world need this book?

If this recent lockdown experience has taught us anything it's that the world is going crazy. Many have lost trust in experts and just don't know what to believe any more.

People hurl links at each other on social media like ninja stars and there are so many 'alternative facts' that the truth gets lost along the way.

There are many debunking and fact checking websites out there but only hard-core skeptics visit them. The language of science is often inaccessible and dismissive to the uninitiated.

So I want to write Science For Hippies to provide a simple, friendly guide to what science and critical thinking are all about. The book will explore the scientific method, cognitive biases, the uses and limits of intuition and address common concerns about funding and credibility.

The book won't offer detailed breakdowns of why individual conspiracy theories aren't true. No one likes to be told why they're wrong (and especially not in detail!).  Instead we'll look at how can we know anything at all? Not what to think but how.

And that can help make the world a better place to live in.

Why raise money for this book?

I'll be honest: I thought I'd sooner sell a kidney than do a crowdfunding campaign. I find it excruciatingly awkward to ask anyone for money.

I'm an experienced writer, however, and think that I can write a book that's worth reading. So here you can order your copy of the book in advance and I have something to live on in the meanwhile.

The truth is, however, I'll write the book whether I reach the target or not - it will just take a lot longer!

And if there's momentum behind this campaign then I can also make videos and podcasts to accompany the chapters. There will also be a blog where you can see the ongoing work and I'd like this to be the seed for a movement to reconcile science with spirituality.

To be honest, if you're already the kind of person who reads science of a regular basis this book won't teach you much. But don't you know 1 or 2 (or 50!) people who could really do with learning the basics?

Why should I write Science For Hippies?

I used to believe a lot of...interesting things.

But then I read and read and read and discovered that amazing superpower that science bestows: the ability to change my mind. I learned to recognise the flaws in own thinking and learned how science makes the world a more magical place, not less.

I've written 5 books and so I know how to create structure and narrative, how to edit and craft a bunch of thoughts and stories into something worth reading. And I've already written a lot about alternative culture.

You can download here for free my book about the Rainbow Gatherings - rainbow gatherings are kind of a month-long autonomous gathering of free spirits in isolated places across the world. 

Or you can to www.tomthumb.org to see other examples of my storytelling.

And I'd love your feedback. Perhaps together we can help  restore some reason to a world that needs it more now than ever before.

www.scienceforhippies.com

story:
Kissing him goodbye as he left for work, only to be crying oceans of tears later that evening when she realizes something is wrong when he doesn't come home.  Emma Briggs was the frilly sort.  Her husband Ethan was a bit of a nerd.  She loved him, heart and soul.  Emma had always known she would be with Ethan forever...that is, until he doesn't come home from his first day at the University.  Questions arose and worry was to be had, until a week later when she received an anonymous letter that her beloved Ethan was dead and along with the letter, Ethan's leather bound journal that documented every moment of his life, starting with the day he disappeared. 

Emma refuses to believe her soul mate is gone from the world and sets out to retrace Ethan's tracks with the guide of her journal.  The mission seems to be dead-ending at every turn until she is face to face in her hotel room with Ethan, just three days into her search. 

After only moments of drinking in his beautiful face, she realizes that the man in front of her has a significantly obvious birthmark where Ethan had none.  If this isn't Ethan, then who is it?  And where is Ethan?

ABOUT:

"Dear Journal: Entry One" is a novel written by Melinda Williams.  Melinda Williams is featured in the Anthology titled, "Once Upon A Time; A Collection of Unexpected Fairytales" Edited by S.J. Holliday and Anna Meade, available on Amazon.com.  Featured for her short story, titled "A Single Rose", Melinda realized that there were many stories at her fingertips and set to writing. 
She has completed two mini novels, featured again at Amazon.com including KDP Select and since, she has completed her novel "Dear Journal: Entry One". 

Being a mother of three beautiful children, Melinda felt strongly about getting her stories told and becoming someone her children could be proud of, along with her family.  Pouring days and nights into her writing, she lacks many of the necessary skills required to put her talent through to the next level.  That's where this project comes in.

Funding of this project will go to the production of the book: The actual printing, the costs of editing, cover art, isbn's, taxes, shipping and other general expenses related to getting the story out there.

While I realize that dreams should be chased and hard work comes with the territory of chasing said dreams, I also realize that my heart and soul have been poured into this project and sometimes in life, it's okay to ask for help.  There will and have been so many trials and tribulations in my journey to telling my story and I have so many more to go through.  In the process, I see this stage of my dream being the one where I pause to take a breath and ask for readers, book lovers and everyone else to consider helping make a very dedicated and hopeful writers dreams come to life in her hands with the result of her novel.

Thank you in advance for taking the time to read about my project and if funded, the book will be published in three formats:

A paperback edition for retail distribution.

An epub edition for the Kindle, Nook, or iPad, or for retail distribution.

Never let your dreams fade.  Chase them through every long night awake, through every backspace, through every grueling research session.  Never give up.  I know I won't.

story:
Brave or Stupid

by Tracey Christiansen

How does a middle-aged, seasick electrician with no money end up spending three years sailing around the world?

Dreams have a logic all their own. Some start with a flash of insight or a moment of recklessness. This one started with a handshake.

On a cycling holiday in France in 1997, my best friend Carl asked me an unexpected question.

“I’m going to sail around the world. Would you like to come with me?”

“Are you serious? You have no boat, we have no money and neither one of us knows the first thing about sailing. What’s more, I get seasick in 2 minutes. Believe me, if decades of nagging from my father hasn’t gotten me out on water, what makes you think I’m going to start now?”

The subject changed and we got on with our cycling, but the conversation stayed with me. After a very long, sleepless night I found myself saying “You know it might not be such a bad idea, after all. I mean, how hard can it be? You’re on.”

So we shook hands and it was a done deal. The little details – buying a boat, learning to sail and saving up money – took five years, but in 2002, we sailed away from Helsingborg, Sweden for a three year voyage that would change both of us forever.

I came home a new man with new dreams. One of them was writing a book.

 

 

 

A story that deserves a bigger audience.

Today, Carl and I lecture all over Sweden about our experiences. In response to audience reactions, we wrote a book in Swedish about the voyage.

Our story, however, is bigger and deserves a bigger audience. This is why I’ve brought in a talented writer, Tracey Christiansen, to help retell our story in English. The Spanish multi-artist Rodolfo Navarro will help us with illustrations, layout and music for the DVD.

The result is Brave or Stupid, a book for anyone who has ever had a dream, anyone who has ever gone beyond what is sensible and realistic to discover a whole new world outside and a whole new person inside. The book is full of photos and illustrations from a journey that is everything you would expect and much you wouldn’t.

story:
Romero Travels to University of Central Florida

Help spoken word artist David A. Romero get to his first out of state college gig(s)!

  • I'm a proud Pocho/Chicano spoken word artist based out of Diamond Bar, CA. I have opened for Ozomatli and am the second artist to have been featured on All Def Digital, a YouTube channel from Russell Simmons.
  • UPDATE: CHAMPLAIN COLLEGE in Burlington, Vermont will be my first out of state college appearance! The University of Central Florida will be my second. For more than 6 years now, I have been developing myself as a spoken word artist. About 3 years ago, I started performing at colleges in Southern California and receiving honorariums for my performances. Many, including family members, have told me that my dreams of becoming a professional spoken word artist were impractical. This summer was rough (as it was for many spoken word artists) and I have found myself without the necessary funding to make it out to this first out of state appearance. That's why I need your help: to make this first big step towards regularly touring as a professional poet.
  • I pride myself on the fact that I booked these shows without an agency and without a manager. I'm just a simple guy from Diamond Bar. I spent hours this summer compiling lists of college contacts. I put my own EPK together and trained myself how to build my own website. Some may consider me a dreamer, but I assure you, I'm also a grinder and have worked hard to get this booking and will work hard to get the funds necessary to make this trip. Funds generated from these college appearances will go towards funding my next trips. I hope to book even more out of state gigs! The goal is to become self-sufficient from here on out. Long-term goals include the formation of a scholarship for Latino students with an interest in film-making and/or spoken word.

Hey, where is this money going to anyways?

"If you don't know where you come from, how're you supposed to know where you're going?"

  • Airfare (rounds up to about $500), hotel (rounds up to about $400). I may also need to pay for cab fare to get to my hotel and to the University from the hotel ($100+). Plus, extra costs always come up. This site also takes a cut. You know how it is. I assure you though, I'm looking to book cheap and will not be spending your hard-earned dollar on any frivolities (did I mention that I'm almost two years sober?).
  • Here are your perks:
  • $5: NEW PERK: A "I <3 Cheese Enchiladas" 1" mini button (Any public donor for $5 or more gets this too!)
  • $10: I'll take a picture at the University of Central Florida before the show starts with a paper that says "Thank You (Your Name)" and email it to you! (Any public donor for $10 or more gets this too!)
  • $20: You get a handwritten thank you card with a unique short poem in there just for you!
  • $50: A copy of Voices of Highland Park (a poetry book that came out of a workshop series for middle school and high school students I participated in. I edited and designed the book!) Also, you get a full poem dedicated to you included in a handwritten thank you card.
  • $75: A signed copy of Diamond Bars: The Street Version or Fuzhou, my first two books of poetry. You also get the full poem written for you in the handwritten thank you card.
  • $100: Signed copies of Diamond Bars: The Street Version and Fuzhou. You might also get a copy of Ellendale Night (my third book of poetry, supplies limited). You get a full poem written for you, or for a loved one. I will memorize the poem and record a performance if you'd like! Then, I will upload it onto the YouTube and you can share it with your friends and family!
  • $200: A signed Cheese Enchiladas or Diamond Bars: The Street Version poster. You also get signed copies of Diamond Bars: The Street Version and Fuzhou. You get the full poem, memorized by me and uploaded onto the YouTube.
  • $500: You get a personal appearance from me at your party, college, whatever! I'll perform 30-60 minutes for your enjoyment! Unfortunately, this only applies to supporters in SoCal. If you're not in SoCal, and would still like to donate this amount, you will get 3 poems written and memorized by me and uploaded onto the YouTube. Best thing is, these 3 poems can be on a topic of your choosing! Woohoo! You also get everything that was listed before and I'll think of some other stuff to throw in.
  • Every single bit of the funds I raise will be used to fund my trip. The more I am able to get from you supporters, the less I will have to try to get from a bank or from another financial institution. Due to the fact that my credit is in bad shape, this will be helpful indeed.
  • Any money raised over the campaign goal will go towards funding future trips.

What does it all mean?

"If you're not proud of who you are, what're you going to be proud of?

  • True to the name of the tour, I'll be performing "My Name is Romero." To stand with the undocumented, I'll be performing recent hit "Undocumented Football." To attack public figures who would either spread hatred towards Latinos or turn their backs on our people during these turbulent times, I'll be performing "Open Letter to Katt Williams" and "Open Letter to Edward James Olmos." To make people laugh and explain why I can't speak Spanish and my other eccentricities, I'll be performing "Make Me More Mexican," "Sweet Pocho Pie" and "Pardon My French." Of course, Vermont and Florida will be salivating over crowd favorite "Cheese Enchiladas" and I'm excited to announce that I'll be expanding a poem called "Death Wears a Black Hoodie" that deals with the murder of Trayvon Martin. When I am at my best, my poetry speaks for the voiceless. When I am at my best, my poetry moves crowds to laugh hysterically, to think critically, to feel hungry, to cry tears of joy or sorrow and to raise their fists in protest. 
  • I have received honorariums from USC, UCLA, Loyola Marymount University, Occidental College, Chapman University, the University of La Verne, Cal Poly Pomona, Cal State Fullerton and more. So, I am not just any geek off the street. I'm handy with the metaphors and similes if you know what I mean. I need your push to start doing this across the country.
  • I'm traveling to represent Los Angeles. I'm the Mexican-American guy from the suburbs with a big heart and big dreams of putting it down for my hometown and for Boyle Heights and East LA (where my parents are from). I was the first person in my family to graduate from college. My father wanted me to be a writer, I tell you his patience will pay off someday.

Broke like me? You can still help!

"Telemarketing Juliets... Calling from their ivy covered balconies..."

  • Spread the word to any and all patrons of the arts that you may know!

Thanks for your time and consideration. Please donate now.

Some may consider me a dreamer, but I assure you, I'm also a grinder and have worked hard to get this booking and will work hard to get the funds necessary to make this trip. Funds generated from these college appearances will go towards funding my next trips. I hope to book even more out of state gigs! The goal is to become self-sufficient from here on out. Long-term goals include the formation of a scholarship for Latino students with an interest in film-making and/or spoken word.



Hey, where is this money going to anyways?
"If you don't know where you come from, how're you supposed to know where you're going?"

Airfare (rounds up to about $500), hotel (rounds up to about $400). I may also need to pay for cab fare to get to my hotel and to the University from the hotel ($100+). Plus, extra costs always come up. This site also takes a cut. You know how it is. I assure you though, I'm looking to book cheap and will not be spending your hard-earned dollar on any frivolities (did I mention that I'm almost two years sober?).
Here are your perks:
$5: NEW PERK: A "I <3 Cheese Enchiladas" 1" mini button (Any public donor for $5 or more gets this too!)
$10: I'll take a picture at the University of Central Florida before the show starts with a paper that says "Thank You (Your Name)" and email it to you! (Any public donor for $10 or more gets this too!)
$20: You get a handwritten thank you card with a unique short poem in there just for you!
$50: A copy of Voices of Highland Park (a poetry book that came out of a workshop series for middle school and high school students I participated in. I edited and designed the book!) Also, you get a full poem dedicated to you included in a handwritten thank you card.
$75: A signed copy of Diamond Bars: The Street Version or Fuzhou, my first two books of poetry. You also get the full poem written for you in the handwritten thank you card.
$100: Signed copies of Diamond Bars: The Street Version and Fuzhou. You might also get a copy of Ellendale Night (my third book of poetry, supplies limited). You get a full poem written for you, or for a loved one. I will memorize the poem and record a performance if you'd like! Then, I will upload it onto the YouTube and you can share it with your friends and family!
$200: A signed Cheese Enchiladas or Diamond Bars: The Street Version poster. You also get signed copies of Diamond Bars: The Street Version and Fuzhou. You get the full poem, memorized by me and uploaded onto the YouTube.
$500: You get a personal appearance from me at your party, college, whatever! I'll perform 30-60 minutes for your enjoyment! Unfortunately, this only applies to supporters in SoCal. If you're not in SoCal, and would still like to donate this amount, you will get 3 poems written and memorized by me and uploaded onto the YouTube. Best thing is, these 3 poems can be on a topic of your choosing! Woohoo! You also get everything that was listed before and I'll think of some other stuff to throw in.
Every single bit of the funds I raise will be used to fund my trip. The more I am able to get from you supporters, the less I will have to try to get from a bank or from another financial institution. Due to the fact that my credit is in bad shape, this will be helpful indeed.
Any money raised over the campaign goal will go towards funding future trips.



What does it all mean?
"If you're not proud of who you are, what're you going to be proud of?

True to the name of the tour, I'll be performing "My Name is Romero." To stand with the undocumented, I'll be performing recent hit "Undocumented Football." To attack public figures who would either spread hatred towards Latinos or turn their backs on our people during these turbulent times, I'll be performing "Open Letter to Katt Williams" and "Open Letter to Edward James Olmos." To make people laugh and explain why I can't speak Spanish and my other eccentricities, I'll be performing "Make Me More Mexican," "Sweet Pocho Pie" and "Pardon My French." Of course, Vermont and Florida will be salivating over crowd favorite "Cheese Enchiladas" and I'm excited to announce that I'll be expanding a poem called "Death Wears a Black Hoodie" that deals with the murder of Trayvon Martin. When I am at my best, my poetry speaks for the voiceless. When I am at my best, my poetry moves crowds to laugh hysterically, to think critically, to feel hungry, to cry tears of joy or sorrow and to raise their fists in protest. 
I have received honorariums from USC, UCLA, Loyola Marymount University, Occidental College, Chapman University, the University of La Verne, Cal Poly Pomona, Cal State Fullerton and more. So, I am not just any geek off the street. I'm handy with the metaphors and similes if you know what I mean. I need your push to start doing this across the country.
I'm traveling to represent Los Angeles. I'm the Mexican-American guy from the suburbs with a big heart and big dreams of putting it down for my hometown and for Boyle Heights and East LA (where my parents are from). I was the first person in my family to graduate from college. My father wanted me to be a writer, I tell you his patience will pay off someday.



Broke like me? You can still help!
"Telemarketing Juliets... Calling from their ivy covered balconies..."
Spread the word to any and all patrons of the arts that you may know!
Thanks for your time and consideration. Please donate now.

story:
Thank you to everyone who took the time to spread the word and/or donated to the cause.

Though we didn’t make our full goal of $5K, I think we did pretty darned well.

Keep up on what’s going on or send folks over to the blog

Thanks again!

story:
The Project

“Health is a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being, and not merely the absence of disease or infirmity.”

The World Health Organization

Imagine a world where feeling good, being healthy and living a happy life is normal. Now with the right knowledge it is possible for all of us to have this future because proper nutrition and some minor lifestyle changes can make it possible.

This book is a comprehensive guide to Total Health which is achieved when the mind, brain, and body are in a state of balance that allows the body to prevent or cure disease and disorder. It examines the science of the mind, nutrition, and health and its relationship to personal development, human behavior, and emotional well-being.

Filled with sound scientific evidence from more than 25 years of research conducted by the Global Peace Project and more than 150 years of work by the world's leading minds in science and medicine, Total Health Solutions will shatter your perception of what it means to live a happier, healthier, wealthier life and give you the knowledge, understanding, and power to change your life for the better forever. 

The lies propagated by the Food Industrial Complex, the Medical Industrial Complex, the FDA, and the media are exposed. You will learn the truth about what it takes to break the hypnotic trances that block your ability to achieve total health, wealth, and happiness. You will see how we are captive to the global chemical, food, and drug industries and how we are addicted to dangerous chemicals, food additives, and pharmaceutical drugs that promote disease and death.

The human race has suffered for 10,000 years from chronic malnutrition. This book teaches you why and how we are deficient in nearly every essential nutrient we need to sustain life and provides proof, based in part on the research findings of a group of scientists and medical experts known as the "Miracle Men" who’s findings are featured in the 1936 U.S. Senate Document 264 and the research of Dr. Abram Hoffer and two-time Nobel Prize winner Dr. Linus Pauling who declared that all human disease and disorders are caused by mineral deficiencies.

My research reveals the link between lifestyle behavior and brain damage for people suffering from substance abuse, chronic stress, and obesity. You will see the biological links between stress and disease and you will understand the nature of what scientists are calling the second brain in our digestive system. The saturated fat/low fat myth and the vegetarian myth are debunked and the truth about fad diets is examined, explaining why virtually all weight loss efforts fail, and the enormous health benefits of meditation, visualization, and yoga are explored. 

The nature of the subconscious mind and the role it plays in the hypnotic trances that control our health and well-being in our daily life is explained and I show you how your thoughts can change your genes, create disease and emotional disorders. The power of the placebo effect and the mind's incredible ability to heal the body, the brain, and achieve meaningful success in life is revealed.

Who am I? 

I am Michael Locklear, since 1986 I have been the President of the Global Peace Project, a 501(c)(3) educational scientific corporation. During this time I have conducted more than 25 years of research focusing on the creation of a new farming system that would help to alleviate poverty, hunger, and improve the health of people living around the world. 

I have written more than 200 articles on health, nutrition, meditation, the mind, and alternative medicine. I am recognized as an environmentalist, agriculturalist and human rights activist. I am a member of the Southern Poverty Law Center and my name appears on their Wall of Tolerance in recognition of my work on human rights. I've been a member of and worked with numerous organizations including the United Nations Association, The Natural Resources Defense Council, Earth Day International, Heifer International, The American Civil Liberties Union, Amnesty International, and the Health Sciences Institute, just to name a few. I was listed in Who is Who in Service to the Earth in 1991. I am  Certified in Neuro Associative Conditioning by Tony Robbins and the Robbins Research Institute. 

If you would like, you may read some of my expert articles which are available at selfgrowth.com. You can also read more of my work by visiting my website naturalremediesfortotalhealth.com.

Who Will Benefit From This Book?

Total Health Solutions is for everyone who has ever dreamed of being happy, healthy, and living a rich and fulfilling life. Everyone who's tried to change their life and failed because they hit a wall of resistance within themselves and everyone who has suffered with fear, depression, loneliness, fatigue, poor health, failed relationships, obesity, diabetes, heart disease, cancer, and a wide range of emotional, spiritual, and health issues will benefit from this project.  I wish I could've had a book like this 40 years ago when I first started to deal with my own personal challenges and the social, emotional, and health issues of the people I've dedicated my life to serving. 

Most of the information available on the subject of optimal health, personal success and well-being is false and misleading and the truth about the real health crises has been kept from the public for more than 100 years. It's almost impossible for people who need the correct information and solutions to find them. Although this knowledge has been known for a very long time it has been hidden from all of us who suffer and need it the most. 

Where Will Your Money Go?

Your financial support is needed to finish the writing and to hire an editor, public relations support, and a designer to create the cover and the poster. The potential of this book to benefit the lives of millions of people means that it must not be allowed to fail. I desire to see this book become a bestseller since that would reach and benefit the greatest number of people. 

This project will take about six months to bring to completion and be published in both electronic and physical form. Your support will be making an enormous contribution to yourself and countless others. 

How To Contribute

If you are able to, please pledge to support this project and help make it a reality. On the right of the screen, you'll find a range of pledges from $5 to $10,000, with different rewards for each. To pledge to this project, just click the red “Contribute Now” button on this page. You will be asked to enter your pledge amount and select a reward. From there, you will go through the Amazon checkout process. If the project is successfully funded, your card will be charged when the project reaches its funding deadline.

In addition to your financial contribution please help spread the word!

Email your friends asking them to check out this IndieGogo page or the website: naturalremediesfortotalhealth.com

Share this IndieGogo page on your Facebook wall or Twitter

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Of course the biggest risk in publishing a book is writing a good book and marketing it using the best practices known and available. To offset these issues we will hire and form strategic alliances with top book promotion experts such as Kathleen Gage, Steve Harrison, Jack Canfield, Brian Tracy or Susan Harrow; there are several to choose from. This will provide us with a significant advantage. All of these experts have a proven track record for producing best selling authors.

We will also use Twitter, Facebook, Self Growth.com and other social media sites to announce and market this project. We have our own website NaturalRemediesForTotalHealth.com to assist us as well. We will self-publish so we don't have to find a publisher which will speed up the process considerably and allow us to control the final outcome.

We have over 25 years experience in researching complex issues and I have published over 200 articles and webpages based on our health and human behavior research. I am a recognized expert in the field.

The bulk of the research work for this project is done. We will hire a top editor and designer to insure the best possible presentation for the book. With the help of the best people available to us we can overcome all the issues that may arise and complete this project on time and reach best seller status in a reasonable time-frame.

story:
Project Summary: kanere.org

Kanere newspaper is based in Kakuma refugee camp, advocating for refugee rights. Kakuma has existed for over 20 years and houses nearly 120,000 refugees, with many waiting over 15 years for resettlement. Located in the remote desert, life is tough and opportunities are scarce. Started by exiled journalists, Kanere is an independent refugee-run newspaper that advocates for refugee rights, which are in short supply. Kanere's achievements are extensive, its resources are not. Kanere: 

  • Provides a window into refugee life for the world outside of Kakuma, advocating for improving the plight of refugees globally
  • Advocates for refugee rights in Kakuma, which has led to improved refugee services, water access, security and many other camp improvements
  • Provides training and opportunities for journalists and youth
  • Shares information between camp residents, raising awareness about current issues, promoting social cohesion and inspiring refugees

This campaign is to raise money to support Kanere in their push to achieve a better deal for refugees. The Kanere team is hard working, passionate and inspirational, despite their lack of resources. They have one old laptop (most work is on paper), erratic electricity/internet, no office and they all work on a voluntary basis. This is where you step in - a small amount of money goes a long way in Kakuma. Please support Kanere so they can improve their advocacy for refugee rights and improve the lives of Kakuma residents and refugees globally.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $7000, it will:

  • Build a fully equipped, solar powered office for Kanere
  • Enable the purchase of 2 laptops, a printer and other production materials
  • Cover transport, communication and publishing costs for the next year
  • Support the Kanere team to dedicate more time to the newspaper, creating new opportunities and professionalising the organisation

In return, supporters will:

  • Be supporting the voices and rights of refugees globally
  • Help to improve the lives of nearly 120,000 refugees in Kakuma
  • Receive exclusive, professional photos for donations of a certain size

 

What makes Kanere unique?

  • It's the only independent refugee-run newspaper based in a refugee camp
  • All funds go directly to the project: no head office, no admin, no advertising
  • Established and run by refugees, not a charity project
  • It creates hope, empowerment and opportunities for some of the world's most vulnerable people
  • Kanere is by refugees for refugees

Other Ways You Can Help

Kanere is established, efficient and effective. It really needs funding. Otherwise:

  • Spread the word about Kanere, building its readership and opportunities to advocate for refugee rights
  • Get involved with refugee and asylum seeker projects locally
  • Lobby your Government to increase support for refugees
